iniquitie printed h denham praier vpon poſie prefixed almightie god moſt mercifull father mercie haſt ordeined theſe lamp thy choſen virgin commanded loines girt lamp burning bright ſhould take heed readie execute charge committed vnto v watch full warilie continuallie ſeuerall calling feruent inſtant praier comming thy ſonne ſpirituall spouſe ſouereigne lord ſweet sauiour iesvs giuing v meane ſeaſon diuerſe gift talent occupie imploie till come ſetting dailie eies iuſt iudgement ſhall execute giue dreadfull daie ſudden comming vpon quicke dead doo thou vouchſafe euen thine owne ſelfe praie thee gird compaſſe ioines iniquitie haue power ouer v decline bow anie ſinne oh ſuffer v take contentation vaine delight pleaſure anie thing wretched world may lull bring v faſt aſleepe curſed cradle ſenſeleſſe ſecuritie fooliſh virgin neglect houre daie laſt viſitation forget wait attend thine appearing cloud ſo direct v beſeech thee ſhort race perilous pilgrimage thy holie ſpirit heauenlie loadeſman lawfull vſe thy good gift whatſoeuer beſtowed vpon v cheefeſt care may alwaies depart iniquitie wee may liue ſoberlie ſelues holilie thee vprightlie world thereby gaine much profit fruit better increaſe thy kingdome moreouer make thou lampes burne cleere bright ſight men angel keepe thou light euer burning loue towards thee wax neuer key cold charitie towards neighbour quite extinguiſhed yet faith deuotion zeale gift ſpirit vtterlie quenched v euermore within without kindled inlightened inflamed thee art conſuming fire purifieng flame vnſpeakable feruent heate let thought word work alwaies directed doo thy holie righteous iudgements work begun continued ended thee may euer glorifie thy holie reuerent name finallie make v verie carefullie keepe caſtle ſoules temple holie ghoſt body meane pure holie vndefiled watch continuallie maner well dooing vnto end thy sonne heauenlie bridegroome ſhall come iudge world condemne wicked reiect reprobate caſt awaie vnprofitable ſhut gate heauen againſt vnbeleeuers retchleſſe virgin finding v heedfull watchfull praieng well occupied readie thoſe haue beene verie well content eſtates time hauing lamp filled brim gleaner grape gatherer reſtleſſe ruth go maiden harueſt gleane gather mother naomi certeine handful corne reaper painfull labourer among ſheaues let fall deuotion fruitfull feelds charitable boaz haue aſſailed well perceiue repleniſh wine preſſe grape lord plentifull vintage fill lampes brimfull oile god good bleſſing rich ſtore left behind wiſe virgin holie veſſels increaſe therefore might ſo bold without offenſe name foreſaid bleſſed boaz would gladlie exhort perſuade ruth hir godlie woman ſimple ſort followe good counſell ſaith heare daughter go none feeld gather neither depart hence gleane abide maiden let thine eies feeld doo reape go thou maiden thou art athirſt go alſo veſſels drinke ſeruants handmaid haue drawne thou art hungrie come hither eate bread dip thy morſell vineger ſit reaper thou ſhalt ſatiſfied full leaſt ſhould gather anie method order diuiſion title direction application ſhall find booke anie part therof go nicelie curiouſlie ſtrictlie inioine obſerue hour day feaſts time ſeaſons bind vnlawfullie impoſſibilitie neceſſitie vſe euerie theſe praiers meditation place maner forme ſet downe although wiſhed moſt part might poſſible neceſſities turbulent life would permit ſhould miſtake ſaie iudge purpoſe anie reſpect hinder common praier interrupt miniſtration word ſacraments church time knowe ought glorifie god together one hart ſpirit mouth otherwiſe occupied might conuenientlie ſerue godlie deſires glorie god confuſion ſathan owne eternall comfort chriſt ieſus referring notwithſtanding ſhall find proper church vſed onelie conuenient time ordinance church lawfullie permitted reſt priuate vſed elſewhere diſcretions ſo often opportunitie ſhall ſerue god ſpirit heauenlie motion giue anie occaſion would haue thinke hereby ſelfe doo reſpects obſerue order preſcribed although aſſure ſtriue doo either within booke without repent bottome hart often omiſſion time paſt ſo wiſh good reader chriſtianlie haue conſecrated vowed giue ſelues holie exerciſe lord ſaie mercie ſhall giue grace leiſure time occaſion ſuffer tired anie worldlie neceſſitie name feare god obſerue order method forme direction word dooth allow knowe beſt keepe continuall faith feare fauour god truſt little together call theſe ten memorable thing chriſtian remembrance ſo holie exerciſe firſt commandements almightie god himſelfe conſideration owne great miſerie neceſſitie common lacke chriſtian congregation hath willed v call vpon ſaieng praie alwaies maner praiers ſupplications ſpirit watch therevnto perſeuerance secondlie moſt ſweet comfortable promiſes made gratiouſlie heare grant godlie lawfull requeſts ſaieng aske ye ſhall haue ſeeke ye ſhall find knocke ſhall opened vnto euerie one calleth vpon name lord departeth iniquitie ſhall ſaued c thirdlie great manifold ſinnes whereof guiltie ſuffer v ſit ſtill without care briueth v neceſſitie beg moſt gratious pardon fourthlie feeble fleſh weake nature vnable euerie reſpect doo anie good thing requireth continuall praier aid ſtrength fiftlie wilie ſubtiltie ſpirituall enimie ſathan priuilie lurketh inward part waiting euen beſt action trip ouerthrowe v againſt muſt feruent praier vehementlie ſtriue sixtlie owne greeuous aſſalts cruell temptation neuer giue v truce reſt quietneſſe haſten v verie much vnto god helpe seuenthlie zeale glorie god aduancement kingdome ought wholie drawe moone v continuallie exerciſe ſelues ſeruice god eightlie dailie danger continuall calamity hourelie hang ouer head giue v cauſe enough yea euen moſt holie ſighs grones continuallie flie vnto god heauenlie father call vpon feruent praiers ninthlie infinite benefit great bleſſings god ſo bountifullie plentifullie euerie waie powred continuallie vpon v giue v ample matter iuſt occaſion hourelie thankeſgiuing euen bottome hart praiſe magnifie ſame tenthlie laſtlie great excellencie woorthineſſe neceſſitie vertue fruit profit true chriſtian praier conſiſting partlie dignitie god commander partlie effect obteining whatſoeuer aſke according theſe thing ſaie good reader well conſidered ſuppoſe ſaie nothing ſuperfluous little enough ſo needfull profitable exerciſe faith praier meane wherein peace conſcience yea whole ſaluation conſiſteth whereby god himſelfe ſaid preſent v onelie prouidence watch ouer v alſo power ſuſteine ſuccour v goodneſſe mercie receiue v fatherlie grace fauour yea doubt willinglie confeſſe ſaie ſorts deuout woman haue great cauſe continuallie take theſe lamp hand thereby either vaniſhed hagar acknowledge god grace towards deſolate naomi praie god would bleſſe child preſeruation gratious gouernour queene elizabeth church faithfull ſoule chriſtians long kiſſes peace chriſt ſpirituall ſpouſe neuer ceaſe daie night ſeeke ſoule loueth till praier meditation haue hazarding owne liues alſo need ſo require owne preſeruation people ſubiects ſafetie deliuerance hand cruell haman ſeditious conſpirators chaſt innocent suſanna appeale god high iudge iudges acquitted violeut death falſe accuſation vniuſt condeinuation afflicted church exile acknowledge ſinnes call mercie deliuered diſtreſſe woman canaan flie vnto chriſt neceſſities releeued bodilie ghoſtlie moſt gratious souereigne ladie queene elizabeth muſe diuinelie inward loue ſoule towards chriſt ſpouſe lord father mother brother vertuous ladie queene katherine vewaile ignorance blind life led anne aſkew marryr praie hartilie enimies maiſter bradford mother petitioner vnto god conſtancie faith death child miſtreſſe dorcas alarten carefullie inſtruct whole familie principall point chriſtian thanks ſo often mightie maruellous preſeruation deliuerance ſo manie kind danger yea death deſtruction pretended ſathan bloudie miniſters dailie againſt finallie godlie woman taking hereby good occaſion theſe holie foremother continuallie make petition preuenting euils ſupplications obteining thing needfull ſoule bodie interceſſions well others themſelues thankſgiuings corporall ſpiritual benefit receiued may ſhew themſelues daughter woorthie ſuch mother virgin woorthie ſuch lamp perpetuall virginitie woman woorthie ſuch ghoſtlie weapon right chriſtian miniſtration helpe weakeneſſe praiers precept meditation meane following vertues wiſelie perfect feare god bearing ſame hand hart carefullie due obedience prince fighting therewith golgatha field ſpirituall warfare good fight faith couragiouſlie pure loue countrie chriſtian charirie towards neighbour laſt world come glorie god euerlaſting comfort togither wiſe virgin elect people god ioifullie triumph ouer weakneſſe infirmitie corruption yea ouer ſinne death hell damnation ſaie oh death thy ſting oh hell thy victorie wading ſo far argument praier making bolume ſo big ante ſhall thinke ſaic mine idleneſſe time thus ſpent verie chargeable vnto conſidering plentie prater book portable alreadie extant ſhall iudge haue taken verie needleſſe bootleſſe trauell haue laboured vaine ſpent ſtrength nothing would addeſtars ſkie light lampe noone daie therefore ſhall deeme woorthie opinion looſe oleum operam oh forgiue wrong praie conſidering could otherwiſe either ſatiſfie ſelfe go forward determined purpoſe according preſcript order collection pleaſure ſimple reader ſuch plentie varietie profitable matter eſpeciallie ſo good paper faire vſuall letter thing aged feeble ſighted reader verie gratefull much deſired let intreate whoſoeuer meaſure ſame rather goodneſſe content godlie neuer haue enough bigneſſe deereneſſe volume willing deſirous mind euer beſt cheape doubt ſhall pleaſure profit one leaſt counteruaile far ſurmount paine charge ſelfe good reader haue rudelie ſee vndertaken great labour proteſt haue doone neither preſumption would vſurpe office diuine intrude himſelfe ſtudies profeſſions arrogancie would boaſt make great brag men labour enuie went make fruſtrate inſufficient painfull godlie work better learned neither yet ambition vaineglorie gaped praiſe commendation anie would faine ſeeme approoued regiſtred anie chronicler author one knoweth ſomewhat deed knowes nothing much leſſe deſerues thought aboue anie either owne knowledge true report doo ſhall ſee knowe heare therefore ſaie good reader iudgement howſoeuer pleaſe others iudge mine intent herein knowe lord formed wombe ſeruant eie witneſſe mine integritie ſimple meaning herein ſaie life hid made manifeſt doo line muſt die worke ſo honourable verie author ſo godlie matter ſo neceſſarie time ſo profitable perſons ſo excellent vſe ſo conuenient increaſe pietie chriſtianitie ſimpler ſort howſoeuer otherwiſe ſome carping head euill diſpoſed reader aeſops dog manger neuer giuen either doo well themſelues iudge rightlie ſpeake truth others right well aſſured god firſt put mind take hand onelie confeſſe humble hartie thankeſgiuing manie yeeres fore trauell ſtudie much ſweet long watching great expences haue length finiſhed ſame truſt glorie profit mine owne comfort therefore leauing euerie woorthie work godlie men woman howſoeuer elſewhere extant particular vſe church god publiſhed honourable author themſelues due deſerued praiſe perpetuall commendation poſteritie exhortation godlie chriſtians reuerentlie willinglie thankfullie read receiue imbrace ſame wherein better fulfilling ſo heauenlie exerciſe faith moſt agreeable god good word perfectlie ſupplied accompliſhed rare gift ornament grace holie ghoſt compiler whatſoeuer otherwiſe ignorance wanteth perhaps alſo good reader vnlearned giue therefore giue ſaie woorthilie fruit owne hand let owne work praiſe world conclude humbly ſubmit ſelfe vnto graue iudgements godlie learned mine heroicall author liuing meeklie craue pardon bold enterpriſe attempted baſhfulneſſe doubtfulneſſe feare become writer ſo learned age trouble ſtudies rude labour laſtlie offer theſe labour ſuch vnto good liking fauourable correction well matter maner right chriſtian learned reader full recompenſe ſatiſfaction anie fruit either ſimpler ſort ſhall hereby reape onelie make requeſt dutifullie reuerence diuine work ſo noble learned author whoſe holie trauels perceine ſelues enioie moſt ineſtimable benefit ſo freendlie take good part theſe firſt fruit poore ſtudies proceeding well meaning mind built vpon ſo good foundation hee could though ought benefit hurt offend none lamp well eſteemed opinion rich vertue knowledge gratefullie accepted approoued learneder ſort monument ſo famous matrones may yet leaſt ſakes become welcome approoued ſimple chriſtians meanes greatlie incouraged go forward vertuous ſtudies benefit countrie hartie thankeſgiuing vnto god mercie great curteſie goodneſſe towards bid farewell vnto whoſe heauenlie defenſe almightie protection diuine fauour continuall bleſſing finallie commend betake theſe labour ſelfe deere welbeloued reader beſeeching loue loue vnfainedlie ſpeake worke woorſe doo chriſtianlie ſake alone loued v moſt deerelie loue v endured maner reproch ſlanders might moſt patientlie euen effuſion moſt pretious bloud often ſundrie time trulie well feruent praier ſweat otherwiſe croſſe eternall glorie therefore ineſtimable benefit bloudie praiers dririe death bitter paſſion euermore rendred giuen writer reader ſo angel men creature heauen earth deepe poſſible praiſe perpetuall glorie hart thinke hand worke toong ſpeake amen owne owne euer thomas bentley facies militantis eccleſiae iam propè ſexagies redijt centeſimus annus quùm laeſo aeternum ſeruans ſub pectore vulnus incenſis animis gerit implacabile bellum cum ſerpentino muliéris ſemine ſemen nam pater omnipotens nec iam pater improbus ex quo seduxit ſerpens primo errore parentes nullus amor natis dixit nec foedera ſunto exoriare aliquis pura de virgine vindex cuius dextra caput ſerpentis conterat cui iratus ſerpens leniter calcanea tundat nunc olim ſtirpem pono genus omne futurum exercendum odijs vtrin que que impero tolli infeſtas aquila aquilis contraria pilis pila ala ali ſigna minantia ſignis haec deus ex illo ſtruere malè nectere ſerpens arte dolos coepit belli que opponere molem nulla quies aetas quae tempore fluxit ab illo militia eſt hoſtis factum iam grande periclis ingenium longo creuit ſolertia bello effrendét que draco ruber immortalibus iris crudelis reparát que nouas praelia vires audet à nobis ſumptis confligere telis nam peccatorum benè quae numerantur ab illo vel numero miſeras anima vel pondere terret tunc aptè mortem peccati oſtendere ſtipem tunc ſtygias turmas totúm que acheronta ciere promptus hijs hominem petit exitialibus armis non par lex huius non ius aequabile pugnae no ſumus terris eſt coeleſtibus hoſtis non pede congreditur pe denſúſ que viro vir sed micat tenebris ſpiritualibus armis vtitur nocet non vult nocuiſſe videri improbus infligit vulnus ne que vulneris author extat ſic pugnat ſic eſt metuendus abaddon adde alios hoſtes quos intùs habemus extrà hinc caro no blandis odijs affabilis hoſtis enecat leni peccati imbuta veneno strangulat incluſas anima conficit intùs extrà alias ſcelerum face diráſ que cohortes et coniuratum cernas obſiſtere mundum quacun que aſpicimus timor vndique vndique terror infernae que ruunt acies praedám que requirunt chriſticolas quem da finem rex magne laborum no tua progeny coeli quibus annuis arcem perdimur ac coeli longè diſiungimur oris haec eſt illa fides potis eſt quae vincere mundum inferni que fore sic no ſceptra reponis ollis ſubridens chriſtus qui cuncta ſerenat oſcula libauit natis dein talia fatus nata deo prole ex viui ſemine verbi multum dilecta mihi dilecta parenti moeſtáne per tantos ſemper iactabere fluctus nec quae ſit tua ſpes quae ſit victoria noris tu ſathanam tu tela time ignita gehennae eſto tuos quondam potuit ſuperare parentes nec dum animo exciderint irae ſaeuó que dolores et veteres verſet fraudes ac pectora tentet atque omne ſecum phlegetonta praelia ducat idcircóne tuo poteris diffidere chriſto nec venit mentem quam crux ferat alma ſalutem ille vides leo terribilis quique omnia ſaeuus circuit immanis rugit praedámque futuram faucibus expectat ſiccis quem peſſima ventris exigit impranſum rabies exutus inermis cruce confoſſus iacet en victor leo iudae inferni fregit porta contudit omnes peccati vires mortem morte peremit haecſpolia aeterna lauros ex hoſte reporto ecce deum ſummum medijs eſt cernere terris coelis hominem tibi ſeſe aeterna reſeruant gaudia cum ſuperis homini benè conuenit actum eſt viciſti pepigit cum terra foedera coelum iam cherubinorum vagina includitur enſis atque iterum tibi ſe tradit paradiſus habendum námque ego quem gremio tellus abſorpſit iniquo vincula perrupi mortis coelúmque petiui et cupis hijs mecum pariter conſidere regnis regnum quod teneo veſtrum eſt hîc meta laborum iudáque génſque mihi nullo diſcrimine agétur pugnat adhuc ſathanas confert agmina pugnet iuſti materiem praebet tibi pugna triumphi per varios caſus per multa pericula rerum tenditur coelum ſedes vbi fata quietas oſtendunt illic fa laeta pace potiri durato temet rebus ſeruato ſecundis sic placitum dum te pieta excocta periclis splendeat viua formetur imagine chriſtus tempus erit quùm paucis labentibus annis cernes denſis venientem nubibus quùm regnabis mecum victo dominaberis hoſti tu modò poſce deum veniam ſacrisque litatis arma aſſume dei cauſáſ que innecte morandi bona ſimplicitas animi tibi baltheus eſto quo ſtes contra ictus omnes circundata lumbos indue iuſtitiae thoracem pectora muni tum pro calceolis coeleſtis nuncia pacis aptato pedibus certis ſuper omnia viuae sume manu ſcutum fidei galeámque ſalutis spem capiti imponas laterique accingere ferrum spirituale pares hoſtem ſtringe rebellem quicquid aduerſum verbo eſt interfice verbo sic vbi iam mundi decurſa volubilis aetas poſt exantlatae diuerſa pericula pugnae non areſcentis folijs redimita corona foelix coeleſtem patriam hieroſolyma cernes dixerat extemplo moeſtos attollere vultus coepit afflictis laetari eccleſia rebus infuſó que oleo manibus ſua lumen portans praeſto lánſque ſuum patiens laeta maritum vota deo ſupplex animo ſolennia fundit l rob marbeck ad lectorem avſcultat noſtris diuina potentia votis et prece non pretio flectitur ira dei perlege ſcripturas ſancta volumina patrum aſſiduis precibus no vigilare iubent si malè te morbus proſtratis viribus vrat si te paupertas inuidioſa premat per ſteriles ſaltus per dura inhoſpita ſaxa paſſibus ambiguis ſi vel inermis ea si mare te iacter ſi tempeſtatibus actus et coelum terras mox ruitura putes si te circunſtet vel mille pericula mortis inuoca nil dubitans numen ſaluus eris ergo ſi precibus vi tanta putetur ineſſe praeponi precibus nil mihi crede poteſt hic labor hic liber eſt tibi quem bentlēius offert nil aliud reſonans quàm pietate preces et pius eſt author pius conatus vtrun que cur perames cauſam candide lector habes argumentum libri vin tibi quid portent haec ſcire volumina ſeptem occurrunt animo lumen ſparſa tuo nulla quidem fruſtra eſt praelata virgine lampas oſtendit varias illá que illa preces prima docet myriam quas olim debora fudit 1 quas domino iudith fudit aanna preces altera reginis quas noſtratibus vſquam 2 legimus medijs incaluiſſe mali hîc katherina ſuas mulieribus aemula ſanctis hîc cernit princeps elizabetha ſuas tertia habet pſalmos quos pro ſolamine noſtrae reginae docti compoſuere viri 3 hîc modo de noſtri loquitur moderamine regni excipit hîc votum principis ore deus quarta alias fusè complectitur omnibus aptas perſonis rebus temporibúſ que preces 4 quinta precum formas narrat quas foemina quaeuis seu virgo fuerit ſiue marita legat 5 sexta locos recitat ſacris e fontibus hauſtos 6 poſſit vt officium foemina ſcire ſuum continet hiſtorias illarum ſeptima quarum vel bona vita fuit vel mala vita fuit 7 hinc saram propone tibi caſtám que rebeccam et ſubeat menti ſancta maria tuae illinc ante oculos infamis iezabel adſit occurrát que tibi labe notata thamar sic exempla pares illuſtria turpia vites hiſtoriae fructus maximus ille ſacrae interea bentlaee tuo de lumine lumen qui facis accenſum fratribus eſſe tuis hîc aeterna pij cernis monumenta laboris hîc zeli laus eſt non peritura tui l breefe learned woman conſideration referring ſuch deſire knowe ſeuerall work treatiſe following geſnerus bale ludouicus viues chronicle ſuch writer time haue doone like sycophant currie fauour flatterie woman ſimplie god witneſſe good purpoſe partlie well perceiue theſe manie named well deſeruing excellent work taſt wherof haue booke haue heretofore beene right woorthilie great veneration godlie learned father writer age therfore leſſe v alſo reuerentlie regarded honourable remembrance perpetuall recordation continuance heroicall name fame ſome inrollment condigne praiſes memorable dooings poſterities eſpeciallie might hereby much lieth incourage prouoke allure godlie woman time ſome meaſure according ſeueral gift giuen god become euen youth ſtudious imitator diligent folowers ſo godlie rare example vertuous mother either ſex name eſtate equall ſo learning wiſedome good induſtrie holie ſtudies vertuous exerciſes commendable woman would dailie endeuour themſelues become like ſo lightened good example life doctrine may ſhine alſo together earth burning lampes verie virginitie heauen bright ſtarres eternall glorie god owne name ſake grant amen vvhat ceremonie euerie woman ought god word vſe time praier publike priuate 1 corinth chapter ii verſe 4 c everle man praieng propheſieng hauing anie thing head diſhonoureth god head euerie woman praieth propheſieth bare headed diſhonoureth hir husband hir head euen one verie thing though ſhe ſhauen therefore woman couered let hir alſo ſhorne ſhame woman ſhorne polled deed ſhame let hir couered keepe hir haire truſſed vp vnder kercher man ought couer head ought polled bare ſomuch image glorie god maiestie power dooth ſhine concerning authoritie ouer wife god creature ſubiected vnder dominion rule woman glorie man receiueth hir glorie commendation man therefore ſubiect man woman woman man neither man created woman ſake woman man ſake therefore ought woman haue power hir head ſome thing couer hir head ſigne ſubiection bicauſe angel alſo ſhew diſſolution ſhame onelie christ church congregation praie iudge ſelues alſo comelie woman praie vnto god bare headed dooth nature ſelfe teach man haue long haire like woman ſhame vnto woman haue long haire praiſe vnto hir hir haire giuen vnto hir couering end ſhe ſhould truſſe vp hir head declare ſhe must couer hir head anie man list contentious haue ſuch custome neither church god ¶ firſt lampe virginitie conteining diuine praiers hymnes song made ſundrie holie woman scripture ſomething explaned hardeſt place better vnderſtanding edifieng vnlearned reader firſt praier hagar handmaid sarai ſhe made hir trouble baniſhment wherein ſhe rebuketh hir owne dulneſſe acknowledgeth god grace preſent hir eueriewhere geneſis 16 13 thou god lookeſt haue alſo looked ſeeth ſong thankeſgiuing moſes myriam propheteſſe ſiſter aaron together woman ſang vpon timbrel praiſe god people iſraëls deliuerance hand pharao c exodus 15 1 sing ye vnto lord hath triumphed gloriouſlie horſe rider hath ouer throwne ſea lord ſtrength praiſe become ſaluation god glorifie hee father god exalt lord man war iehouah name battell ſtil ouer commeth euer mindfull promiſe pharaos chariot hoſt hath hee caſt ſea choſen captaines alſo drowned red ſea deepe water haue couered ſunke bottome ſtone thy right hand lord become glorious power thy right hand lord hath daſhed enimie thy great glorie thou haſt ouerthrowne roſe vp againſt thee thou ſenteſt foorth thy wrath conſumed ſtubble blaſt thy noſtrils water gathered together fluds ſtood ſtill heape deep water congealed together hart depth ſea enimie ſaid purſue ouertake diuide ſpoile luſt ſhall ſatiſfied vpon drawe ſword mine hand ſhall deſtroie thou didſt blowe thy winde ſea couered ſanke led mightie water like vnto thee lord among god mightie men world like thee ſo glorious holineſſe fearefull praiſes ſhewing woonders thou ſtretcheſt thy right hand earth ſwalowed thou thy mercie haſt caried people thou haſt redeemed deliuered thou wilt bring thy ſtrength vnto thine holie habitation land canaan mount zion people nation ſhall heare afraid ſorowe ſhall come vpon inhabitant paleſtina duke edomites ſhall amazed trembling ſhall come vpon great mightieſt men moabites inhabitant canaan ſhall waxe faint harted feare dread ſhall fall vpon bicauſe greatnes thine arme power ſhall ſtill ſtone till thy people paſſe lord till people paſſe thou haſt gotten purchaſed thou ſhalt bring plant mountaine thine inheritance mount zion place lord thou haſt made prepared dwell euen ſanctuarie lord thine hand ſhall eſtabliſh lord ſhall reigne euer euer pharao horſebacke went chariot horſemen ſea lord brought water ſea vpon child iſrael went drieland mids ſea sing ye therefore vnto lord hath triumphed gloriouſlie horſe rode vpon hath ouerthrowne ſea ſong thankeſgiuing deborah barak victorie giuen god hand iaël againſt siſera iudges 5 2 praiſe ye lord auenging iſrael people zabulon nepthali offred themſelues gladly became ſo willing reſiſt enimies heare ye king harken ye prince euen ſing vnto lord ſing praiſe vnto lord god iſrael lord thou wenteſt seir thou departedſt field edom earth trembled heauens rained cloud alſo dropped water mountaines melted lord euen sinai lord god iſrael day samgar ſome anath day iael high way vnoccupied feare enimies trauellers walked byway townes inhabited decaied ſay inhabitant thereof gone iſrael vntill deborah came vp miraculouſly mooued god pitie deliuer roſe vp mother iſrael choſe new god war enimie gate ſhield ſpeare ſeene among fortie thouſand iſrael hart reſiſt enimies hart ſet gouernours iſrael loueth willing among people praiſe yee lord speake yee gouernours ride faire aſſe sor moiles yee dwell middin danger enimies walke way noiſe archer among drawer water ceaſed ſhall rehearſe righteouſneſſe lord righteouſneſſe vnfenced townes iſrael people lord go downe gate without feare enimie debora vp ariſe ſing ſong ariſe barak lead thy captiuitie kept thy people bondage captiuitie captiue thou ſonne abinoam remaine haue dominion ouer mightie people lord hath giuen mee dominion ouer ſtrong ephraun roote ioſua firſt aroſe fought againſt amalek thee ioſua beniamin saule ſhall fight againſt thy people amalek machir came ruler zebulun handle penne writer euen learned helpe fight prince iſſachar debora whole tribe iſſachar alſo barak ſent foote vallie diuiſions ruben great thought hart abodeſt thou among ſheepfolds heare bleatings flock diuiſions ruben came ouer iordan helpe brother neceſſitie great thought hart much maruelling gilead abode beyond iordan yet came helpe brother therefore thou ruben canſt haue excuſe doth dan remaine ſhips aſher continued ſea ſhore taried deſolate decaied place people zebulun nepthalie haue ieoparded liues vnto death hie place field king came fought fought king chanaan taanach water megiddo wan monie loſt fought heauen euen ſtarres courſes fought againſt siſera god power people holpen ouer come enimies riuer kiſhon ſwept away béeſome doth filth houſe ancient riuer riuer kiſhon ſoule thou haſt marched valiantly horſe hoofes broken praunſing oft beating together mightie men curſe ye citie meros ye fought ſaid angel lord curſe inhabitant thereof bicauſe came helpe lord helpe lord againſt mightie iael wife heber kenite ſhall bleſſed aboue woman bleſſed ſhall ſhe aboue woman dwelling tent aſked water ſhe gaue milke ſhe brought foorth butter lordlie diſh put hir hand naile hir right hand workman hammer hammer ſmote ſhe siſera ſhe ſmote head ſhe wounded perſed temple bowed downe hir feete fell downe lay ſtill hir feete bowed himſelfe downe fell ſunk downe lay dead deſtroied mother siſera looked windowe cried lattiſe chariot ſo long comming tarie wheeles chariot hir wiſe lady anſwered hir yea ſhe anſwered comforted hir ſelfe hir owne word surely haue gotten found diuide ſpoile euerie man hath damſell two siſera hath praie diuers coloured garment euen praie raiment died ſundrie colour made needle worke raiment diuers colour needle worke ſides meete chiefe diſtributing ſpoiles let thine enimies periſh lord loue ſhall ſunne hee riſeth might growe dailie god fauour land reſt fortie yeeres praier bleſſing naomy hir two daughter lawe ruth orpah ruth 1 8 9 lord ſhew fauour deale kindlie good daughter yee haue dealt dead huſbands two ſonnes mee yea lord grant may find reſt either houſe hir huſband praier vow hanna ſonne 1 samuel 1 11 lord hoſts thou wilt looke trouble thine handmaid remember mee forget thine handmaid giue vnto thine handmaid manchild giue vnto lord day life ſhall raſor come vpon head ſong thankeſgiuing hanna ſhe praier obteined ſonne called samuel 1 samuel 2 mine hart reioiceth lord mine horne exalted lord haue recouered ſtrength glorie benefit mouth inlarged wide open ouer mine enimies ſo anſwere reprooue barrenneſſe reioice thy ſaluation none holie lord yea none beſides thee god like god speake preſumptuouſlie againſt god condemning barrenneſſe let arrogancie come mouth lord god knowledge purpoſes come paſſe enterpriſes eſtabliſhed bowe mightie men broken weake haue girded themſelues ſtrength full hired foorth bread ſell labour neceſſarie foode hungrie hired ceaſe haue néede ſo barren hath borne ſeuen euen many ſhee many child waren feeble lord killeth maketh aliue bringeth downe graue raiſeth vp againe lord maketh poore maketh rich bringeth lowe exalteth vp high raiſeth vp poore duſt according owne lifteth vp begger dunghill ſet among prince make inherit ſeate glorie pillers earth lord hath ſet world vpon therefore may diſpoſe thing pleaſure prefer honour keepe feete saint ſo ſhall neither walke fall euill wicked ſhall keepe ſilence darkeneſſe owne might ſhall man ſtrong lord aduerſaries ſhall deſtoried heauen ſhall thunder vpon ye lord ſhall iudge end world ſhall giue power vnto king ieſus exalt horne chriſt annointed ſong woman iſraël praiſe dauids victorie ouer goliah 1 samuel 18 7 saule hath ſlaine thouſand dauid ten thouſand praier wiſh abigaël king dauid againſt enimies 1 samuel 25 24 oh lord haue committed iniquitie praie thee let thine handmaid ſpeake vnto thee heare thou word thine handmaid let lord praie thee regard wicked man nabal name ſo nabal name follie thine handmaid ſawe yoong men lord whome thou ſenteſt therefore lord lord liueth thy ſoule liueth lord ſay hath withholden thee comming ſhed blood thine hand ſhould ſaue thee reuenge thée thine enimies pray god thine enimies intend doo lord euill may nabal praie thee forget treſpaſſe thine handmaid c ſong sion familiar talke myſticall communication diuine dialogue ſpeciall loue betwene ſpirituall bridegrome ieſus chriſt bride faithful ſoule ſanctified chaſte holie ſpouſe church commonlie called song ſongs ballat ballats made king salomon cantic 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 church faithfull ſoule ſpeaketh chriſt thou wouldeſt kiſſe kiſſes thy mouth euen thy peace paſſeth vnderſtanding thy loue chriſt better pleaſant vnto wine bicauſe good pleaſant ſauour thy moſt pretious balmes ointment euen thy great benefit taſte féele thée thy name chriſt ſweet ſmelling ointment powred ſhed foorth thy mercie ſet foorth publiſhed preaching thy goſpell therefore uirgins euen pure hart conuerſation doo loue thee drawe thou ſwéete chriſt vnto thee wee run thee otherwiſe confeſſe come thée except drawne thée king hath brought priuie chamber reuealed vnto ſecret ioies knowne world therefore glad reioice thee yea wee thinke thy loue wine righteous loue thee aboue thing blacke confeſſe ſpots ſinne perſecution trouble ye daughter ieruſalem yet comelie faire welfauoured faith blood chriſt whoſe fauour haue confidence truſt fruites tent kedarens arabian hanging curtens salomon within ſet pretious ſtones iewels maruell therfore bicauſe ſo blacke regard conſider outward apperance ſunne euen corruption nature ſinne affliction hath looked ſhined vpon yea mother child euen mine owne brother ſhould haue moſt fauoured angrie againſt hauing euill mee made keeper vineyard mine owne vineyard haue kept ſuch ala hath béene mine owne negligence therefore féeling fault imperfection flie vnto thée chriſt ſpirituall huſband onlie ſuccour beſéeching thée ſaieng tell thou ſoule loueth thou feedeſt ſheepe ſhew ſaie thou lieſt makeſt reſt noon day ſhould like hir turneth aſide goeth wrong flock thy companion whome thou haſt called dignitie paſtors thy church yet like apoſtataes onelie ſet foorth owne falſe dreames tradition ſtéed thy true doctrine alſo become domeſticall enimies perſecute church chriſt ſpeaketh church faithfull ſoule thou faireſt among woman thou knowe thy ſelfe art ignorant way go thy way foorth footſteps flock ſheepe euen doctrine apoſtles feede thy goates kid tent ſhepheards learne true paſtors ſpirituall doctor haue compared thee loue vnto troupe horſes chariot pharao bicauſe thy ſpirituall beautie excellencie worldlie treaſure compared vnto thée thy cheekes thy neck beautifull turtle behanged ſpangles chaines goodly iewels neckband alſo imbrodered gold ſtuds button ſiluer make thee church king ſitteth table repaſt hee ſhall ſmell nardus ſpikenard reioice admitted companie huſband chriſt yea welbeloued bundle mirrh vnto mee ſhall lie betwixt breſts moſt déere vnto welbeloued ſaie cluſter camphire vnto vineyard engedi wherfore ſo long followe chriſt erre true faith ſaluation christ faire art thou loue oh faire art thou thine eies like dooues eies behold moſt acceptable art thou vnto commend thy beautie church oh faire art thou alſo beloued welfauoured pleaſant art thou bed euen hart faithfull thou chriſt dwelleſt thy ſpirit greene bedecked flower beames ſeelings houſe cedar tree croſſe ioints cipreſſe roſe field lillie vallies christ yea like lillie among thornes ſo loue among daughter church preferred aboue thing yea ſo alſo among mine enimies church like apple tree among tree foreſt ſo welbeloued among ſonnes men teſtifie loue great deſire towards delight ſit reſt vnder ſhadowe bicauſe fruite word ſweet vnto mouth ſtrength faileth bringeth wine ſeller ſpreadeth banner loue ouer mee deſired comforted ſaieng set mee cup flagon wine comfort apple ſicke loue lo haue felt left hand vnder head right hand doth imbrace mee christ charge daughter ieruſalem yée ruler haue doo church ſolemne oth roe hind field yee wake vp loue touch hir trouble hir quietneſſe vntill ſhe pleaſe content hir ſelfe church thinke heare ye voice welbeloued ſpouſe chriſt behold hath taken nature vpon commeth leaping vpon mountaines ſkipping ouer little hils helpe church beloued like roe yoong hart behold hauing diuinitie hid vnder cloke fleſh ſtandeth behind wall looking foorth windowes ſhewing himſelfe thorough grate ſo haue full knowledge life welbeloued ſpake ſaid vnto christ loue ariſe ſtand vp faire one come thy waie go thine owne behold winter ſinne error infidelitie paſt driuen backe put awaie comming fleſh compared springtime thing flouriſh raine changed gone awaie flower good work come vp appere field time bird ſinging come voice turtle dooue holie ghoſt heard land fig tree bringeth foorth hir fig vine beare bloſſoms haue good ſmell ſtand vp come loue ariſe ſaie beautifull one come awaie dooue thou art caues rock hole wall ſecret place ſtaires thou ſaie art aſhamed thy ſinnes come ſhew thy ſelfe vnto let ſee thy countenance heare thy voice ſweete thy voice faire comelie thy face take v fox yea little fox deſtroy vine ſuppreſſe heretikes enimies church while yoong begin ſhew malice deſtroie vine preaching falſe doctrine vine beare bloſſoms haue ſmall grape church welbeloued mine hee feedeth among lillie vntill daie breake till ſhadowes gone returne praie thée come againe beloued chriſt like roe yoong hart vpon wild mountaines bether euer moſt readie helpe defend danger bed night trouble ſought ſoule loueth yea diligentlie ſought found carnall reaſon ſcriptures neither incontinentlie heard bicauſe muſt continue praier till féele comfort though féele firſt therefore thought riſe get vp go citie ſtreets hie way open place ſeeke praier continuallie ſoule loueth deſire ioined inſeparably chriſt huſband ſought carnall reaſon found ſcriptures ſéeking vnto others alſo hoped haue comfort ſuccor laſt watchman went citie found mee ſaid sawe ye ſoule loueth little paſt found preaching word ſoule loueth haue gotten hold vpon let go vntill haue brought mother houſe euen chamber hir conceiued bare christ charge ye daughter jeruſalem ye ruler magiſtrates haue doo church ſolemne oth roe hind field ye wake vp loue touch hir trouble ſtate quietneſſe peace thereof vntill ſhe pleaſe content hir ſelfe church ſpeaking hir deliuerance wilderneſſe beautie salomon temple ſaith commeth vp wildernes like pillers vapour ſmoke perfumed ſweet ſmell mirrh incenſe maner ſpices ſweet powder apothecarie merchant thinke like comming child iſrael led wilderneſſe followed chriſt fortie yéeres behold bedſted temple salomon made round ſtand threeſcore ſtrong men euen moſt valiant mightie men iſrael handle ſword expert war euerie one hath ſword vpon thigh watching kéeping defending temple word god bicauſe feare night king salomon made himſelfe palace chariot tree wood lebanon hee made pillers therof ſiluer pauement couering therof gold hanging thereof purple whoſe mids ground paued pleaſantlie loue daughter ieruſalem come foorth yee daughter zion euen yée number faithfull behold king salomon euen chriſt become man crowned loue god glorious crowne diuinitie wherewith mother crowned daie mariage daie gladneſſe hart christ faire art thou loue faire art thou chooſe praiſe commend thée haue ſo great delight thou haſt dooues eies euen ſimple ſincere faith beſides lieth hid within thy hearie lock euen fruit true faith like wooll flocke goates ſhorne vpon mount gilead ſo great reſpect haue multitude faithfull one manie number thy teeth faith faithfull made ſonnes god equallie like flocke ſheepe good order ſame bigneſſe went vp waſhing place euerie one beareth two twin one vnfruitfull barren among thy lip like roſe coloured riband thy word louelie thy talke comlie thy cheek temple like peece pomgranate within thy hearie lock thy necke preacher like tower dauid builded coſtlie ſtones lieng ſides defence thouſand ſhields hang therein yea weapon targats giant ſtrong men fixed therein thy two breaſts old teſtament new wherin knowledge zeale two pretious iewels like two twin yoong roe feede among roſes might go mountaine mirrh hill frankincenſe till daie breake till ſhadowes paſt awaie thou art faire loue ſpot blemiſh thee ſight come mee lebanon ſpouſe come lebanon looke top amanah top shenir hermon den lion mountaines leopard euen corner world call thee church faithfull vnto ſiſter ſo cal thée church reſpect haue taken fleſh man vpon ſpouſe thou haſt wounded bewitched hart loue ſiſter ſpouſe thou haſt wounded hart one thy eies chaine thy necke yea loue gift thée haue therewith made ſo beautifull rich faire thy breſts ſiſter ſpouſe faire thy loue thy breaſts loue much better pleaſant vnto wine ſauour thine ointment paſſeth ſpices thy lip ſpouſe bicauſe thy confeſſion thankeſgiuing preaching goſpell drop honie combe bring foorth much conſolation comfort yea milke honie vnder thy tongue ſweet ſmell ſauour thy garment like ſmell lebanon ſiſter ſpouſe garden well locked incloſed ſpring ſhut vp fountaine ſealed vp fruit planted thee like verie paradiſe orchard pomegranate ſweete fruit camphire nardus spikenard saffron calamus cinamon ſweet ſmelling tree incenſe mirrh aloe beſt ſpices church fountaine garden well liuing water ſprings lebanon confeſſe glorie beautie commeth thée chriſt art true fountaine grace goodneſſe church thy ſpouſe ariſe north wind come thou ſouth wind come blowe garden ſpices ſmell thereof may flowe carried euerie ſide yea let welbeloued come garden eate ſweet pleſant fruit growe therein deſire haue thée chriſt beloued ſpouſe come comfort powre grace thy holie ſpirit quarter vpon christ come garden euen vnto kingdome church prepare banket mine elect beſtowe vpon ſingular benefit ſiſter ſpouſe haue gathered mirrh ſpice haue eaten honie honie combe haue drunke wine milke eate ye alſo friend drink ye make merrie welbeloued church sleepe troubled care worldlie thing mine hart waketh heare voice welbeloued knocketh ſaieng christ open ſiſter loue dooue derling mine vndefiled mine head full dew lock heare full night drop hauing long patience towards ſinners church haue put cote confeſſe nakedneſſe hauing ſelfe nothing ſhall put againe haue waſhed feete made cleane ſhall defile ſelfe againe yea therefore ſéeing thée made cleane promiſe vnto thée neuer defile pollute ſelfe ſinne againe welbeloued put hand hole doore hart bowel affectioned moued towards roſe vp open beloued hand dropped mirrh mirrh ran downe finger vpon hand barre locke opened vnto welbeloued departed gone waie paſt hart gone ſpeake ſought would faine haue béene annointed chriſt could find bicauſe thought annoint good work ſought ſaie could find called cried vpon anſwered mee left time end might ſtir vp greater deſire continuall praier wicked watchman falſe teacher went citie found ſmote wounded conſcience tradition yea watchman kept walles tooke awaie vaile kerchife mee charge therefore ye daughter ieruſalem ye godlie watchman zion whence lawe ſaluation commeth ye find welbeloued tell ſicke loue ye direct vnto daughter ieruſalem faithfull chriſtians church ſaie thou faireſt among woman maner man thy welbeloued aboue louers welbeloued thy loue doo louers thou doſt ſo ſtraightlie charge v church welbeloued deſcribe perfect beautie comlineſſe vnto white ruddie coloured goodlieſt chiefeſt perſon among ten thouſand head moſt fine gold lock curled blacke rauen eies like dooues eies water brooke looke though waſhed milke remaine fuller veſſels ſet like pearles gold cheekes like garden bed wherin apothecary plant maner ſweete ſpices flower thing lip like lillie drop downe pure ſweet ſmelling mirrh hand like gold ring ſet chryſolite pretious ſtone tharſis bellie like white iuorie deckt couered ouer saphyres leg pillers marble ſet vpon ſockets fine gold face countenance lebanus excellent beautie cedar tree mouth word thereof ſweet altogither louelie wholie delectable euen ſuch one loue yee daughter ieruſalem ſuch maner man welbeloued ſpouſe chriſt daughter ieruſalem faithfull church ſaie thou faireſt among woman whither thy welbeloued chriſt gone whither thy welbeloued turned aſide alſo may ſeek thee hearing excellencie beautie inflamed greatlie deſire knowe find alſo church welbeloued gone downe garden conuerſant earth among men church directed ſcriptures vnto ſweet ſmelling bed ſpices loue come may refreſh himſelfe feede garden gather lillie aſſure ſelfe loue chriſt welbeloueds welbeloued mine feedeth among lillie christ thou art beautifull loue place ſtrong faire citie tirzah thou art comlie faire ieruſalem fearfull terrible armie men banner turne awaie thine eies mee haue ſet fire ouercome mee ſo excéeding loue towards thée church yea muſt néeds praiſe thy ſpirituall comlie beautie alſo thy member thy hearie lock like flocke goat go downe ſhorne vpon mountaine gilead thy teeth like flocke ſhorne ſheepe go vp waſhing place euerie one beareth twin one barren vnfruitfull among thy cheekes temple like peece pomgranate within thy lock heare threeſcore queenes foureſcore concubine wiues damſels without number faithfull manie number diuers order degrées men therein gift grace doo giue vnto church infinit dooue one alone mine vndefiled dearling ſhe onlie beloued daughter hir mother deere vnto hir bare hir diuers particular church diſperſed make one catholike church daughter ſawe hir ſaid ſhe bleſſed ye euen queenes concubins wiues praiſed hir ſhe looketh foorth morning faire moone pure ſunne terrible fearfull armie men banner though beginning church ſmall yet hath growne vp great multitude went downe vnto nut garden looked vpon church ſubiect affliction fruit bringeth ſee grew brook vallie vine budded vineyard pomgranats flouriſhed went downe ſaie synagogue ſée fruit came lawe prophet knew nothing found thing rebellion therin ſoule ſet chariot noble people vnder tribute ran ſwift noble people chariot call repentance ſaieng come againe turne againe shulamite thou perfect one turne againe people ieruſalem turne againe looke vpon thee ſhall ye ſee shulamite ieruſalem shalem ſignifieth peace like men war ſinging companie pleaſant beautifull thy going ſhooes thou prince daughter ioints thy thigh like faire iewell wrought hand cunning workemaiſter thy nauell like round goblet cup neuer without drinke wanteth liquor euer repleniſhed rich knowledge god word heauenlie deſires thy bellie wombe heape wheate ſet lillie euen full ſpirituall treaſures thy two breaſts old teſtament new came god like two twin yoong roe equall authoritie church thy necke preacher like tower iuorie ought pure godlie thine eies alſo like water pooles neſbon gate bathrabbin euen thy magiſtrates muſt well inſtructed god word thy noſe iudges good euill like tower lebanon looketh toward damaſcus thine head ſtandeth vpon thee like carmel ſkarlet heare thine head like purple king tied gallerie rafter dwelleth among manie water conduit delighteth come néere thée thy companie faire louelie art thou loue pleaſant art thou dearling pleaſures thy ſtature like palme tree preſſed perſecuted groweth increaſeth thy breaſts like cluſters grape ſaid climbe vp palme tree take hold hir high boughes thy breaſts alſo ſhall like cluſters vine ſmell thy noſtrils like ſauour apple roofe thy mouth like beſt wine meet beſt bloud cauſeth lip ancient ſpeake church welbeloueds deſire turne towards come welbeloued let v go forth field take lodging village remaine christ morning get vp earelie go ſee vineyard ſee vine ſproong forth grape growne pomegranate flouriſh ſhot call profeſſe word account fruit doo bring foorth church giue thee loue breaſts euen grace faithfull church mandrake haue giuen ſmell gate ſweet thing new old haue kept thee beloued church father old teſtament might find thee without ſée incarnation chriſt kiſſe thee whome loue brother ſuckt mother breaſts ſhould deſpiſe thee mee leade thee bring thee mother houſe thou chriſt mighteſt teach might giue thee drinke ſpiced wine ſweet ſap pomgranats left hand ſhall vnder head right hand ſhall imbrace gratious fauour ſhall preſerue deſperation aduerſitie preſumption proſperitie christ charge ye daughter ieruſalem ye magiſtrates elder rule church ye ſtir vp contention war therein wake loue tumult trouble vntill ſhe pleaſe ſhe thus commeth vp wilderneſſe leaning vpon hir welbeloued waked raiſed thee vp among apple tree thy mother conceiued thee thy mother ſaie bare thee brought thee world church set ſeale vpon thine hart ſignet vpon thine arme thy ſpouſe deſire ioined perpetuall loue thée chriſt ſeale holie ghoſt loue ſtrong death ielouſie cruell graue coales thereof fierie coales verie vehement flame lord ſo manie water able quench loue neither may ſtreames fluds drowne yea man would giue ſubſtance houſe loue ſhould count nothing would greatlie contemne haue little ſiſter namelie church gentils ſhe yoong hath breaſts wanteth old new teſtament ſhall doo ſiſter ſhe ſhall ſpoken ſhe ſure firme wall build vpon hir ſiluer palace ſhe doore keepe faſten hir boords cedar tree church ſure faſt ſhe méete huſband dwell apoſtles preach called inwardlie god ſaluation yea wall breaſts tower doo promiſe fidelitie conſtancie vnto ſpouſe chriſt one hath found fauor peace ſight salomon lord chriſt hath vineyard baalhamon vineyardlet vnto kepers euerie one fruit therof ſhould giue thouſand peeces ſiluer vineyard mine ſight thee chriſt ſpirituall salomon apperteine thouſand peeces ſiluer two thouſand keepe fruit thereof euen greateſt profit life euerlaſting obteined grace god merit thou dwelleſt garden thy church thy companion faithfull one hearken vnto thy voice let heare alſo companion may hearken vnto ſame welbeloued chriſt thou flie awaie depart v thy faithfull one yet beſeech thee like vnto roe yong hart vpon ſweet ſmelling mountaines ſpices make haſte praie chae come againe helpe v trouble amen foure lamentation daughter zion church wherin weeping ſighing howling heauie wofull hart ſhe ſorowfullie bewaileth hir miſerable eſtate plagued god forſaken hir ſpouſe chriſt ſinnes vnfaithfulneſſe rebellion lament 1 firſt lamentation ala doth citie jeruſalem remaine ſo ſolitarie deſolate ſometime full people ſhe become like widowe ſhe brought vnder tribute great among nation ruled land prouinces princeſſe weepeth ſore continuallie night teares run downe hir cheekes ſo ſhée taketh reſt among hir louers ſhe hath none comfort hir yea hir next friend trangreſſe againſt hir haue dealt vnfaithfullie hir become hir enimies iuda caried away captiue bicauſe hir crueltie affliction great bondage ſeruitude oppreſſion ſeruants poore ſhe dwelleth among heathen findeth reſt hir perſecutours tooke hir ſtrait place ſhee could eſcape way ſtreets zion mourne lament bicauſe man commeth anie mirth ioie woont ſolemne feaſts hir gate deſolate hir prieſts ſigh make lamentation hir virgin diſcomfited hir maides carefull ſhe hir ſelfe great heauineſſe hir aduerſaries chiefe ruler ouer hir hir enimies proſper lord hath chaſtened afflicted hir hir great wickedneſſe hir child gone captiuitie enimie multitude hir tranſgreſſions daughter zion hir beautie gone departed hir prince become like hart finde paſture euen men pined awaie ſorowe haue courage driuen awaie gone without ſtrength enimie purſuer ſo haue power ieruſalem remembred time hir miſerie affliction bare eſtate rebellion hir toie pleaſure ſhe hath time paſt ſeeing hir people brought downe vnder power enimie man helpe hir enimies ſtand looking hir laugh mocke hir sabboth day hir religion ſeruing god ſcorne ieruſalem hath greeuouſlie ſinned therefore ſhe come decaie deriſion hir honour deſpiſe hir becauſe haue ſeene hir filthineſſe yea ſhe ſigheth turneth backward ſhe aſhamed hir ſelfe hir filthineſſe hir ſkirts manifeſt yet ſhe aſhamed hir ſinne remembred hir laſt end therefore hir downefall ſo woonderfull man comfort hir lord behold mine affliction conſider trouble mine enimie hath vpper hand hath proudlie magnified himſelfe enimie hath put hand pretious thing ſhe yea euen hir eies came heathen entred hir sanctuarie whome thou neuertheleſſe didſt command forbid come within thy church congregation hir people ſigh ſeeke bread heauineſſe looke pretious pleaſant thing euerie man hath giueth meate ſaue life refreſh ſoule conſider lord ſee vile become haue ye regard pitie yee paſſe waie behold ſee anie ſorowe like vnto mine wherewith lord hath afflicted troubled day fierce fearefull wrath learnc beware mine example aboue hath euen god ſent downe fire bone preuaileth burneth cruellie hath ſpred laid net feete turned backe throwne wide open hath made deſolate ſo dailie heauines muſt euer mourning yoke tranſgreſſions bound faſt god hand wrapped wreathen come vp vpon necke ſo meanes ſhaken remitted onlie ſpeciall grace mercie hath made ſtrength faile lord hath deliuered hand neither able riſe vp quit ſelfe haue bondage lord hath troden vnder foote deſtroied valiant mightie men middes hath proclauned appointed time called aſſemblie ſlaughter deſtroie beſt yoong men lord hath troden downe virgin daughter iuda like grape winepreſſe therefore weepe mine eies euen mine eies guſh water becauſe comforter ſhould quicken refreſh ſoule far child driuen awaie deſolate becauſe enimie hath gotten vpper hand preuailed zion caſteth hir hand none comfort hir lord hath laid enimies iacob round ieruſalem menſtruous woman hir pollution ſeparate hir huſband become abhomination middeſt lord righteous haue rebelled againſt commandements prouoked countenance anger heare praie take heede ye people behold ſorowe conſider heauineſſe virgin maiden yong men led awaie priſoners gone captiuitie called louers deceiued prieſts counſellers periſhed died hunger citie euen while ſought meate ſaue liues refreſh ſoules behold lord conſider troubled bowel ſwell wombe diſquieted hart turneth within full heauineſſe becauſe rebelled ſtubbornelie ſword ſpoileth abroade death doth home heare mourning none comfort mine enimies haue heard trouble glad thereof becauſe thou haſt done thou wilt bring forth daie time thou haſt pronounced calledſt alſo ſhall like vnto let wickedneſſe come thee thou vnto thou haſt done vnto tranſgreſſions treſpaſſes ſorowe verie great ſighes manie mine hart heauie ſecond lamentation zion ala hath lord darkned daughter zion wrath brought hir proſperitie aduerſitie hath caſt beautie honour iſrael downe heauen vnto earth giuen hir moſt ſore fall remembring owne footeſtoole temple ieruſalem daie wrath angrie lord hath caſt deſtroied habitation iacob without anie fauour ſtrong place holdes daughter iuda hath broken wrath throwne downe ground ſpared hir kingdome prince thereof hath prophaned polluted wrath fierce indignation hath broken horne power ſtrength iſrael hath drawne backe right hand ſuccour enimie yea flame fire kindled iacob hath conſumed deuoured vp round hath bent bowe like enimie right hand ſtretched vp faſtned aduerſarie euerie thing pleaſant eie ſee hath ſlaine hath powred wrath like fire tabernacle daughter zion lord become enimie hath deuoured iſrael conſumed palace yea ſtrong hold hath deſtroied filled greatlie increaſed daughter iuda much ſorrowe heauineſſe lamentation mourning hath deſtroied tabernacle garden ſolemne meeting congregation hath put downe yea lord hath brought ſo paſſe high ſolemne feaſts ſabboths cleane forgotten zion hath deſpiſed heauie diſpleaſure indignation wrath king prieſt lord hath forſaken owne altar hath abhorred owne sanctuarie hath giuen walles hir palace tower hand enimies haue made noiſe blaſphemous ſhoutings criengs houſe lord daie ſolemnitie feaſting people accuſtomed praie lord hath determined breake downe walles daughter zion ſpread line hath withdrawne hand deſtroieng therefore maketh inſenſible thing euen rampart turret walles take part ſorowe mourne lament becauſe fell downe deſtroied together hir gate ſunke downe ground hir bar broken ſmitten ſunder hir king prince caried awaie gentile haue lawe neither haue hir prophet anie viſion lord senatours elder daughter zion ſit vpon ground keepe ſilence haue caſt vp duſt aſhes vpon head girded themſelues ſackcloth virgin maides ieruſalem hang downe head ground mine eies faile weeping abundance teares bowel ſwell liuer powred vpon earth great hurt deſtruction daughter people bicauſe child babe ſucklings faint ſowne ſtreetes citie haue ſaid mother bread drinke ſowned fell downe wounded ſtreetes citie gaue vp ghoſt died mother boſome thing ſhall take witneſſe againſt thee thing ſhal liken thee daughter ieruſalem thy calamitie ſo euident néede proofe whome ſhall compare thee thou virgin daughter zion comfort thee withall breach thy hart like breach maine ſea may heale thee thy falſe prophet haue looked vaine fooliſh thing thee haue diſcouered thine iniquitie ſhewed thee thy wickedneſſe turne awaie thine affliction keepe thee captiuitie flatter thée thy ſinnes haue ſeene looked falſe propheſies cauſes baniſhment deſtruction paſſe waie clap hand thee hiſſing wagging head vpon daughter ieruſalem ſaie citie men call ſo faire perfection beautie ioie whole earth al thine enimies gape vpon thee open mouth hiſſe thee grinde teeth ſaieng let v deuoure certainlie daie time looked come haue found ſeene lord hath fulfilled thing purpoſed doo performed word deuiſed determined old time long ago hath throwne downe deſtroied ſpared hath cauſed thine aduerſarie reioice triumph ouer thee hath ſet vp horne power thine enimie hart cried vnto lord thou wall citie daughter zion let thy teares run downe like riuer daie night take thee reſt neither let apple thine eie ceaſe leaue wéeping ariſe ſtand vp crie night beginning watch powre thy hart like water face lord lift vp thine hand towards liues yong child faint die hunger corner ſtreets behold lord conſider whome thou haſt done thus shall ye woman eate fruit euen child ſpan long shal prieſt prophet ſlaine sanctuarie lord yong old lie ground ſtreetes virgin yong men ſlaine fallen ſword thou haſt ſlaine put death daie thy wrathfull indignation yea euen thou haſt killed ſpared terrours euen mine enimies feared round haſt thou called feaſtdaie ſo daie lord wrath none eſcaped neither anie left behinde thoſe haue nouriſhed brought vp hath mine enimie deſtroied conſumed third lamentation zion gold prince become ſo dimme moſt fine gold ſo changed ſtones sanctuarie prieſts ſo ſcattered corner euerie ſtreete noble men zion alwaie honour cloathed moſt pretious gold eſteemed become like earthen veſſels worke potter hand ſmall eſtimation without anie honour dragon though cruell yet pitie drawe breaſts giue ſucke nouriſh yong one daughter people become cruell woman forſake child like eſtriches wildernes forſake egge bird tongs ſucking child cleaue roofe mouth verie thirſt yong child aſke bread man giueth woont fare delicatelie periſh ſtreets afore brought vp purple ſcarlet make much doong iniquitie daughter people beecome greater wickedneſſe zodome ſuddenlie deſtroied taken hand anie camp pitched againſt hir hir nazarites abſteiners purer ſnowe whiter milke colour bodie freſh red corall beautie like poliſhed saphyr ſo greatly god fauour face verie blacke cole ſo much none knowe ſtreetes ſkinne cleaueth bone withered become like drie ſtocke greateſt abhomination vnto ſlaine ſword happier killed die hunger fade pine awaie ſtriken lacke fruit field foode woman nature pitifull haue ſodden owne child hand might meate miſerable deſtruction daughter people lord hath performed heauie wrath hath powred furiouſneſſe wrathfull diſpleaſure hath kindled fire zion hath conſumed foundation thereof neither king earth inhabitors world would haue beleeued enimie aduerſarie ſhould haue entred come gate ieruſalem neuertheleſſe contrarie men expectation come paſſe ſinnes hir prophet iniquity hir prieſts haue ſhed bloud iuſt innocent midſt hir blind men went ſtumbling ſtreets ſtained polluted themſelues bloud ſo heathen would touch garment cried vnto depart flee ye polluted awaie get hence touch thoſe prieſts vncleane remoued therfore fled awaie wandered yea haue ſaid among heathen ſhall dwell anger wrath countenance lord hath ſcattered ſhall neuer looke vpon regard themſelues neither regarded reuerenced face prieſts compaſſion pitie elder wherefore eies failed while yet looked vaine helpe man waiting haue looked aegyptians nation people could doo v good ſaue v hunt ſteps lay ſo ſharpe wait v go ſafe ſtreets end neere hand day fulfilled end come perſecutors ſwifter eagle aire purſued followed vpon v ouer mountaines laid wait v wilderneſſe verie breath noſtrels euen ioſias king annointed lord himſelfe whome ſtood hope god fauour whome depended ſtate life taken net ſlaine whome ſaid ſhadowe ſhall preſerued aliue among heathen thou daughter edom dwelleſt land huz go glad reioice deſtruction fall yet thou ſure thou ſhalt eſcape cup god wrath ſhall paſſe come vnto thee alſo thou ſhalt dronken diſcouer thy nakedneſſe vomit vp thine owne ſhame good comfort therefore thou daughter zion thy ſinnes fullie puniſhed thy puniſhment accompliſhed ſeuentie yeres thy ſorowes ſhal haue end carie thee awaie captiuitie thy wickedneſſe daughter edom ſhall viſit diſcouer thy ſins ſo wicked ſhall tormented euer fourth lamentation complaint zion ſhe rod wrath haue experience miſerie droue foorth led yea darkeneſſe light surelie againſt turned turneth hand dailie againſt fleſh ſkinne hath made waxe old bone hath bruſed broken hath builded againſt cloſed gall trauell hath ſet darke place dead euer hath hedged get hath laid heauie linkes chaines vpon alſo though crie call pitiouſlie yet heareth praier hath ſtopped vp way hewen ſquared ſtones made path crooked laieth waite like beare lion hole ſecret place hath ſtopped vp way broken peeces hath laid waſte made deſolate hath bent bowe made marke ſhoote arrowe arrowes quiuer ſaie hath ſhot entred euen reines laughed ſcorne deriſion people make ſongs ballet vpon daie long hath filled bitterneſſe made dronken woormewood great anguiſh ſorowe hath made looſe ſenſes hath ſmitten teeth peeces ſtones rolled duſt thus ſoule farre peace forgat proſperitie good thing ſaid ſtrength mine hope periſhed lord remember yet miſerie trouble woormewood gall yea remembring ſoule doth ſtill remember humbled within conſider theſe thing hart therefore get hope againe namelie lord mercy vtterlie conſumed wickedneſſe truelie pitifull compaſſions faile new mercy ſhall lord ſhew vpon thee earlie daie ſpringing euerie morning lord great thy faithfulneſſe féele thy benefit continuallie lord portion ſaith ſoule therefore hope good lord vnto put truſt ſoule ſeeketh hun good man ſilence patience doth truſt waite health ſaluation lord good man take beare yoke vppon youth vp ſitteth alone murmureth patient holdeth ſtill keepeth ſilence becauſe hath taken borne lord yoke vpon laieth face vpon earth humbleth himſelfe waiting patience may happen anie hope ſuccour offreth cheeke ſmiter content reproches lord forſake euer though ſend affliction puniſh yet haue compaſſion according multitude mercy receiueth grace againe doth plague willinglie delighteth afflict child men doth neceſſitie amendment treade priſoners earth vnder feete ouerthrowe right man face moſt high condemne man cauſe lord hath pleaſure ſuch thing ſaith commeth paſſe lord commandeth without prouidence nothing done mouth moſt high proceedeth euill good proſperitie aduerſitie wherefore mourneth liuing man god afflicteth let mourne ſorowfull owne ſinnes ſuffereth let v ſearch trie looke well vpon owne way remember ſelues turne againe lord let v without hypocriſie lift vp hart hand vnto god heauens ſaie haue ſinned rebelled therefore haſt thou ſpared thou haſt couered v thy wrath perſecuted v thou haſt ſlaine without anie fauour thou haſt hid thy ſelfe cloud praiers ſhould paſſe thou haſt made v offſcowring reffuſe mids people enimies haue opened mouth againſt v gape vpon v feare ſnare come vpon v yea deſolation deſtruction whole riuers water guſh mine eies deſtruction daughter people mine eie droppeth without ſtaie ceaſeth reſt till lord looke downe heauen conſider mine eies breake mine hart ouercome wéeping bicauſe daughter people citie mine enimies hunted chaſed ſore like bird yea without cauſe haue ſhut vp life dungeon caſt ſtone vpon water flowed ouer mine head thought deſtroied called vpon thy name lord deepe pit lowe dungeon thou haſt heard voice ſtop thine eare ſighings crieng thou dreweſt neere vnto daie called vpon thee haſt ſaid feare lord thou haſt maintained cauſe ſoule haſt redeemed life danger lord thou haſt ſeene wrong take thou cauſe vpon thee iudge thou haſt ſeene vengeance deuiſes againſt mee thou haſt hard reprochfull deſpitefull word lord yea imagination againſt lip alſo thoſe riſe againſt deuiſes whiſperings take againſt daie long behold alſo ſitting downe riſing vp ſong reward lord according work hand giue ſorrowe hart obſtinate hart euen thy curſe perſecute lord thine indignation root vtterlie deſtroie vnder heauen fift lamentation praier zion call remembrance lord come vpon v conſider behold confuſion reproch inheritance turned ſtrangers houſes alien vnderlings without father mother widowes haue drunken water monie wood haue ſale ſold vnto v neck vnder perſecution wearie haue reſt aforetime yeelded ſelues aegyptians haue ſubmitted ſelues aſſyrians onlie might ſatiſfied haue bread inough father gone haue ſinned muſt beare wickedneſſe seruants haue rule v man deliuereth v hand muſt get liuing perill liues bicauſe drought wilderneſſe ſkin made blacke like ouen bicauſe trouble famine verie ſore hunger rauiſh defile wiues zion maiden citie iudea prince hanged vp enimies hand haue honoured old ſage men face haue taken yoong men ſlaues grind boy fainted vnder burden wood able abide elder haue ceaſed gate ſo lawes forme commonwealth yoong men ſongs ioie hart gone danſe melodious meeting turned mourning garland crowne head fallen wo vnto v ala euer ſinned therfore hart full heauineſſe theſe thing eies dimme wéeping bicauſe hill mountaine zion deſtroied deſolate inſomuch fox runne vpon thou lord remaineſt euer thy ſeate throne generation generation world without end therefore thy couenant mercy neuer faile wherefore doſt thou forget v euer forſake v ſo long time turne thou v vnto thee lord ſo ſhall turned renew day old time thou haſt vtterlie baniſhed reiected v thou art exceedinglie angrie diſpleaſed againſt v praier thankeſgiuing sarra tobit wife hir virginitie faſting weeping ſpace three day three night ſhe made deliuered ſhame reproch wherewith hir father maid vpbraided hir tobit 3 11 bleſſed art thou lord god thine holie glorious name bleſſed honourable euer let thy work praiſe thee euer god father thou art wroth ſheweſt mercie time trouble thou forgiueſt ſinnes call vpon thee unto thee lord turne face vnto thee lift vp mine eies ſaie beſeech thee lord looſe bond rebuke elſe take vtterlie awaie earth may heare anie reproch thou knoweſt lord minc innocencie neuer deſire vnto man haue kept ſoule cleane vncleanlie luſts thou knoweſt lord ſay pure ſinne man haue neuer polluted name name father land captiuitie haue kept companie thoſe paſſe time ſport neither haue made ſelfe partaker walke light behauiour onelie daughter father neither hath anie man child heire neither anie neere kinſman child borne may keepe ſelfe wife huſband haue conſented take pleaſure thy feare ſeuen huſbands dead one another ſhould liue endure ſo great reproch counted murtherer huſbands peraduenture either haue beene vnwoorthie elſe vnmeete pleaſe thee ſhould die deſire thou happilie haſt kept another huſband command looke pitie doo heare reproch thy counſell power man euerie one ſerueth thee ſure life trieng ſhall crowned trouble god doubt ſhall deliuer life chaſtening ſhall haue leaue come vnto thy mercie thou haſt pleaſure damnation ſtorme thou makeſt weather faire ſtill weeping heauineſſe thou giueſt great ioie thy name god iſrael praiſed euer amen ſame time hir praiers heard maieſtie great god praier iudith ſhe made faſting teares deliuerance hir people bethulians hand holophernes aſſyrians hoſt beſieged citie iudith 9 2 lord god father simeon gaueſt ſword defence againſt enimies take vengeance ſtrangers vſed violence vncleanneſſe opened wombe maid dinah defiled hir rauiſhed virgine diſcouered thigh ſhame polluted wombe hir reproch confuſion thou hadſt commanded ſhould ſo yet sichemites meane thing thou gaueſt prince ſlaughter deceiued waſhed bed bloud haſt ſtriken ſeruants gouernors gouernors vpon throne thou gaueſt wiues praie daughter captiues ſpoiles bootie vnto thy child ſeruants iſraelites thou louedſt mooued thy zeale abhorred pollution bloud called vpon thee aid god lord god heare alſo widowe helpe mee beſeech thee thou haſt wrought thing afore theſe thing ſhall thou conſidereſt thing preſent thing come thing thou doſt purpoſe preſent ſaie behold heere looke thou haſt taken hand deuiſed came euer paſſe thy way readie prepared thy iudgements put thine euerlaſting foreknowledge looke vpon army aſſyrians like thy pleaſure ſometime looke vpon hoſt aegyptians weaponed perſecuted thy ſeruants put truſt chariot horſemen multitude men war thou lookedſt vpon hoſt caſting thicke darknes came deepe water ouerwhelmed euen ſo lord behold let go thoſe aſſyrians multiplied power haue exalted themſelues horſes horſemen glory ſtrength footman truſt ſhield ſpeare bowe knowe thou art lord god breakeſt battels deſtroieſt war beginning lord thy name apperteineth vnto thee called lord lift vp thine arme like euer beginning breake thou ſtrength thy power cauſe force fall thy wrath haue purpoſed yea make vaunt boaſt vnhalowe defile thy ſanctuarie pollute tabernacle thy glorious name reſteth waſte ſpoile caſt downe ſword weapon horn thine altar behold pride bring paſſe lord blaſphemie enimie holophernes may cut downe owne ſword ſend thy wrath vpon head giue mine hand widowe ſtrength haue conceiued may taken ſnare eies thou maieſt ſmite lip loue smite ſaie deceit lip ſeruant prince prince ſeruant giue ſtedfaſt mind may deſpiſe ſtrength may deſtroie ſhall bring thy name euerlaſting remembrance thou abate ſtrength ouerthrowe hand woman thy power lord ſtandeth multitude men thy might ſtrong men neither haſt thou anie pleaſure ſtrength horſes neither beginning anie proud perſons pleaſed thee praier humble meeke hath thy pleaſure beene euermore thou ſaie lord art helpe humble little one defender weake protector forſaken sauiour without hope surelie ſurelie thou art god father god inheritance iſrael lord heauen earth creator water king lord creature heare thou praiers heare ſaie poore woman calling vpon thee putting truſt thy mercie remember thy couenant lord miniſter word mouth ſtabliſh deuiſe hart thy houſe may continue ſtill holineſſe yea grant word ſaie craft wound art god power ſtrength none defendeth people iſrael thou iudith hir praier ſhee made ſecretlie mentallie hir hart ſhe ſtroke head proud holophernes iudith 13 4 lord god power behold preſent haue reſpect vnto work hand houre exaltation ieruſalem thou maieſt ſet vp thy citie like thou haſt promiſed strengthen lord god iſrael grant may performe thing hope may done thee haue deuiſed time helpe thine inheritance execute mine enterpriſes deſtruction enimies riſen againſt v strengthen therefore daie lord god iſrael ſtrengthen ſaie lord god euen houre iudith hir ſong praiſe thankeſgiuing ſhe togither people made deliuerance hand aſſyrians deſtruction holophernes iudith 16 begin vnto god timbrel ſing vnto lord cimbals tune vnto pſalme ſing new ſong thankeſgiuing vnto exalt praiſe ioifull call vpon name lord deſtroieth war breaketh battels euen lord name god hath pitched tent campe mids people deliuered hand perſecutors enimies aſſur came mountaines north multitude ſtrength came thouſands armie ſo multitude people ſtopped water brooke horſes couered vallies purpoſed haue burnt vp border land ſaid would kill yoong men ſword daſh ſuckling child againſt ground lead awaie child virgin praie ſpoile captiuitie almightie lord hindered deliuered hand woman hath brought naught confuſion mightie holophernes fall deſtroied yoong men ſonnes titan ſlue neither haue great giant inuaded ſet themſelues againſt iudith daughter merari hir faire beautie comlie countenance hath diſcomfited brought naught ſhe put laid awaie garment hir widowhood put apparell gladneſſe exaltation reioicing thoſe oppreſſed iſrael annointed hir face ointment bound vp hir heare coife tooke new ſtole linnen garment beguile hir ſlippers rauiſhed eies hir beautie captiuated tooke mind priſoner ſword faulchin ſmote ſhe head perſians aſtoniſhed hir boldneſſe medes troubled hir hardineſſe mine afflicted reioiced feeble one appeared drie thirſt ſhowted ioie perſians medes feared lift vp voice howled turned backe child maides ſonnes daughter haue pierced wounded fled awaie like fugitiue child periſhed battell verie feare lord god ſing vnto lord ſong thankeſgiuing new ſong praiſe ſing vnto god lord lord thou art great glorious god maruellous mightie inuincible power man may ouercome let thy creature ſerue thee thou ſpakeſt word made thou ſenteſt thy ſpirit created none reſiſt withſtand thy voice mountaines mooue leape vp foundation water ſtonie rock melt thy preſence like waxe yet thou art mercifull feare thee ſacrifices little ſweet ſauour fat little thy burnt offering feare thee lord ſhall
