deus illi corrupti ſunt abhominabiles ſua impietate nullus eſt qui aliquid boni facit french le fol dit en ſon coeur il ny point de dieu il ſont corrompus abhominables en leur impieté ilny nul qui face aucun bien italian lo ſtolto diſſe nel ſuo cuore egli non vi è dio eſsi ſon corrotti abomineuoli ne la lor impietà non vi è neſſuno che faccia alcun bene godlie meditation inward loue christian ſoule towards chriſt lord firſt chapter ſoules ſlauerie ſinne redemption chriſt paſſion hell full trauel paine miſchiefe torment pit curſedneſſe doth ſpring deſperation hel ſo profound ſufficient puniſh ye tenth part ſinnes number ſo manie infinit ſwarme ſo ſhadoweth darkened ſenſes account neither yet well ſee ſo farre entred among haue power obteine true knowledge deepe danger perfectlie feele alſo roote ſinne ſo graffed ſelfe find none effect either branch leafe fruit bringeth foorth looke better branch therof ſhadoweth mine eies mouth doth fall would ſpeake bitter fruit curſed ſinne ſpirit ſtirred harken noiſe hir leaues ſtoppeth mine eares filleth noſtrils ſmell hir flower behold therefore paine ſoule ſlaue priſoner without light comfort lieth crieng weeping hauing hir feete bound chaine concupiſcence hir armes faſt tied thorough euill vſe hath power helpe remedie neither haue power crie ſuccour perceiue helpe hope ſpeciall grace god ſelfe deſerue chriſt onelie ſonne whoſe brightneſſe giueth light darkneſſe whoſe power examining fault breaketh vaile ignorance giueth mee cleare vnderſtanding thing abideth mee wherefore labour haue offended obeie ſo ſeldome wherefore conuenient pride ſuppreſſed weeping hart ſorowfull ſighs humblie therefore confeſſe much leſſe nothing birth mire dunghill hauing bodie prompt euill willing ſtudie ſubiect care ſorowe paine ſhort life end vncertaine vnder ſin adam ſold lawe condemned ſelfe neuer yet power obſerue one onelie commandement god force ſinne ſuch therefore ſinne whit leſſe hidden cloaked diſſembled ſinne outwardlie increaſed within hart god would could hee would oft time deſired performe thing doth conſtraine mee importable ſorowe wearie raging life wiſh end miſerable bodie deſired death ſhall ſhall deliuer recouer anie good ala mortall man power ſtrength ſuch deliuer onlie grace almightie god neuer ſlacke helpe penitent mercie oh maiſter without deſeruing ſhew mercie ſinners ſerued ſlothfullie without ceaſing offended euerie daie yet ſlacke helping doth ſee euill haue much ſelfe doo nothing good hart bodie ſo inclined contrarie feele ſtrength vnleſſe doo euill yet doth tarie till humblie praie ſeeing hell damnation doo crie vpon ſpirit whurling hart greater declare aſketh mee gift whereof vertue vnknowne little power ſame vnknowne gift whurling hart doth bring mee new deſire ſhewing good haue loſt ſinne giuen againe thorough grace bountie hath ouercome ſinne lord grace goodneſſe doth put ſo manie ſinnes may ſee thou art full godlie loue make ſinner thy ſeruant child ala god ſeeke thee fled ran awaie thee beneath thou cameſt downe mee nothing woorme earth naked doo ſaie woorme naie woorſe woorme full pride deceit malice treaſon promiſe friend made baptiſed ſuch alwaies thorough faith thy paſſion ſhould feele mortification fleſh dwell alwaies thee croſſe thou waſt faſt nailed beleeue yeelded death dead alſo ſhould yeeld ſinne haue oftentimes vntied taken downe ſet large haue broken denied falſified promiſe pride haue lifted vp ſuch maner ſloth dutie towards thee forgotten much well profit value thee daie baptiſme alſo thy ſauing loue promiſes folowing haue alike neglected ſhall ſaie albeit oftentimes thou perceiuing mee wretched vnhappie haſt giuen ſo manie warning faith ſacraments admoniſhing mee preaching comforted mee receiuing thy bleſſed bodie ſacred bloud promiſing ſame put number adorned perfect innocencie yet haue theſe high benefit throwne forgetfulneſſe oftentimes lord haue thee broken couenant partlie poore ſoule much fed euill bread damnable doctrine hypocrite deſpiſed ſuch ſuccour ghoſtlie phyſicke god word would haue helped mee beene willing looke yet knew time teacher conuenient neither man saint angel without thy ſpirit change hart ſinner ala good ieſus thou beholding blindneſſe neede could haue ſuccour men didſt open waie ſaluation great thy goodneſſe ineſtimable ſweeteneſſe thou haſt ſhewed therein anie father ſo naturall daughter brother ſiſter would euer haue done thou haſt done thou cameſt downe hel ſuccour ſoule againſt thy ſhee intending haue periſhed bicauſe ſhe loue thee ala ſweet lord thou haſt loued hir yea euen verie outſhedding thy moſt pretious bloud charitie feruent incomparable nothing ſlacke art thou loue ſo louedſt euerie ſinner yea alſo thine enimies onelie forgiuing offence alſo giuing thy ſelfe ſaluation libertie deliuerance death croſſe trauell paine ſufferance caſt mind ſhould occaſion thy loue towards mee ſee nothing elſe loue woonderfull moueth thee giue deſerue far foorth ſee ought giue thanks ſaluation onlie thee lord ieſu owe praiſe thereof sauior creator ſecond chapter ſoules affinitie chriſt thing god thou haſt done ſo much thou art onelie contented haue forgiuen ſinnes alſo haſt giuen vnto mee right fortunate gift grace ſhould ſuffice mee comming ſuch danger like ſtranger vſed thou doeſt handle ſoule durſt ſo ſay mother daughter ſiſter wife notwithſtanding lord treſpaſſer woorthie come neere doore thy right high place aſke bread thy dwelling oh grace ſo ſuddenlie thou vouchſafeſt drawe ſoule ſuch highnes ſhe feeleth hir ſelfe ruler bodie poore ignorant lame doth find hir ſelfe thee rich wiſe ſtrong bicauſe thou haſt written hir hart roote thy ſpirit holie word giuing hir true faith receiue thing made hir conceiue thy ſonne beleeuing man god sauiour alſo true forgiuer ſinnes therefore doeſt thou aſſure hir ſhee mother thy sonne whome thou art onlie father furthermore father great loue thy well dooing thy holie ſonne hath taken bodie man hath mingled himſelfe aſhes thing may vnderſtand without moſt true faith hath pleaſed thee put ſo neere v ioine himſelfe fleſh ſeeing called man bold call brother ſith ſoule may ſaie hir ſelfe ſhee ſiſter god ought ſhe haue hir ſelfe aſſured yes trulie thou doeſt declare great loue hir creation onlie thy good wil pleaſeth thee alwaies haue towards hir giuing aſſurance hir firſt daie time prouided hir thou thorough loue haſt made hir thou power alone canſt well doo alſo didſt put hir within bodie ſlacke ſloth ſhould haue none exerciſe thinke doo ſome ſeruice vnto thee truth maketh hir feele thee true paternitie honor ſweetneſſe glorie hath ſoule doeth alwaies remember ſhe thy daughter calling thee father ſhee doth thy commandement doth pleaſe thee giue hir another name call hir thy wife ſhe againe doo call thee huſband declaring therby thou haſt freelie manifeſted mariage hir baptiſme haſt thou made promiſe giue hir thy good rich take thee hir ſinnes ſhe hath nothing heritage ſinne hir firſt father adam hir treaſures ſhe hath nature nothing elſe ſinnes thou haſt tied vpon croſſe paid hir debt thy goodes land thou haſt made hir ſo rich ſo great iointure endued hir ſhe knowing hir ſelfe thy wedded wife doth beleeue quit ſhe oweth eſteeming verie little ſhee hath heere beneath forſaketh hir old father good giueth hir hir huſbands ſake ſurelie god hurteth ſoule fed ſuch good againe releeued leauing pleaſures world eternal peace without warre father ala ought thinke shall ſpirit ſo bold take vpon call thee father yea alſo father ſo haſt thou taught pater noſter call daughter haſt thou ſo ſaid praie thee tell ala yea lord great ſweetnes thou ſaiedſt daughter lend thy hart againe thou ſaiedſt daughter thy faith hath ſaued thee ſoule inſtead lending lord readie giue himſelfe wholie vnto thee receiue permit anie creature put thee ſo euer faithfull ſtedfaſtneſſe may loue thee daughterlie loue lord thou father may thinke may thy mother indeede well perceiue ſhould conceiue thee createdſt matter thou diddeſt ſatiſfie doubt preaching ſtretching forth thy hand thou didſt ſaie thoſe ſhall father brother ſiſter mother beleue hearing reading word thou haſt taught vttered thy holie prophet apoſtles ſame alſo thy true preacher thou doſt dailie declare vnto men beleeuing ſtedfaſtlie deſiring fulfill ſame conceiue thee beare thee loue therfore without anie feare wil take vpon name mother mother chriſt ſweet virgine marie beſeech thee angrie take vp ſuch title neither ſteale vſurpe anie thing vpon thy priuiledge thou onelie aboue woman receiuedſt ſo great honour man himſelfe comprehend hath beene willing take thee fleſh thou art mother perfect virgine holie birth thy bleſſed wombe thou didſt beare nouriſh thou didſt followe tribulation alſo teaching brieflie conclude thou haſt god found ſuch grace enimie malice deceit cauſed adam poſteritie loſe eue haue loſt sonne hath yeelded vnto v againe therefore haſt thou bene rightfullie called full grace one whome lord hath ſhewed aboundant fauour sith beſt among good alſo ſpring goodneſſe power hath created thee ſo pure innocencie endued thee ſuch grace exalted thee ſuch dignitie thee example vertue hath builded dwelling temple loue confirme himſelfe thee thou grace art confirmed therefore man giue thee greater praiſe god himſelfe hath giuen thee ſuch praiſe ſame commeth god thou alſo haſt ſo firme conſtant faith thou holie ghoſt waſt filled godlineſſe take vpon therefore giue thee greater praiſe honour thy ſonne ſoueraigne lord hath giuen thee thou art corporall mother ſo art thou thorough faith ſpirituall mother following thy faith humbleneſſe ſpirituall mother alſo ala god brotherlineſſe thou haſt towards thorough thy humbleneſſe calling ſiſter great thou haſt broken kindred mine old father calling daughter adoption seeing haue one father feare call thee brother thou haſt ſo reported wiſe salomon canticle ſaieng ſiſter ſpouſe thou haſt wounded hart ſweete looke one thine eies c ala brother wiſh nothing elſe wounding thee might finde ſelfe wounded thy loue would giue ouer ſelfe likewiſe thou doeſt call mee wife ſpeaking theſe amorous word ariſe deere doue come hitherward delectable ſpouſe wherefore may ſaie louing faith thou art mine thine bicauſe thou haſt called thy loue faire ſpouſe ſo ſuch haſt thou made ala doth pleaſe thee giue ſuch name trulie able breake hart cauſe burne loue vnſpeakeable thinketh vpon honour thou doeſt vnto ſoule much greater hath deſerued mother mother ala child god ſonne ieſus ſpeech mother daughter ſiſter brother happie kindred ſweetneſſe doth proceede paternitie daughterlie reuerent feare ought haue towards father yea creator protector ſauiour brother ala heere great loue therfore ſaie salomon hart longer refraine breake ſunder make roome ſame ſo ſweete brother ſo none name written ſame onlie name brother ieſus ſonne god none creature giue place ſcurging beating done vnto keepe hart deere brother loue let thine enimie enter third chapter ſoules infidelitie apoſtaſie god ſweete father child brother ſpouſe hand ioined humblie vpon knee yeeld thee thanks praiſes pleaſeth thee turne thy face towards conuerting hart couering ſuch grace thou doeſt ſee euils ſinnes well haſt thou hidden ſeemeth thou haſt put forgetfulneſſe yea alſo ſeeme forgotten haue done committed faith loue ſo working cauſeth forget wholie putting truſt thee alone father whome lieth vnfeigned loue whereof haue feare hart confeſſe haue done euill one creature doo ſelfe naught alſo haue offended thee prodigall child following fooliſh trade fleſh wherewith haue prodigallie ſpent ſubſtance aboundance goodes thou heere haſt giuen vſe thy glorie miſpending pouertie hath taken hath withered awaie euen haie yeelded ſpirit dead hunger compelling eate reliefe ſwine ſuch meates found verie little ſauour ſeeing life ſo miſerable returne thee father againe ſaieng ala deere father haue ſinned againſt heauen thee therefore worthie called thy child bountifull mercifull father thou worſſe one thy houſhold ſeruants ala deere father loue zeale thou wouldeſt tarie comming praier ſpeedilie ſtretching foorth thy hand receiuedſt thinke thou wouldeſt looke ſo receiuing ſtead haue puniſhed thou didſt aſſure ſaluation ſhall puniſh father ſhall denie ſinne iudge condemne vnleſſe god himſelfe damne want goodneſſe feare haue god father enimie ſhall harme father take ſtrength awaie owe thing ſhall paie haue deſerued death king ſhall pardon deliuer priſon death heere woorſt maner mother haue beene faith receiued name true mother became verie rude vnto thee sonne becauſe conceiued brought thee foorth left reaſon ſubiect taking heed vnto thee fell aſleepe gaue place great enimie night ignorance aſleepe ſteale thee craftilie thy place ſhe put hir child dead ſo leeſe thee ſorowfull remorſe thus looſe thee ſonne mine owne fault becauſe tooke heed keepe thee senſualitie neighbour beeing beaſtlie ſleepe ſteale thee gaue hir child life named ſinne whome ſaid would haue vtterlie forſake affirmed mine owne knew hirs ſoone came light grace thou hadſt giuen knewe glorie changed ſaw dead child mine ſame aliue ſhe taken awaie child ſo apparant change betweene ieſus ſinne heere ſtrange thing old woman cauſeth keepe dead child whome ſhe reporteth mine ſo ſhe mainteine salomon thou true wiſe iudge thou haſt heard lamentable proceſſe ordeined content party child ſhould diuided two part falſe woman agreeth ſhould ſo remembring mine owne ſonne aliue rather content leeſe ſee bodie parted twaine true perfect loue neuer content one halfe loueth rather therefore weepe whole recouer one halfe without life ala noble salomon giue child aliue better die ſee ſonne diuided lord thou didſt better looke thou ſeeing anguiſh ſuffer rather forſake right behold ſuch cruelneſſe thou ſaiedſt true mother ſo cauſed giue child againe whome hart ſorowfull ſweete ieſus thus haſt thou proued much loued thee yea ſinne loſt thee yet didſt thou returne vnto ala gentlie doeſt thou vouchſafe come againe hir let ſinne could keepe thee ſweete child ſweete ſonne helper nouriſher whome humble creature permit euer leaue thee againe repent time paſt come ſenſualitie thy rablement ſinnes thou haſt power make receiue thy dead child ſonne ſtrong defend ſhall permit thou take anie awaie ſtrength greater anie others therefore may ſleepe take reſt neere thing well conſidered ſhall keepe thine aſſaults ſweete reſt mother ſonne together ſweete child god onlie vnto thee honour praiſe euerie creature may ſee hath pleaſed thee call leſſe nothing mother ſtrange hard done ought thy goodneſſe haue praiſe thou haſt retained thy ſiſter wherefore acknowledge ſelfe bound anie creature ſiſter vnto thee ſo naughtie ſiſter better without name forget name adoption ſo noble kindred alſo thy good brotherlie behauiour towards pride riſe againſt thee remembring fault going aſtraie thee agree aaron brother giue iudgement againſt thy work folowing example miriam priuilie grudged againſt thee thing cauſed haue remorſe conſcience ala right bountifull brother true moſes doeſt goodneſſe iuſtice haue eſteemed thy workes euen ſinne ſo bold ſpeake euen raſhlie ſaieng wherefore haſt thou maried ſtrange woman thou giueſt v law puniſhment fulfill thou wouldeſt bound forbidding v thing thou thy ſelfe doeſt thou forbiddeſt v kill anie man thou doeſt kill ſpareſt none three thouſand thou commandedſt ſlaine god gaue v commandement thee ſhould marrie daughter ſtranger yet thou tookeſt thy wife among ala deere brother moſes great manie theſe word knowe fooliſh aaron miriam mine owne wit imbraided thee wherof repent liuelie voice god rebukinglie tooke vp went place wouldeſt thou ſinne thou wouldeſt haue puniſhed rather wouldeſt ſaluation health aſking great benefit might pleaſe god mitigate iudgement thing thou couldeſt obtaine wherefore became lazar ſo looked mee might well ſaie beene wiſe mine vncleannes leproſie put tent tabernacle among people becauſe ſicke ſhould infect ſuch whole oh ſoule haue greater puniſhment baniſhed companie holie god didſt thou ſweet loue brother ſeeing repentance thou prouidedſt penance ſoone end true loue madeſt meanes wherevpon returned thee brother would ſtead puniſh fooliſh ſiſter ſo naturallie cleaue vnto hir iniurie grudge great offence hir committed thou giueſt hir grace loue recompenſe ala brother exceeding thy loue much brotherhoode bound giue ſo poore wretched woman haue done thee euill thou giueſt good thine thou ſaieſt thou art mine euen ſo euer feare great fooliſhneſſe aaron miriam man may ſeparate thee together brother ſiſter care little thy land mine inheritance let v keepe pleaſe thee one houſhold ſith hath pleaſed thee humble thy ſelfe ſo much ioine thy hart mine making thy ſelfe liuelie man right hartilie thanke thee thanke thee ought lieth power take meaning praie thee excuſe mine ignorance ſeeing ſo great kindred thy ſiſter god haue good cauſe loue praiſe ſerue thee vnfeignedlie feare deſire anie thing ſaue thee onlie keepe well humblie praie thee aſke none brother friend helpe anie father haue anie pitie vpon child anie mother haue taken anie care hir ſonne anie brother haue hid ſinne ſiſter thou fourth chapter entier affection loue god towards ſinfull ſoule man neuer ſawe elſe kept wondrous ſecret euer anie huſband would thoroughlie forgiue wife ſhe offended returne vnto haue beene manie auenge wrong haue cauſed iudges put death beholding ſinnes ſpare owne hand kill alſo ſeeing fault appeare ſend home owne friend ſome perceiuing euill diſpoſitions haue ſhut vp priſon brieflie conclude vpon diuers complexion end pretence puniſhment leaſt harme euer could perceiue puniſhing would neuer ſee againe wiſh mind ſhould rather helpe turne forſake therfore god find man comparable vnto thee loue thou art perfect example therefore confeſſe lowlie hart haue broken thee mine oth promiſe ala thou hadeſt choſen thy wife didſt ſet vp great ſtate honour greater honour may one haue place thy wife ſweetelie taketh hir reſt ſo neere thee onlie ſuretie ſoule bodie alſo thy goodes queene miſtreſſe ladie great fauour ſo vile creature ſo ennobliſhed thee ſo honourable huſband ſpeake brieflie haue poſſeſſing thee anie man mortall deſire yet remember mine vnwoorthie deſeruing hart doth ſob ſigh mine eies let fall abundance teares mouth make manie exclamation neither new ancient writing ſhew ſo pitifull caſe ſame tell shall dare tell may pronounce without ſhame yea confuſion ſhew great loue huſband worſhip declare fault ſauiour waſt crucified croſſe ſinnes deede thine ſuch father leaue ſonne child offend mother ſiſter chide grudge ala fault ſuch far greater familiaritie haue thee benefit receiue thee greater mine offence thee diſſemble ſpeciallie ſhould ſo doo called thy ſpouſe loued thee thy ſoule shall tell truth ſpouſe haue left thee forgotten thee run awaie thee leaue thee go vaine pleaſure forſooke thee choſe another yea refuſed thee welſpring goodneſſe faithfull promiſe leaue thee whither went place nothing curſedneſſe haue left thee truſtie friend louer worthie beloued aboue others haue put thee aſide welſpring health ſomnes mine owne wretched yea haue forſaken thee full beautie goodneſſe wiſedome power ſought withdrawe thy loue haue accepted thy great enimies diuell world fleſh againſt whome ſake thou foughtedſt ſo ſore croſſe ſet libertie long time priſoner ſlaue ſo bound man could cauſe humble ſelfe loue charitie ſhould haue towards thee quench ſo name jeſus deare huſband found ſo ſweet tedious hatefull ſo oftentimes ieſt haue heard goſpell preached taught word haue hard hath tarried feather doth winde went neuer yet heare thy word preached faſhion onlie worke hypocriſie alſo annoied hard ſpeake thee becauſe willing go pleaſure brieflie conclude thou didſt forbid fulfilled thou commandedſt eſchue cauſe loued thee yet lord thus hate thee forſake thee ran awaie thee betraied thee ſhould giue place anie haſt thou ſuffered ſhould mocked either yet beaten killed haſt thou put darke priſon baniſhed euer ſetting naught haſt thou taken awaie thy gift pretious iewels againe puniſh vnfaithfull fruit haue loſt iointure thou promiſedſt mine owne offence done againſt thee accuſed thee afore eternall father naughtie woman haſt thou forbidden thy preſence haue deſerued ſhould neuer appeare thine houſe moſt true huſband pure perfect friend moſt louing among louers ala thou haſt done otherwiſe thou haſt diligentlie ſought going moſt deepe place hell euils done fartheſt thee hart mind directlie waie didſt thou louinglie call backe ſaieng deare daughter hearken ſee vow thine eare toward forget ſtrange nation whome thou haſt run aſtraie alſo houſe thine owne father thou haſt dwelt ſo long ſhall king faithfulneſſe deſire thy beautie thou lord ſaweſt thy ſweete gratious calling profit beganneſt thou crie lowd voice ſaieng come vnto wearilie loden labour ſhall plentiouſlie refreſh feed bread life ala ſweet lord vnto theſe ſweet word would hearken rather doubted whether thou ſo ſpake vnto elſe fabulous writing ſo ſaid ſo fooliſh without loue read thy word conſidered compariſon uineyard brought foorth thornes brier ſtead good fruit ſignified ſo done knew alſo thou didſt call barren wife ſaieng returne shulamite thou didſt ſpeake ſhould forſake ſinnes yet theſe word though vnderſtood neuer whit peruſed prophet ieremie confeſſe reading thereof feare hart baſhfulneſſe face tell yea teares mine eies lord thine honor ſuppreſſe pride thou haſt ſaid holie prophet woman haue offended hir huſband ſo left going aſtraie therevpon refuſeth hir ſhe eſteemed polluted value lawe doth conſent put hir hand iuſtice driue hir awaie ſo neuer take hir againe thou haſt made ſeparation betweene thy bed mine ſaith vnto placed forren louers roome committing fornication yet thou maiſt returne againe alwaies angrie againſt thee lift vp therfore thine eies looke thee euerie ſide ſhalt thou well ſee place thy ſinne hath lead thee filthilie thou lieſt earth poore ſoule looke thy ſinne hath put thee euen vpon high way thou didſt waite tarie beguile came euen theefe doth hidden wilderneſſe therefore thou fulfilling thy wicked pleaſure haſt fornication infected earth thee thine eies thy forehead thy face haue loſt good maner ſuch harlot hath yet thou hadeſt ſhame thy ſinne ſurplus ieremie ſaith conſtreineth knowe wretched life wiſh ſorowfull ſighes houre moneth daie yeare time life might haue end yeelding ſelfe condemned worthie lie euer euerlaſting fire ſame feare proceedeth thee ſelfe putteth rather hope deſpaire often remember ſinne ſoone thou knoweſt bowing vnder thine obedience putting liuelie faith thou didſt vſe great clemencie ſo knewe thee ſame lord maiſter king whome ought haue feared found feare quenched mixed loue beleeuing thou art ſo gratious gentle ſweete ſo pitifull huſband ſhould rather haue hid haue ſhewed ſelfe feare go foorth looke thee ſo ſeeking found thee didſt thou didſt thou refuſe lord rather haſt excuſed haſt thou turned thy face thine eie ſo ſweetlie penetrated hart wounding almoſt death giue remorſe ſinnes thou haſt put backe thy hand thine armes ſweet manlie hart thou didſt meete waie reprouing fault embracedſt could ſee beholding thy countenance euer thou didſt perceiue mine offence wherefore thou haſt done ſo much though neuer broken promiſe thee thou didſt hide fault euerie bodie giuing againe part thy bed alſo ſhewing multitude ſinnes ſo hidden ouercome thy great victorie thou wilt neuer remember ſo thou ſeeſt nothing grace gift vertues hath pleaſed thy free goodneſſe giue charitie moſt pretious ſee well thy goodneſſe doth conſume lewdneſſe maketh new godlie ioifull creature euill mine thou haſt deſtroied made ſo perfect creature good huſband wife thou haſt done giuing faithfull hope thy promiſes haue thy good grace recouered place thy wife happie deſired place gratious bed thou right honourable ſeate peace reſt warre high ſleepe honour ſeparate earth doeſt thou receiue vnworthie creature giuing hir ſcepter crowne thine empire glorious realme euer heare ſuch ſtorie raiſe vp one ſo high hir ſelfe nothing maketh great valure ſelfe naught fift chapter vnion death life faithfull ſoule chriſt ala caſting mine eies high ſee thy goodnes thine vnknowne grace thy loue ſo incomprehenſible ſight woonderfull beholding thee looking downeward might ſee willing ala ſee lewdeneſſe darkeneſſe extreme deepenes mine euils death humblenes cloſeth mine eie admirable goodneſſe thee vnſpeakable euill thy right highnes pure maieſtie right fragill mortall nature thy gift good beatitude malice great vnkindnes good art thou vnto vnking haue bene vnto thee thou wilt purſue thing conſidered cauſeth maruell pleaſeth thee ioine thy ſelfe ſeeing compariſon betweene v thou art god thy worke thou creator thy creature ſpeake brieflie though cannot define thee yet know ſelfe leaſt thing may compared vnto thee moſt happie loue thou madeſt agreement thou didſt ioine life death together ye vnion hath made aliue death life dieng life without end haue made death life death hath giuen vnto life quickning yt death dead may receiue life death rauiſhed aliue liue otherwiſe ſelf dead concerning bodelie death nothing comming priſon death life death aliue mortall life filleth full care ſorowe ſo death yeeldeth content godlie thing die ſoule may liue deliuering hir mortall death ſhe deliuered death miſerable matched hir moſt mightie louer ſoule blameleſſe faine would haue life yes trulie ought call death hir welbeloued friend ſweet death pleaſant ſorowe mightie king deliuering wickednes lord thoſe truſt thee thy death mortified hope haue thy paſſion thus ſweet ſleepe doſt thou put death cauſeth manie lament happie ſame ſleepe vnto awaketh doth find thy death life euerlaſting death none thing chriſtian man libertie deliuerance mortall band death fearefull wicked pleaſant acceptable good bicauſe death death deſtroied therefore god rightlie taught ſhould call death life end labour beginning euerlaſting ioie knowe long life doth let ſight thee death come doe thine office may ſee ſpouſe elſe ſweet loue tranſforme thee ſhall better tarie comming death ſweet lord let die may liue thee none deliuer thou onelie sauiour faith planted ioined thee vnion ſith faith aſſured thee may call thee father brother ſonne huſband father paternitie brother fraternitie child delectation ſpouſe coniunction father full humilitie brother hauing ſimilitude ſonne engendred faith loue huſband louing releeuing extremitie doſt thou loue ala ſhe thou haſt withdrawne ſnare wherin malice ſhe bound haſt put hir place name office daughter ſiſter mother wife sauiour great ſauour ſweetneſſe right pleaſant delectable ſoule hearing thy word ſhall cal thee without feare father brother child ſpouſe ſuch ſoule doubtleſſe may continuallie burne loue anie loue vnleſſe maner loue hath ſome euill condition anie pleaſure hereto compared anie honour may accounted ſhame yea anie profit equall moreouer conclude thing could earneſtlie loue ala vnfeinedlie loueth god reputeth theſe thing wordlie leſſe valure dunghill pleaſure profit honour world vanitie trifle vnto hath found god loue ſo profitable honourable abundant grace dare ſaie ſhe onlie ſufficeth hart godlie ſoule yeeldeth hir ſo conſtant ſhe neuer deſireth would haue whoſoeuer hath god ought accounteth thing ſuperfluous vaine thanked lord father faith haue gotten ſame loue wherfore ought ſatiſfied content haue thee father defence want fooliſhnes long youth haue thee brother ſuccour ſorowes wherein find end haue thee ſonne feeble age onlie ſtaie haue thee true faithfull huſband ſatiſfieng whole hart ſith haue thee doo forſake world holding thee faſt thou maieſt eſcape seeing haue poſſeſſed thee look vpon none thing might keepe backe beholding thy diuinitie seeing doo heare thee heare nothing letteth fruition thy voice seeing may freelie talke thee common none seeing pleaſeth thee put ſo neere thee rather die touch anie ſeeing ſerue thee ſerue none seeing thou haſt ioined thy hart mine depart thee let puniſhed euer departing thy loue harder damnation doo feare paine ten thouſand hel doo feare looſing thee ala god father creator doo thou ſuffer enimie inuenter ſinne haue anie power make mee looſe thy preſence whoſoeuer ſhall feele loſſe thy loue ſhall ſaie would rather bound euer hell feele paine thereof one moment time sauiour doo thou permit euer depart thee againe may pleaſe thee put ſuch place ſoule wantonneſſe ſinne neuer ſeparated thy loue ſixt chapter longing ſoule death feede chriſt world perfectlie haue deſire thing maketh mee feruentlie deſire departing bodie ſinne fearing death anie hir inſtruments feare ought haue god loue offered himſelfe ſuffered death debt dutie onlie bicauſe would ſake vnder power mortall death ieſus dead dead death ſhall liue meane thoſe faith partaker paſſion euen death great myſterie croſſe hard euerie man man feared therewith conſidering copulation bodie ſoule order loue agreement ſo ſorowes extreme departing one ſince hath pleaſed ſweet lambe offer himſelfe vpon croſſe great loue hath kindled fire within hart ſo vehement euerie true beleeuer eſteemeth paſſage death plaie paſtime ſo prouoketh conſtantlie die euen feare death doth retrograde v ſo ought loue giue v deſire die true loue vnfainedlie within hart man feele none thing bicauſe loue ſo ſtrong ſelfe ſhe keepeth room putteth deſires ſuffering nothing god onlie whereſoeuer true perfect loue remembred neither feare ſorowe yet owne pride attaine honour cauſeth v ſeeke death manie ſtrange way man haue fooliſh pleaſure putteth himſelfe ieopardie life merchant obtaine rich doth danger himſelfe ſomtime ſmall value theefe conceiuing roberie murther crueltie deceit doth ſo blind man doubteth nothing danger death neither yet miſfortune ſeeketh aduenge himſelfe doth euill furie ſickneſſe rankeneſſe melancholie cauſeth man fiercelie wiſh death oftentimes drowne hang kill themſelues euils ſometimes ſo great cauſe pained patient chooſe death libertie ſo theſe paine full euils imperfection cauſe feare hazard death rather thinke death tarieth long ala ought true laudable loue doo ought loue eternall creature wiſh ſhe ſtir hart ſuch wiſe ſhe maiſtered ſuch affection ſhould feele none thing hir ala yea death pleaſant thing ſoule loue god eſteemeth paſſage eaſie thorough ſhe commeth priſon hard waie ſhe commeth let hir embrace hir huſband sauiour good pleaſant ſame death ſhall haue end ſorowes ſhall enioie thy ſight without impediment tranſformed likeneſſe thy maieſtie death thy force truſt haue ſuch honour vpon knee crieng weeping dailie doo deſire therefore come quicklie make end ſorowes happie daughter right holie ſoules ioined citie ieruſalem open eies pitie looke vpon deſolation beſeech name ye doo ſhew vnto deere beſt beloued god friend king euerie houre daie doo languiſh preſence ſweet death come vnto louinglie bring vnto lord god death thy ſting dart ala baniſhed mine eies rigour changed ſweetneſſe ſeeing ſake friend ſuffer vpon croſſe whoſe death doth ſo encourage death wiſh followe ſeuenth chapter truſt ſoule hath merit hir redeemer againſt dread hell deſperation sith death ſo pleaſant pleaſeth feareth ought feare nothing onlie right iudgement god ſinnes iuſt ballance ſhall weied haue done openlie ſhall ſhewed thought word ſhall better knowne written roll wherefore may thinke charitie would offend iuſtice truth certaine whoſoeuer liueth vnfaithfullie ſhall puniſhed euerlaſting paine god iuſt iudgement righteous doth perfect thing conſidering mine owne righteouſneſſe wretch poore creature knowe work iuſt men ſo full imperfection afore god filthie mire vileneſſe concerning ſins haue committed whereof feele burden importable nothing elſe ſaie haue woon damnation end shall deſpaire comfort great ignorance ala god inuiſible faith cauſeth beleeue thing impoſſible man poſſible vnto thee ſo thou doo conuert worke nothing ſome good worke thine ſpeciallie faith lord ſhall condemne iudge damne sith thou art iudge art alſo father ſpouſe refuge ala father doth neuer condemne child alwaies doth excuſe defend perceiue haue none excuſer ieſus chriſt ſpouſe redeemer whoſe death hath reſtored loſt inheritance made himſelfe man lawe ſhewing ſo worthie merit afore father wherewith great debt ſo aboundantlie recompenſed iudgement nothing redeemer great loue find ſuch men lawe ſweete ieſus thee debtor yet doeſt thou praie ſpeake moreouer thou doeſt ſee poore aboundance thy good thou doeſt paie debt incomprehenſible ſea goodneſſe deare father doeſt thou vouchſafe iudge willing death ſinner ieſus chriſt crucifier ſauiour ſoule friend aboue friend thou man law didſt excuſe ſpeake thou couldſt iuſtlie haue accuſed mee feare therefore crueltie mine enimie lawe thee ſatiſfied paiment ſo made ſweete ſpouſe lawe aſke nothing paid beleeue hath taken ſinnes vpon hath giuen place owne goodes aboundance ſo sauiour thou preſenting thy vertues doeſt content lawe ſhe reproch ſinnes thou doeſt ſhew hir willinglie thine owne fleſh thou haſt taken diſcharge coniunction mariage alſo vpon croſſe thy paſſion thou haſt made ſatiſfaction morouer thine onlie charitie hath giuen thou haſt deſerued therefore ſeeing thy merite mine lawe aſke nothing feare iudgement deſire perforce tarrie time ſhall ſee iudge heare iuſt iudgement knowe thy iudgement iuſt fault therein though mine infidelitie woorthie ſuffer cruelneſſe hell onlie conſider deſeruing yet ſee nothing keepe fire hell true torment hell prepared diuell child anie man haue ſet minde like diuell ſenſuall appetite ought diuell paid like reward man contemplation ſoule hold thee angell counſell vertue perfection ſure obtaine heauen place thy deſeruing ſhall wicked puniſhed ſame puniſhment ought haue haue ioined themſelues ſith folowed satan muſt enioie ſuch place angel prepared conſidering diuerſitie ſorts little comforted ſpirit cannot denie like diuell angell light wherefore feare tremble angell pure perfect ſo vnpure vnperfect nothing like vnto thus confeſſe ſo like dooings ſo accuſtomed way paine torment ought partaker cruell ſinne hath bound hell ſo great force ſo ſtrong letteth nothing come neither feareth contrarie aſſault whoſe force lieth kind ſtrength knoweth ſtrength goeth awaie ſtronger commeth place could neuer yet ſee anie man merite paine taking could euer yet vanquiſh hell ſaue onlie great aſſault vnſpeakable charitie humbled himſelfe croſſe whereby hath vanquiſhed ouercome enimie robbed hell power ſo hath force ſtrength keepe ſoule putteth hir truſt god beleeuing great ſtrength ſauiour hath ſet hell ſinne ſinne haue hold vnles ſhew god mercifull ſtrong mightie puiſſant vanquiſher euils within hart ſinnes forgiueneſſe glorie moſt louing ſauiour ought alſo beleeue glorie increaſed loue planted graffed honour onlie doth honour rich doo repleniſh euerie one good death hell ſinne ouercome gluttonous hell thy defence thou cruell villaine ſinne thy tyrannous power death thy ſting victorie ſo much ſpoken inſtead death thou death giueſt life ſo doeſt thou contrarie thy alſo thou ſinne coueteſt drawe creature damnation thou giueſt ladder reach thereby godlie citie ieruſalem yet wouldſt thou thy curſed nature mine eternall maker ſhould looſe creature loue grace ſorie remembrance thine vncomlineſſe doth cauſe hir repentance againe come ſubmit hir ſelfe vnto god whoſe ineſtimable goodneſſe cauſeth thee looſe thy whole labour thou takeſt hand number thou pretendeſt haue thou ſhalt haue becauſe comfortable ſhadowe chriſt paſſion ſuch mightie protection ſoule needeth neither doubt death ſinne hell anie thing pull backe god willing gift faith drawe meane ſuch faith muſt needes haue obtaine high grace aboue alſo ſuch faith charitie doth ioine humble ſeruant maker ioined vnto ought haue feare trauell paine ſorowe whoſoeuer doth willinglie ſuffer anie maner death paine ſorowe truth chriſt ſhall feele ſuch torment great comfort conſolation ſoule knowing ſelf weake yet god right ſtrong comfort may thing loue ſo conſtant permanent varieth anie worldlie thing withdrawe grace surelie great height heauen depth hell breadth whole earth neither death ſinne dailie doth warre againſt ſeparate one minute great loue charitie heauenlie father ieſus chriſt hath vnto goodneſſe ſuch loueth hath time loued loue hun ſhall feele loue increaſe becauſe loue worthie loue deſire loue mine feele ſuch mine owne deſire loue loue inflameth hart heauenlie loue ſuch loue findeth himſelfe owne deede yeeldeth well content loue ſtrength thus contenting himſelfe loue doth increaſe deſire eight chapter incomprehenſible loue chriſt ſinfull ſoule benefit come true faith true louer fountaine welſpring charitie onlie purſe heauenlie treaſure ought thinke dare ſaie thou art may write anie mortall man comprehend thy goodneſſe loue thou print man hart expreſſe ſurelie capacitie man cannot comprehend vnmeaſurable goodneſſes thee naturall reaſon doth ſhew v compariſon betweene eternall mortall thing loue mortall ioined eternall mortall thing ſo filled eternall cannot find end thereof hath good thereby conteine hold therfore doth man thinke hath one ſparke loue god hath world therewith euen ſee sunne one onlie ſparke light doth blinde eie yet doth withhold great light ſhould aſke eie hath ſeene would ſaie hath beholden whole brightnes ſame neuertheleſſe ſo content ſeemeth vnto though ſo much light sunne conteineth ſaid ſparke able ſuffer euen ſo ſoule faith doth feele one ſparke loue god doth finde therewith heate ſo great maruellous ſo ſweet delicious impoſſible hit declare thing ſame loue little thereof ſhe hath felt doth yeeld hir mind ſatiſfied yet deſiring ſhe hath ynough thus doth ſhe liue languiſhing ſighing hir ſelfe hart doth feele hath receiued much hath conceiued ſuch deſire much alwaies deſireth receiue thing cannot haue neither worthie receiue knoweth good hath alreadie vnſpeakable yet would haue cannot ſkill trulie cannot feele thinke good lieth power tell thing loue god ſith haue knowledge feruentneſſe thereof thinketh haue loue within hart trulie declare thing happie therefore hath ſuch aboundance loue may ſaie god haue ynough hath loue within dare much boaſt thereof leaſt much ſpeaking looſe vnleſſe edifie neighbour ſaluation impoſſiblitie declaration loue ſhall make hold peace ſainct ſo perfect ſpeake loue high god goodnes ſweetnes grace thing elſe pertaine looking lowe ſhall find himſelfe vnworthy ſo ſtop mouth worme earth leſſe nothing ought ceaſe ſpeake incomparable highneſſe loue yet much vnkindneſſe noted written nothing hauing done vnto would ſatiſfie much better wit mine hee would hide goodneſſe god ſo good maiſter ſhould commit ſin worthie puniſhed euerlaſting paine therefore come happie paule haſt taſted ſo much ſame ſweet honnie beeing blind ſpace three day rapt vp third heaven ſatiſfie beſeech thee mine ignorance tell ſuch viſion thou haſt ſeene harken ſaith vnſpeakable highnes aboundant rich treaſure wiſdome knowledge god incomprehenſible iudgements vnſearchable way vnto weake wit holie paule thy word cauſe much maruell thou hauing knowledge ſo heauenlie ſecrets wouldeſt ſpeake leaſt yet tell thou thing may hope haue throgh ſuch godlie loue grace hath wrought giue eare vnto thy word neither hath eie ſeene yet eare heard neither yet hath euer entred hart man god hath prepared loue bleſſed paul yet thou haſt ſaid none purpoſe prouoke earneſtlie loue willing thy word thinke thou canſt none otherwiſe declare ſo giue mine hart patience hope thing neuer man yet could ſee yet deſerue although manie loue haue died excellent gift faith whereof ſo much good commeth cauſeth man poſſeſſe thing comprehend faith ioined truth bringeth foorth hope whereby perfect charitie engendred charitie god witneſſeth apoſtle haue charitie haue alſo god therewith god v commeth benefit faith dwelleth men haue true faith thus haue greater treaſure tell yet anie man expreſſe vnto v conclude ſith ſo great apoſtle paule ſpeake god ineſtimable loue according righteous example doctrine hold peace ſtill following neuertheleſſe teaching notwithſtanding though herein acknowledge ſelfe earth duſt yet may murther grant god wicked may haue power hurt beetraie neither ſuffer anie ſuch treaſon wickedneſſe proceed againſt thou god canſt mollifie ſuch tyrannous hart diſappoint ſuch cruell purpoſes beſeech almightie euerlaſting god giue thee moſt hartie thanks thou haſt beene ſo mercifull vnto ſpare mee behold ioifull daie acknowledge thou haſt dealt woonderfully thou didſt thy true faithfull ſeruant daniel prophet thou deliueredſt den crueltie greedie raging lion euen ſo ouerwhelmed onelie thee deliuered thee therfore onlie thanks honour praiſe euer euer amen reſt praiers belonging hir maieſtie vſe found beginning third lampe william cicill hauing taken much profit reading treatiſe following wisheth vnto euerie chriſtian reading thereof like profit increaſe god moſt gentle chriſtian reader keepe iudgment ſilence truſting report could haue mooued like preſent treatiſe woorthineſſe matter ſhall compell giue honour anie earthlie man would ſoone ſtirred ſee ſome myſterie magike practiſe alchumie perchance ſome inchantment element thou art chriſtened haſt woonderfull myſterie mercie god heauenlie practiſe regeneration ſpirituall inchantment grace god ioie triumph ſhewed king child ſheepe ioifull hauing ninetie nine ioie conſider returne ſtraie child almightie god whoſe returne teacheth ninetie nine come fold euen ſuch cauſe ioie angel heauen take comfort herein thou therefore ioifull noble child newlie borne ſhew thy ſelfe glad loſt ſheepe hath wonne whole flocke thou ſad wherein angel reioiſe maiſt thou ſee one kind may mooue thee woman degree may prouoke thee woman high eſtate birth made noble marriage moſt noble wiſedome godlie mightie king excellent queene famous henrie renowmed katherine wife king realmes refuſing world wherein ſhe loſt obtaine heauen wherein ſhe whereby ſhe may ſee remoouing ſuperſtition wherewith ſhe ſmothered imbrace true religion wherewith ſhe may reuiue fruit treatiſe good reader thine amendment onelie writer ſatiſfied good ladie thought thee warned profit may enſue theſe great myſteries grace well perceiued except ſurelie ſtudied neither perfectlie ſtudied except diligentlie practiſed neither profitablie practiſed without amendment see learne hereby ſhe hath doone maiſt thou practiſe amend thou canſt doo ſo ſhalt thou practiſe eaſe hauing guide amend profit hauing zeale eaſier ſee theſe learne begin eaſieſt come harder ſee thou hir confeſſion thou maieſt learne hir repentance practiſe hir perſeuerance thou maieſt haue like amendment deſpiſe thy ſelfe eſchewing vice thou maieſt pleaſe god asking grace let ſhame hinder confeſſion hindered offenſe thou ſure knowledge ſinnes god faithfull forgiue v clenſe v vnrighteouſnes obeie prophet ſaieng declare thy way lord thus far thou maiſt learne knowe thy ſelfe next thou diligent releeue thy ſelfe god mercie thou haſt beene reueale thy ſelfe thine owne repentance god hath concluded thing vnder ſinne bicauſe would haue mercie vpon hath alſo borne ſinnes bodie vpon tree ſuppoſe none would willinglie haue done therefore wretch caitife prince prince king king ſpeake manie pleaſant gentle word vnto alſo called ſo manie ſundrie time numbred yet notwithſtanding theſe great ſignes token loue would come vnto hid ſelfe ſight ſeeking manie crooked biwaies wherin walked ſo long cleane loſt ſight maruell woonder blind guide called ignorance dimmed ſo mine eies could neuer perfectlie get anie ſight faire goodlie ſtreight right way doctrine continuallie trauelled vncomfortablie foule wicked crooked peruerſe way yea bicauſe ſo much haunted manie could thinke walked perfect right waie hauing regard number walker order walking beleeuing alſo moſt aſſuredly companie haue walked heauen wheras moſt ſure would haue brought hell forſooke ſpirituall honouring true liuing god worſhipped viſible idol image made men hand beleeuing haue gotten heauen yea ſaie truth made great idole ſelfe loued ſelfe better god certainlie looke manie thing loued preferred hart god ſo manie taken eſteemed idol falſe god ala haue violated holie pure moſt high precept commandment loue god precept bindeth loue whole hart mind force ſtrength vnderſtanding like vnto euill wicked diſobedient child haue giuen power ſenſes contrarie making almoſt euerie earthlie carnall thing god furthermore bloud chriſt reputed ſufficient waſh filth ſinnes neither ſuch way appointed word ſought conceiue anie thing value cannot done ſo great iniurie diſpleaſure almightie god father tread vnder foote chriſt onlie begotten welbeloued ſonne ſinnes world gathered together one ſo heinous deteſtable ſight god wonder chriſt crucified god doth ſhewe himſelfe moſt noble glorious euen almightie god moſt louing father onlie deare choſen bleſſed ſonne therefore count ſelfe one moſt wicked miſerable ſinners world bicauſe haue beene ſo much contrarie chriſt ſauiour saint paule deſired knowe nothing chriſt crucified beene rapt third heauen heard ſuch ſecrets conuenient meete vtter men counted work doings nothing win chriſt moſt preſumptuouſlie thinking nothing chriſt crucified went ſet foorth mine owne righteouſneſſe ſaieng proud phariſie good lord thanke thee like men none adulterer fornicator ſo foorth ſuch like word vaine glorie extolling ſelfe deſpiſing others working hired ſeruant wage elſe reward louing child onlie verie loue without reſpect wage reward ought haue redemption hart ſo ſtonie hard great benefit neuer trulie liuelie printed hart although word oft rehearſed thinking ſelfe ſufficientlie inſtructed ſame deede blinde ignorance yet ſtoode ſo well mine owne iudgement opinion thought vaine ſeeke increaſe knowledge therein paule calleth chriſt wiſdome god euen ſame chriſt fooliſhneſſe pride blindneſſe deceiued hardneſſe hart withſtoode groning truth within fruit carnall humane reaſons haue rotten ignorance price ripe ſeaſonable knowledge ſuch alſo malice wickedneſſe poſſeſſeth hart men ſuch wiſdome pleaſing fleſh profeſſed chriſt baptiſme began liue ſwarued baptiſme continuance liuing euen heathen neuer begun chriſt innocent void ſinne wallowed filthie ſinne free ſinne chriſt obedient vnto father euen death croſſe diſobedient moſt ſtubborne euen confuſion truth chriſt meeke humble hart moſt proud vaineglorious chriſt deſpiſed world vanity therof make god becauſe vanity chriſt came ſerue brother coueted rule ouer chriſt deſpiſed worldlie honour much delighted attaine ſame chriſt loued baſe ſimple thing world eſteemed moſt faire pleaſant thing chriſt loued pouertie wealth chriſt gentle mercifull poore hardharted vngentle chriſt praied enimies hated mine chriſt reioiced conuerſion ſinners greeued ſee reuerſion ſinne declaration creature may perceiue far chriſt without chriſt yea contrarie chriſt although bare name chriſtian inſomuch anie man ſaid beene without chriſt would haue ſtiffelie denied withſtoode ſame yet deede neither knew chriſt wherefore came concerning effect purpoſe comming certaine vaine blind knowledge cold dead may ſinne doth plainelie appeare confeſſion open declaration ſecond chapter lamentation ſinner hartie repentance faith obtaine abſolution remiſſion merit christ cauſe haue lament ſigh weepe life time ſo euill ſpent much humilitie lowlineſſe ought come knowledge ſinnes god giuing thanks hath pleaſed aboundant goodneſſe giue time repentance knowe ſinnes conſideration ſo greeuous number ſo exceeding haue deſerued verie often eternall damnation deferring god wrath ſo manifoldlie due muſt vnceſſantlie giue thanks mercie god beſeeching alſo ſame delaie puniſhment cauſe plague ſorer ſince mine owne conſcience condemneth former doings mercie exceedeth iniquitie ſhould thus hope ala ſhould ſeeke refuge comfort mortall man power help multitude ſinnes dare lift vp mine eies heauen ſeate iudgement haue ſo much offended god shall fall deſperation naie call vpon chriſt light world fountaine life reliefe carefull conſciences peacemaker betweene god man onlie health comfort true repentant ſinners almightie power ſaue deliuer miſerable ſtate hath mercie ſaue euen whole ſin world haue hope confidence anie creature neither heauen earth chriſt whole onlie sauiour came world ſaue ſinners heale ſicke ſaid whole haue neede phyſician behold lord come thee ſinner ſicke grieuouſlie wounded aſke bread crums fall childrens table caſt thy ſight although haue deſerued caſt hell fire ſhould looke vpon ſinne vpon thy mercie ſhould deſpaire ſelfe find nothing ſaue dunghill wickedneſſe condemne ſhould hope mine owne ſtrength power come maze iniquitie wickedneſſe wherein haue walked ſo long ſhould deceiued ſo ignorant blind weake feeble bring ſelfe intangled wayward maze ſeeke mean way winde ſelfe wrapped tangled therein perceiue ſtriuing therein hinderance trauell labour ſpent going backe hand lord bring endleſſe maze death without preuented grace lord aſke forgiueneſſe repentant ſorie man auow chriſt onlie sauiour world holie ghoſt yea paule ſaith man ſaie lord ieſus holie ghoſt ſpirit helpeth infirmitie maketh continuall interceſſion v ſuch ſorowfull gronings expreſſed therefore firſt require praie lord giue holie ſpirit teach auow chriſt sauiour world vtter theſe word lord ieſus finallie helpe mine infirmity intercede intreate moſt certaine ſure creature heauen earth power anie meane helpe god omnipotent almightie beneficiall mercifull welwilling louing thoſe call put whole confidence truſt therefore ſeeke none meanes aduocate chriſtes holie ſpirit onlie aduocate mediatour betweene god man helpe releeue mee third chapter vvhat true faith worketh ſoule ſinner maketh ſo bold hardie preſume come lord ſuch audacitie boldneſſe ſo great ſinner trulie nothing owne word ſaith come ye labour burdened ſhall refreſh gentle mercifull comfortable word theſe ſinners frantike madde beaſtlie fooliſh man would runne aide helpe refuge anie creature moſt gratious comfortable gentle ſaieng ſuch pleaſant ſweete word allure verie enimies come vnto anie worldlie prince magiſtrate would ſhew ſuch clemencie mercie diſobedient rebellious ſubiects hauing offended ſuppoſe would ſuch word allure except call whome cannot take puniſh taken euen chriſt prince prince lord lord ſo charitie mercie exceedeth ſurmounteth others chriſt ſaith carnall father giue good gift child aſke much ſhall heauenlie father ſubſtance holie moſt highlie good giue good gift aſke ſmall little gift require neither thinke ſelfe worthie receiue ſuch noble gift ſo ingrate vnkind wicked child behold benignitie liberalitie mercie goodneſſe lord encouraged boldened ſtirred aſke ſuch noble gift lord ſo bountifull liberall haue v ſatiſfied contented one gift neither aſke ſimple ſmall gift therefore promiſeth bindeth himſelfe word giue good beneficiall gift aſke true faith without nothing done acceptable pleaſing god faith foundation ground gift vertues grace therefore praie ſaie lord increaſe faith life euerlaſting lord muſt beleeue thee true god thou didſt ſend ieſus chriſt faith aſſured aſſurance feele remiſſion ſins maketh bold comforteth quencheth deſpaire knowe lord thine eies looke vpon faith paule ſaith iuſtified faith chriſt deed lawe righteouſnes come lawe chriſt died vaine paule meaneth dead humane hiſtoricall faith gotten humane induſtrie ſupernall liuelie faith worketh charitie himſelfe plainlie expreſſeth dignitie faith derogation good work faith ſpring good work yet may impute woorthineſſe faith work iuſtification god aſcribe giue woorthineſſe wholie merit chriſts paſſion refer attribute knowledge perceiuing thereof onlie faith whoſe verie true onlie propertie take apprehend hold faſt promiſes god mercie maketh v righteous cauſe continuallie hope ſame mercie loue worke maner way allowed scripture may thankfull ſame thus feele ſelfe come new garment god mercie taken iuſt righteous late without mercie ſinfull wicked faith obteine mercie vnfaithfull enioie although iohn extolleth charitie epiſtle ſaieng god charitie dwelleth charitie dwelleth god truelie charitie maketh men liue like angel moſt furious vnbrideled carnall men maketh meeke lambes yea feruent ſpirit ought call crie praie lord make great charitie burne flame hart ſtonie euill affected neuer would conceiue regard great ineſtimable charitie loue god ſending onlie begotten deere beloued ſonne vale miſerie ſuffer moſt cruell ſharpe death croſſe redemption yea neuer vnſpeakeable moſt high charitie abundant loue god printed fixed hart duelie till pleaſed god meere grace mercie pittie open mine eies making ſee behold eie liuelie faith chriſt crucified mine onelie sauiour redeemer began perceiue ſee mine owne ignorance blindneſſe cauſe thereof would learne knowe chriſt sauiour redeemer god meere goodneſſe thus opened mine eies made ſee behold chriſt wiſedome god light world ſupernaturall ſight faith pleaſures vanity honor rich wealth aid world began waxe bitter vnto knew illuſion diuell falſe ne humane doctrine receiued ſuch ſucceſſe came thereof deteſtation horrour erſt ſo much loued eſteemed god forbidden ſhould loue world vaine pleaſures ſhadowes ſame began perceiue chriſt onlie sauior redeemer ſame doctrine diuine holie heauenlie infuſed grace hart faithfull neuer attained hnmane doctrine wit reaſon although ſhould trauell labour ſame end world began dwell god charitie knowing louing charitie god remiſſion ſinnes god charitie iohn ſaith faith whereby came knowe god whereby pleaſed god euen bicauſe truſted iuſtifie ſprang excellent charitie hart thinke leſſe manie woonder maruell ſaieng neuer knewe chriſt sauiour redeemer vntill time many haue opinion ſaieng knoweth chriſt chriſtian doth confeſſe sauiour thus beleeuing dead humane hiſtoricall faith knowledge haue learned ſcholaſticall bookes true infuſed faith knowledge chriſt may ſaid ſinne vſe ſaie owne experience themſelues faith doth iuſtifie true except haue faith haue declared ſhall neuer iuſtified yet falſe faith onlie ſure iuſtified euen cauſe ſo manie impugne office dutie true faith bicauſe ſo manie lacke true faith euen faithfull forced allow true faith ſo vnfaithfull wiſe probablie intreate thereof one feeling himſelfe ſaith hauing ſaie haue certeinlie curious learning defend matter withall ſimple zeale earneſt loue truth inſpired god promiſeth powre ſpirit vpon fleſh haue grace god moſt humblie honour felt ſelfe true fourth chapter great loue god towards mankind inward beholding chriſt crucified let v therfore praie faith behold conſider great charitie goodneſſe god ſending ſonne ſuffer death redemption mortall enimies ſort maner ſent firſt conſidered yea vndoubtedlie perfect faith beleeued god ſent v freelie giue ſold noble rich gift could haue giuen ſent ſeruant friend onlie ſonne ſo deerelie beloued delight rich honour croſſes pouerties ſlanders lord ſeruant yea moſt vile painefull paſſions waſh v water owne pretious bloud mire puddle filth iniquity hath giuen make v poore enrich v diuine vertues merit grace yea hath giuen v good thing finallie himſelfe ſuch great charitie expreſſed moſt high abundant charitie god ſend chriſt ſhed bloud looſe honour life enimies euen time done moſt iniurie firſt ſhewed charitie v ſuch flame loue greater could ſhewed god chriſt hath opened vnto v although weake blind ſelues may behold miſerable eſtate great wiſedome goodneſſe truth godlie perfection chriſt therefore inwardlie behold chriſt crucified vpon croſſe beſt godlieſt meditation may ſee alſo chriſt crucified beautie ſoule better bookes world liuelie faith ſeeth feeleth ſpirit chriſt ſonne god dead ſatiſfieng purifieng ſoule ſhall ſee ſoule appointed verie tabernacle manſion ineſtimable incomprehenſible maieſtie honour god ſee alſo chriſt crucified vaine fooliſh world chriſt moſt wiſe deſpiſed ſame ſee alſo blind becauſe ſame knoweth chriſt perſecuteth ſee alſo vnkind world killing chriſt time ſhew moſt fauour hard obſtinate would mollified ſo manie teares ſuch ſweate ſo much bloudſhead ſonne god ſuffering ſo great high charitie therefore verie blind ſeeth vaine fooliſh falſe ingrate cruell hard wicked euill world may alſo chriſt crucified weigh ſinnes diuine ballance greeuous weightie ſeeing haue crucified chriſt would neuer haue beene counterpaiſed great pretious weight bloud ſonne god therefore god high goodneſſe determined bleſſed ſonne ſhould rather ſuffer bloudſhead thau ſinnes ſhould haue condemned v ſhall neuer knowe owne miſerie wretchedneſſe light chriſt crucified ſhall ſee owne crueltie feele mercie owne vnrighteouſneſſe iniquitie ſee righteouſnes holineſſe therefore learne knowe trulie owne ſinnes ſtudie booke crucifixe continuall conuerſation faith haue perfect plentifull charitie learne firſt faith charitie god towards v may ſee alſo chriſt vpon croſſe great paine hell bleſſed ioies heauen ſharpe painefull thing ſhall ſweet happie glorious ioie chriſt ſhall depriued crucifixe booke wherein god hath included thing hath moſt compendiouſlie written therein truth profitable neceſſarie ſaluation therefore let v endeuour ſelues ſtudie booke lightened ſpirit god may giue thanks ſo great benefit fift chapter glorious victory chriſt ouer enimies looke booke ſhall ſee chriſts great victorie vpon croſſe ſo noble mightie neuer neither ſhall ſuch victorie glorie worldlie prince great becauſe ouercome great hoſtes men much chriſtes greater vanquiſhed onelie prince world enimies god triumphing ouer perſecution iniuries villanies ſlanders yea death world ſinne diuell brought confuſion carnall prudence prince world neuer fight without ſtrength world chriſt contrarilie went warre euen againſt ſtrength world fought dauid golias vnarmed humane wiſdome policie without worldlie power ſtrength neuertheleſſe fullie repleniſhed armed whole armour ſpirit one battell ouercame euer enimies neuer ſo glorious ſpoile neither rich noble chriſt vpon croſſe deliuered elect ſuch ſharpe miſerable captiuitie battell manie ſtripes yea loſt life victorie ſo much greater therfore looke vpon ſonne god ſupernaturall faith light ſo vnarmed naked giuen vp alone humilitie patience liberalitie modeſtie gentleneſſe diuine vertues beating downe ground god enimies making ſoule man ſo faire beautifull forced ſaie victorie triumph maruellous therefore chriſt well deſerued haue noble title iesvs nazareth king iewes particularlie vnfold ſee great victory let v firſt behold ouercame ſinne innocencie confounded pride humilitie quenched worldlie loue charitie appeaſed wrath father meekeneſſe turned hatred loue ſo manie benefit godlie zeale chriſt hath onlie ouercome ſinne rather hath killed ſame aſmuch hath ſatiſfied himſelfe moſt holie ſacrifice oblation pretious bodie ſuffering moſt bitter cruell death alſo another ſort giueth thoſe loue ſo much ſpirit grace vertue ſtrength may reſiſt impugne ouercome ſinne conſent neither ſuffer reigne hath alſo vanquiſhed ſinne becauſe hath taken awaie force ſame hath cancelled lawe euill men occaſion ſinne therefore ſinne hath power againſt holie ghoſt vnited chriſt nothing worthie damnation although dreg adam remaine concupiſcences deede ſinnes neuertheleſſe imputed ſinnes trulie planted chriſt true chriſt might haue taken awaie immoderate affection hee hath left great glorie father owne greater triumph example prince fighteth enimies ſometime ſouereigntie ouer people ſubduing may kill yet preſerueth ſaueth whereas lord ouer people maketh ſerue whome ruled ſuch caſe prince doth ſhew himſelfe greater conquerour hath made ruler obeie ſubiects lord ouer whome ſerued vtterlie deſtroied vpon conqueſt leaueth continuall victorie whome redeemed whereas otherwiſe occaſion victorie taken awaie none left ſubiects euen ſo like caſe chriſt hath left v theſe concupiſcences intent ſhould ſerue v exerciſe vertues firſt reigne ouer v exerciſe ſinne may plainelie ſeene whereas firſt ſuch impediment v could moue ſelues towards god chriſt haue ſo much ſtrength notwithſtanding force may aſſuredlie walke heauen although child god ſometime fall fariltie ſome ſinne yet falling maketh humble themſelues reknowledge goodneſſe god come refuge helpe likewiſe chriſt death hath ouercome prince diuels hoaſt hath deſtroied paule ſaith verified chriſt ſhould breake serpent head propheſied god although diuell tempt v yet faith planted chriſt ſhall periſh rather temptation take great force might euident triumph victorie glorie chriſt greater hauing ſuch ſort ſubdued diuell whereas prince lord world holding creature captiuitie chriſt vſeth inſtrument puniſh wicked exerciſe make ſtrong elect god chriſtian warfare chriſt likewiſe hath ouercome death glorious manner poſſible becauſe hath taken awaie leauing vniuerſallie ſubiect ſame hath giuen ſo much vertue ſpirit whereas afore paſſed thereto great feare bold ſpirit ſure hope reſurrection receiue ioie bitter ſweete feared deſired death life alſo hath pleaſed god infirmity aduerſities remaine ſight world child god chriſt made ſo ſtrong righteous whole ſound trouble world comfort ſpirit paſſions fleſh medicine ſoule maner thing worke commoditie profite ſpirit feele god father doth gouerne diſpoſeth thing benefit therefore feele themſelues ſure perſecution quiet peacefull trouble without weerineſſe feares anxiety ſuſpicions miſeries finallie good euill world worketh commoditie moreouer ſee triumph chriſt hath beene ſo great onelie hath ſubdued vanquiſhed enimies power hath ouerthrowne vanquiſhed ſuch ſort thing ſerue helth might could haue taken awaie ſhould haue beene victorie palme crowne dailie haue fight fleſh ſuccour grace haue continuall victory ouer ſinne whereby haue cauſe glorifie god ſonne hath weakened enimie diuell ſpirit giueth v ſtrength vanquiſh ofſpring doo knowledge dailie great triumph sauiour reioice owne fight wiſe impute anie wiſdome world ſeeing ſinne increaſe worldlie wiſedome moſt gouerneth moſt ſinne ruleth world enimie god ſo alſo wiſdome therof aduerſe god therefore chriſt hath declared diſcouered ſame fooliſhneſſe although could haue taken awaie worldlie wiſedome yet hath left greater glorie triumph choſen veſſels whereas ruler againſt god chriſt ſerued god ſlaue worldlie thing albeit ſupernaturall thing ſame vnderſtood anie time men would impugne gainſaie v wiſedome world yet haue chriſt ſo much ſupernaturall light truth make mocke thoſe repugne truth chriſt alſo vpon croſſe hath triumphed ouer world firſt bicauſe hath diſcouered ſame naught whereas couered vaile hypocriſie veſture morall vertues chriſt hath ſhewed god ſight righteouſneſſe world wickedneſſe hath yeelded witnes work men regenerated faith euill ſo chriſt hath iudged condemned world naught hath giuen ſo much light ſpirit knowe diſpraiſe ſame yea tread vnder foot vaine honour dignity pleaſures taking faire promiſes neither offer doth preſent naie rather make ſcorne threatnings force world nothing feare therefore may ſee great victorie triumph chriſt hath deliuered thoſe father gaue power diuell cancelling vpon croſſe writing debt hath deliuered v condemnation ſinne bondage lawe feare death danger world euils life come hath inriched v made v noble moſt highlie happie ſuch glorious triumphant waie tongue expreſſed therefore forced ſaie triumph maruellous alſo ſeene knowne chriſt true meſſias hath deliuered man euils man hath goodneſſe ſo true meſſias therefore helper vaine counterfeited ſauiours ſeeing meſſias chriſt wholie onlie deliuered euils haue goodneſſe true euident cleare bicauſe verie true chriſtian chriſtian chriſt true chriſtian feeleth inwardlie chriſt ſo much goodneſſe god euen troublous life death ſweet vnto miſeries happie true chriſtian chriſt diſburdened ſeruitude lawe hauing lawe grace grauen ſpirit inhabiting hart ſinne reigned power infernall ſpirits damnation euerie euill made ſonne god brother chriſt heire heauen lord world ſo chriſt chriſt poſſeſſeth good thing let v knowe chriſt yet fighteth ſpirit elect veſſels ſhall fight euen daie iudgment day ſhall great enimie death wholie deſtroied ſhall ſhall child god reioice ſaieng death thy victorie ſting ſhall trouble ſinne naie rather none euill heauen good hell wicked ſhall wholie diſcouered victorie triumph chriſt paule ſhall preſent vnto father kingdome together choſen ſaued little fauour towards child chriſt choſen god ſaue v elect ſo highlie waie croſſe paule calleth grace moſt ſingular grace may well thinke hauing beene world ſo valiant captaine god full light grace vertue ſpirit therefore might iuſtlie ſaie conſummatum eſt wee ſeeing triumph victorie captaine chriſt ſo maruellous glorious noble war appointed let v force ſelues folowe bearing croſſe may haue felowſhip kingdome ſixt chapter ought ſubmit ſelues ſchoole croſſe ſtill looke learne booke crucifix trulie may moſt iuſtlie verified behold chriſt crucified ſpirit beſt meditation certeinlie neuer knew mine owne miſeries wretchednes ſo well booke admonition learning haue done looking ſpirituall booke crucifix lament much haue paſſed ſo manie yeeres regarding diuine booke iudged thought ſelfe well inſtructed ſame wheras opinion god would ſuffer liue thouſand yeeres ſhould ſtudie continuallie ſame diuine booke ſhould filled contemplation thereof neither hold ſelfe contented alwaies haue great deſire learne ſtudie therein neuer knewe mine owne wickednes neither lamented ſinnes trulie vntill time god inſpired grace looked booke began ſee perfectlie mine owne power ſtrength could helpe lord hand euen claie potter hand began crie ſaie ala lord euer haue ſo wickedlie offended thee beginning ſo gratious ſo good father moſt ſpeciallie haſt declared ſhewed thy goodneſſe vnto time haue done thee moſt iniurie call alſo make knowe take thee sauior redeemer wonderfull work god call ſinners repentance make take chriſt welbeloued ſonne sauior gift god chriſtians required deſired except great benefit chriſt crucified felt fixed ſurelie man hart good worke done acceptable god chriſt fulneſſe godhead hid treaſures wiſdome knowledge euen water life whereof whoſoeuer ſhall drinke ſhall neuer thirſt ſhall well water ſpringing vp euerlaſting life paule ſaith damnation chriſt walke fleſh ſpirit moreouer ſaith enimies reconciled god death ſon much ſeeing reconciled ſhall preſerued death little ſmall benefit haue receiued chriſt conſider hath done v haue perfectlie declared heretofore wherefore praie lord great benefit chriſt crucified may ſtedfaſtlie fixed printed chriſtians hart may true louers god worke child loue ſeruants compelled threatenings prouoked hire ſincere pure louers god doo embrace chriſt ſuch feruencie ſpirit reioice hope bold danger ſuffer aduerſitie continue praier bleſſe perſecutors wiſe owne opinion neither high minded proſperitie neither abaſhed aduerſitie humble gentle alwaies men knowe faith member one bodie haue poſſeſſed one god one faith one baptiſme one ioie one ſaluation theſe pure ſincere louers god thicke ſowne ſhould ſo much contention ſtrife growing field religion well ſhall praie lord take contention ſtrife awaie ſowers ſedition may haue mind ceaſe labour ſowe among ſtones haue grace ſowe gratious vertues may take roote bring foorth fruit ſending alſo godlie vnitie concord amongſt chriſtians may ſerue lord true holineſſe life ſeuenth chapter christian bewailing miſerable ignorance blindneſſe men example good liuing required chriſtians ſpeciallie eccleſiaſticall paſtors ſhepheards called ſcripture workemen god diſburſers god ſecrets light world ſalt earth whoſe hand ſhould take comfort working knowledge god ſight become child light taſte ſeaſonable wiſdome haue ſhould haue holie ſpirit abundantlie pronounce ſet foorth word god veritie truth ignorance blindneſſe reigne amongſt v ſhould truth god word inſtruct ſet v truth direct v waie lord thanks giuen vnto lord hath ſent v ſuch godlie learned king theſe latter day reigne ouer v vertue force god word hath taken awaie vailes miſts errours brought v knowledge truth light god word ſo long hid kept vnder people nigh famiſhed hungred lacke ſpirituall food charitie ſpirituall curats ſhepheards moſes moſt godlie wiſe gouernour king hath deliuered v captiuitie bondage pharao meane moſes king henrie eight moſt ſouereigne fauourable lord huſband one moſes figured anie mo chriſt excellent grace god meete expreſſed veritie moſes conqueſt ouer pharao meane pharao biſhop rome hath beene greater perſecutor true chriſtians euer pharao child iſrael perſecutor goſpell grace ſetter foorth ſuperſtition counterfeit holineſſe bringing manie ſoules hell alchimie counterfeit monie deceiuing poore ſoules vnder pretence holineſſe ſo much greater ſhall damnation bicauſe deceiueth robbeth vnder chriſts mantell lord keepe defend men iuglings ſleits ſpeciallie poore ſimple vnlearned ſoules leſſon would men begin miſlike dooing onlie begin like god certeinlie ſpirituall paſtors ſhepherds thinke cleaue ſticke word god euen death vanquiſh god enimies neede ſhall require reſpects honour dignitie rich welth priuate commodity laid apart following alſo example chriſt choſen apoſtles preaching teaching ſincere holeſome doctrine ſuch thing make peace godly leſſons wherewith may edifie others euerie man may walke vocation holineſſe life vnitie concord vnitie deſired true chriſtians much lamented ſchiſmes variety contention diſputations haue beene world chriſtian religion agreement concord ſame among learned men trulie diuell hath beene ſower ſeede ſedition ſhall mainteiner euen till god fulfilled war ſo cruell euill war ſword killeth body ſlaieth manie ſoules poore vnlearned perſons remaine confuſed almoſt euerie one beleeueth worketh owne waie yet one truth god word ſhall ſaued happie receiue moſt vnhappie neglect perſecute ſame ſhall eaſie sodom gomor daie iudgement without iuſt cauſe conſider beneuolence goodneſſe mercie god hath declared charitie towards v greater ineſtimable euer hebrues liued vnder ſhadowes figure bound lawe chriſt greateſt enimies hath deliuered v bondage lawe hath fulfilled figured lawe alſo propheſies ſheading owne pretious bloud make v child father brother hath made v free ſetting v godlie libertie meane licence ſinne manie glad interpret ſame chriſtian libertie godlie intreated trulie good ſpirit moueth men find fault euerie thing thing may well taken peruert euill ſenſe meaning world manie ſpeakers holines good work verie rare ſeldome declared good holie work work ſpirit neuer almoſt ſpoken therefore verie knowe able iuſtifie ignorance people great matter alone manie moſt neceſſarie chriſtians knowe becauſe haue iuſt proofe ſame maketh thus much ſaie little ſorowe greefe hart ſuch miſerable ignorance blindneſſe amongeſt people doubt ſaie lord lord feare god may ſaie vnto v people honoureth lip hart far god deſireth nothing hart ſaith worſhipped ſpirit truth chriſt condemned hypocriſie feigned holines taught ſincere pure true godlineſſe worſſe frantike blinde followe chriſts doctrine truſt men doctrine iudgements ſaiengs dimmeth eies ſo blind leadeth blind fall dich trulie ſimple vnlearned iudgement man doctrine eſteemed preferred like vnto chriſts apoſtles taught perfect true doctrine euen doth accord agree doctrine goſpell yet thoſe called ſpirituall paſtours although moſt carnall doth verie euidentlie plainelie appeare fruites ſo blinded loue themſelues world extoll men inuentions doctrine doctrine goſpell able mainteine owne inuentions doctrine anie iot ſcripture moſt cruellie perſecute contrarie ſame ſuch louers chriſt naie naie louers wicked mammon neither regarding god honour filthie lucre hath made almoſt mad frantike doubtleſſe miſerable ſtate ſpirituall men world much lamented good chriſtians yet cannot allowe neither praiſe kind lamentation ſuch may ſtand chriſtian charitie eight chapter fruites rule true christianitie men followe charitie ſuffereth long gentle enuieth vpbraideth man caſteth frowardlie fault men teeth referreth thing god angrie without ſinne reforming others without ſlanders carrieng euer ſtorehouſe mild word pearce ſtonieharted men would chriſtians like haue profeſſed chriſt would ſo endeuour themſelues folowe godlie liuing haue put chriſt liue anie ſelues vanity delightes pleaſures world fleſh ſuffering concupiſcence carnalitie fleſh haue full ſwinge muſt walke ſpirit fleſh ſpirit ſpirituall coueteth ſpirituall thing fleſh carnall deſireth carnall thing men regenerate chriſt deſpiſe world vanity pleaſures thereof louers themſelues feele euill infirme able anie good thing without helpe god whome knowledge goodneſſe proceede flatter themſelues thinking euerie thing ſhineth world good holie knowe externe outward work neuer ſo glorious faire world may done euill well good therefore haue verie little eſtimation outward ſhew holineſſe becauſe ſpirituall caſting vp eies vpon heauenlie thing neither looking regarding earthlie thing vile abiect haue alſo ſimplicitie doue policie ſerpent ſimplicitie haue deſire good men hurt man though haue occaſion giuen policie giue miniſter anie iuſt cauſe anie man whereby doctrine might reproued alſo reede ſhaken euerie winde blaſted tempeſts ſtormes world remaine moſt firme ſtable quiet feeling ſpirit god beſt father doth ſend ſuffer thing benefit commoditie chriſt rule line example chriſtian life neuer offended anie thing although occaſion miniſtred vnto like chriſt peter would haue withdrawne death anſwered ſaid go backe sathan thou offendeſt much lieth thee thou giueſt occaſion thy word make withdrawe ſelfe death although yeelded thereto thy procurement extinguiſh burning deſire haue ſhed bloud choſen euen ſo perfect men neuer offended anie thing although world full ſinne would withdrawe themſelues good waxe cold loue lord much leſſe would moued euill yea rather ſo much moued good regenerated chriſt neuer offended work god becauſe knowe faith god doth thing well erre neither want power ignorance malice knowe almightie ſeeth thing moſt aboundantlie good ſee feele ſpirit moſt highlie perfect proceede moſt perfecte work likewiſe offended work men bee good moued take occaſion folowe reknowledge goodnes god giuing thanks praiſing name dailie indifferent ſuch may done good euill intent iudge beſt part thinking may bee done good purpoſe ſo bee edified bee ſo euill bee taken good part anie meanes yet bee offended although occaſion bee giuen naie rather edified aſmuch take occaſion better though contrarie bee miniſtred begin thinke ſaie thus god preſerued grace ſhould haue committed ſin worſſe much bound confeſſe knowledge goodneſſe god go alſo thinking ſaieng hath ſinned may one god elect peraduenture lord hath ſuffered fall intent may better knowe himſelfe knowe one chriſt hath ſhed bloud one chriſtian brother trulie admoniſh rebuke caſe find deſperate comfort ſhewe great goodneſſe mercie god chriſt godlie conſolations ſee lift vp thus ye may ſee men regenerated chriſt euerie thing win receiue fruit ninth chapter fruit infidelitie offence weakelings contrariwiſe yonglings vnperfect offended ſmall trifle taking euerie thing euill part grudging murmuring againſt neighbor ſo much ſhew themſelues feruent ſo iudged blind world themſelues great zealebearers god greateſt euill theſe yonglings moſt euill feare ſo blind ignorant offended alſo good thing iudge nothing good ſuch embrace eſteeme bee good murmuring againſt ſuch folowe way anie ſort lord giue light truth may increaſe growe godlie ſtrength ſuppoſe ſuch yonglings vnperfect ſeene chriſt diſciples eate meate vnwaſhen hand haue faſted phariſies would haue beene offended ſeeing breaker men tradition affection diſpoſe eies ſee men ſee nothing themſelues charitie although moſt ful eies ſee fault others whome coueteth amend thinketh none euill diſcreetlie rightlie interpreteth thing iuſtlie trulie euerie thing taken theſe ſuperſtitious weakling conuerſant chriſt ſeene leade life ſometime woman ſometime samaritanes publicanes ſinners phariſies would haue murmured alſo ſeene marie powre vpon chriſt pretious ointment would haue ſaid iudas ointment might haue beene ſold giuen poore alſo ſeene chriſt whip driue temple thoſe bought ſold would foorthwith haue iudged chriſt haue beene troubled moued anger zeale charitie would haue beene offended ſeene go iewes feaſt heale ſicke man vpon ſabboth daie practiſe woman samaria yea ſhew vnto hir moſt diuine doctrine life would haue taken occaſion haue hated perſecuted scribe phariſies euen ſo ſhould chriſt sauiour world haue beene offence ruine kind little one vnperfecte offended ſort maner ſee one reputed eſteemed holie commit ſinne forthwith learne woorſe waxe cold dooing good confirme themſelues euill excuſe wicked life publiſhing ſame ſlander neighbor anie man reprooue ſaie man woorſe euident ſuch perſons would denie chriſt ſawe men doe ſame went rome ſawe enormity prelate ſaid reigne among doubt ſawe one ſinne reputed taken holie faith ſhould loſt faith chriſt neuer poſſeſſed ſhould looſe humane opinion goodneſſe prelate faith chriſt holie ghoſt ſhould witnes vnto ſhould mightie caſe world would denie chriſt yet would remaine firme ſtable true faith phariſies alſo tooke occaſion euill others waxe hautie proud taking themſelues men greater perfection anie bicauſe vertue euen phariſie ſawe publican ſubmiſſion ſo offended euerie little thing iudging euill murmuring againſt neighbour ſame manie reputed taken holie good whereas deed wicked moſt wicked perſons offended euen themſelues little ſtabilitie goodneſſe delectable euill life take occaſion deſpaire ought commit themſelues god aſking mercie offence foorthwith giue thanks hath pleaſed goodneſſe ſuffer ſo long time needeth anie ſaie euill men offended euen work god ſee god ſuffer ſinners therefore thinke ſinne diſpleaſeth bicauſe ſee good rewarded rich oftentimes imagine god loueth ſeemeth god parciall bicauſe hath elected ſome ſome reprooued therefore ſaie elected ſure ſaluation taking occaſion doo euill inough ſaieng whatſoeuer god hath determined ſhall performed alſo ſee good men oppreſſed euill men exalted iudge god vniuſt taking occaſion liue euillie ſaieng inaſmuch god fauoureth naughtie men let v doo euill inough intent doo v good wicked offended euen god woonder offended thoſe followe walke path way tenth chapter carnall goſpellers whoſe euill liuing god truth ſhamefullie ſlandered iwill ſpeake great dolor heauineſſe hart ſort people world called profeſſors goſpell word doo declare ſhew much affected ſame afraid ſome ſwearers blaſphemers yea wallowe tumble ſinnes theſe fruit doctrine thus may ſeene word god euill ſpoken licentious euill liuing yet word god holie pure ſincere godlie doctrine occaſion holie pure liuing wicked peruert good thing euill euill tree bring foorth good fruit good ſeede ſowne barren euill ground yeeldeth good corne ſo fareth word god heard knowne wicked men bringeth good fruit ſowne good ground meane hart good people bringeth foorth good fruit abundantlie ſo want fault men word god praie god men woman may haue grace become meete tillage fruit goſpell leaue onlie iangling onlie ſpeaking goſpell maketh men good chriſtians good talker except fact work agree ſame ſo ſpeech good bicauſe hart good euen much talke word god without practiſing ſame liuing euill deteſtable ſight god wee haue abroad canon old new teſtament knowne anie onlie clergie beleefe little lament hart heare anie creature ſhould haue ſuch blind ignorant opinion kind ſimplicitie bee praiſed ſimplicitie wit carnall doctrine much knowledge scripture maketh men heretikes without temper humane doctrine sophiſtrie philoſophie logicke wherewith bee ſeduced according tradition men ordinance world chriſt
