euils vouchſafe lord graunt petition moſt humblie beſeech thee thy onlie begotten ſonne sauiour ieſus chriſt ſake amen neceſſarie praier meeter againſt vice lord god make thou hart repentant ſpirit contrition thou ingraffe unto mine eies let giuen aboundant teares wéeping let hand occupied often almes giuing thou king quench foule fleſhlie deſire loue thée alone ſet thou hart fire redéemer driue awaie ſpirit pride graunt great treaſure méeke humilitie take sauiour furious rage ire ſhield patience giue deſire creator roote ſpitefulneſſe mind graunt ſtead thereof againe méekenes may find bountifull father giue faith ſhall endure hope agréeing therevnto charitie moſt ſure thou guide kéepe lip lieng vanitie mind driue far awaie vaine vnconſtancie wauering take thou hart mouth ſcoffing proud lookes gluttonie backbiting ſlandering couetouſnes wipe cleane awaie curioſitie fond deſire vaineglorie hypocriſie let neuer poore deſpiſe yet weake oppreſſe let blaſpheme die remedileſſe thou didſt forme make take raſhneſſe mée leaue ſuch mind peace agrée take ydleneſſe ſloth heauie lumpiſhneſſe take diſobedience eke ſtubborneſſe god thy déere ſonnes ſake humblie beſéech thée graunt work mercie aboundance pitie may thée loue feare eke pitie poore make good men alwaies loue wicked abhor make ſo little eſtéeme thoſe thing worldlie bée hart voice may craue heauen thée amen thankeſgiuing benefit receiued god hand moſt mercifull father yeeld thee moſt humble thanks thy great benefit beſtowed vpon ſinner thy free mercie onlie thou haſt thy fatherlie loue brought vp tenderlie inſtructed thy holie lawe thou haſt giuen knowledge vnderſtanding thou haſt preſerued manie danger euils diuers men haue felt thou haſt bleſſed health quietneſſe ioie plentie wealth number doo want thou haſt taken care done thing lord though deſerue nothing puniſhment thy iuſt diſpleaſure yet good lord truſt thy goodneſſe crauing mercie iuſtice thy mercie ſake beſeech thee continue thy grace increaſe thy good gift towards haue thy protection till liues end good lord bleſſe may enioie fruit earth vſe thy honour glorie good lord thou mine aid guide dooings buckler defence danger may freelie ioifullie ſing praiſes thee liueſt reigneſt one god almightie incomprehenſible world without end amen another thankeſgiuing goodneſſe god v almightie god euerruling king whoſe infinite power maieſtie wit comprehend whoſe glorious brightneſſe mortall eies behold whoſe woonderous work manifold mercy tongs men ſufficientlie declare good lord yeeld thee moſt humble thanks thy ſingular great gift benefit beſtowed vpon ſinner good lord thou haſt bleſſed knowledge increaſe plentie thing thou haſt giuen mee friend health reſt ſhould eate meate ioie praiſe thee thy gift work knowe haue good thing commeth thee oulie thy mercy ſake thou haſt ſo regarded thy ſeruant wherefore good lord beſeech thee graunt thy grace withall may vſe theſe thy gift thy honour glorie comfort neede vſing talent thou haſt lent may become good ſeruant obtaine eternall bliſſe promiſed hire ſuch doo well uouchſafe good lord thy ſonne sauiour ieſus chriſt ſake heare praiers almightie god refreſh thy grace beſeech thee comfort thy mercie bleſſe ſafe euils free feare danger peace quietneſſe may ſing praiſes thy holie name reioice thee thine elected euer euer amen praier ſaid time quietneſſe prosperitie giue v good lord comfortable healthfull ſpirit thy grace aboundant fauour may without ceaſing make continuall boaſt thy praiſe know bottome hart confeſſe thou haſt dealt louinglie v thou haſt done next neighbour whoſe painefull miſeries bloudie broiles may ſufficient warning vnto v hate ſin iniquitie leaſt like calamitie euer aware compaſſe hedge v round giue v grace therefore time peace happie proſperitie ſo walke thy fatherlie bleſſings withdrawne taken v rod thy ſharpe correction laid vpon neckes euen ſuch ſort thou haſt viſited brother country whoſe body meanes ciuill diſſention haue beene made praie ſword heare vnderſtand far euen hard gate border father readie armes ſeeke deſtruction ſonne ſonne greedie gape bloud father heare violentlie brother thirſteth bloud brother friend againſt friend neighbour againſt neighbour yong men murthered old men ſuddenlie ſlaine manie wife huſbandleſſe manie child deſolate fatherleſſe cruell harted enimie ſpareth none maketh hauocke teares ſtaie affectioned tyrannie tender infant haled earnefull pap weeping mother torne peecemeale ſorowfull eies carefull parent old age contemned godlie matrones abuſed virgin defloured rauiſhed violence ſpectacle extreame crueltie v behold glaſſe great carefulneſſe v looke vpon haue worthilie deſerued like far greater puniſhments yet withholdeſt thou v thy ſcourge although offence ſo great diuers might heape vp ſentence thine exceeding iuſtice againſt v place war bloudie battell thou haſt giuen vnto v proſperitie perfect peace place penurie dearth ſcarſitie thou haſt giuen v increaſe fulneſſe great plentie ſtead diſcord diſſention thou haſt ſent v vnitie concord thy celeſtiall prouidence defended cruell enimie domeſticall ciuill war beſides theſe thy gratious gift heape vp conſolation ioie thou haſt giuen v thy true liuelie word lanterne direct v guide footeſteps vanitie vertue wickednes godlie wiſdome licentious libertie newneſſe life godlie conuerſation beſides theſe thine ineſtimable grace freelie beſtowed vpon v thou haſt giuen v godlie zealous preacher plentiouſlie breake vnto v thine eternall teſtament bread life whereon good lord giue ſoules ſuch power feede faith may nouriſhed eternall ioie diligent obſeruing obeieng thy commandements may preſerued kind diſſention peaceablie enioie fruit pure peace truſtie tranquillitie grant mercifull father thy ſon chriſts ſake onelie sauiour redeemer chriſt ieſus amen godlie fruitfull praier ſaid time bloudie battell lord heauenlie father euerliuing god thy wretched moſt miſerable creature confeſſe acknowledge wee haue woorthilie deſerued rod thy correction puniſhment doo merit manie ſharpe bitter ſtripes knowing thy bleſſed glorious haue ſet purpoſe contemned thy diuine heauenlie precept cauſe ſentence thy wrath ſharpelie kindled againſt v euen hath beene againſt thy choſen people iſrael day forefather glorieng wickedneſſe plagued fulneſſe thine indignation ſword enimies beſet round hemmed euerie ſide iebuſites ammonite philiſtines amorites oppreſſed diuerſelie ſtrong hold raſed city beſieged houſes ranſacked good rich caried awaie force bloudthirſtie enimie yoong men led awaie captiue virgin wofullie defloured fine thou lord god didſt behold hartie earneſt contrition thou didſt withdrawe thy frowning countenance ſenteſt ſpeedie ſafe deliuerance one thou lord ſenteſt moſes bring ſeruitude pharao ſtonie ſtubborneharted king aegyptians another iephthah ſet free ſword ammonite wherewith greeuouſlie afflicted make thy power excellent glorie fullie knowne thou gaueſt samſon much fortitude bridle proud philiſtines ouer beſides theſe thou thy loue miraculous goodnes haſt made feeble woman mightie victorious conqueror debora ſhield thy people iudith comforted diſtreſſed bethulians cut head proud holophernes thy ſelfe good lord thou beholdedſt teares hartie ſorowe offence didſt prepare thy ſelfe go foorth hoaſts thou thy ſelfe ſaie breath thy noſtrils didſt confound ouerthrowe enimies good lord thou preſent v fulneſſe thy diuine power looke vpon v eies thy fauourable pitie forget corrupt moſt filthie offence let contrite ſorowfull hart meane vanquiſh thy diſpleaſure conceiued againſt v thou preſent v time neceſſitie trouble ſet thy hand helpe aſſiſt v againſt enimie thou preſent v time perill danger go thou foorth hoſts ſhall aſſured preuaile let multitude furious foe diſmaie v victorie doo knowe conſiſteth power ſtrength manie men horſes armour weapon thou mercifull father giueſt conqueſt thou pleaſeſt thee therefore great extremitie flie appeale beſeeching thee thine ineſtimable loue kindneſſe loue sauiour ieſus chriſt looke vpon true repentant hart fulneſſe thy miſerations pity ſet v free power raging enimie pardon ſinnes greeuous offence hencefoorth may vow dedicate hart mind wholie walke integritie newneſſe life grant good lord thy ſonne chriſt ieſus holie ghoſt praiſe glorie attributed euer euer world without end amen godlie praier ſaid time anie common plague priuate affliction trouble oeternall euerliuing god father conſolation comfort vouchſafe thine infinite loue kindneſſe ſtrengthen mee thy heauenlie grace patiently beare meekeneſſe ſuffer croſſe affliction trouble thou haſt laid vpon vſe ſinne iniquitie knowe gratious louing father deſerts ſuch woorthilie haue prouoked thee diſpleaſure burden ſinnes intollerable muſt acknowledge earneſtlie bottome hart confeſſe iuſtlie thou haſt corrected viſited yet fulneſſe thy furie according thy fatherlie loue kindneſſe albeit thy rod lie heauie vpon ſhoulders yet time thy correction comforted greatlie knowing aſſuredlie thou correcteſt ſimiteſt thou loueſt thou woundeſt healeſt againe thou throweſt downe hell lifteſt vp againe heauen ſuch ſo great thine omnipotencie thou ruleſt aboue firmament earth flouds lowermoſt part hell heauen angel archangel ſoules thy saint bleſſed companie martyr giue thee praiſe glorie veneration ſun moone gliſtering ſtars ech one courſe qualitie ſhew themſelues obedient vnto thy earth beaſts field ſeelie feathered foules aire order ſeeme ſet foorth thy glorie praiſe deepe water fiſhes ſea readie obſerue thy maner thy creature giue thee due honour reuerence among theſe man thou thy diuine pleaſure haſt indued reaſon creation concerning inward man hadſt faſhioned thy ſimilitude likeneſſe moſt prone willing miniſters darkneſſe ſeduced carried awaie vertue vice godlineſſe impietie obedience wilfull breach contempt thy precept ſo diligence baniſhed negligence ſuch power fleſh eies ſhould haue chiefeſt contemplation delight peruſing reading thy glorious ſacred goſpel wherein may behold thee crucified ſlaine ſweeteſt sauiour chriſt ieſus perfect god perfect man whoſe innocent death bloudie paſſion attonement made betwixt thy father v ſo dazeled dimme darke miſts sathan occupied beholding mundane tranſitorie pleaſures effect vaniſh weare awaie euen flower either parched force phoebus radiant beames winter ſtormes horie froſts conſumed eares thou haſt giuen v heare vnderſtand ſacred diuine myſteries conteined thy holie lawe made deafe purpoſe ſo glorie fable lothſome leaſings conceiue delight zealous predication thine euangelicall heauenlie doctrine hart hardened like adamant ſo greateſt part brooke thy teſtimonies continuallie luſt deſire ſatiſfied worldlie wealth honour dignitie beholdeth theſe day cruell conflict bloudie fight betwixt good conſcience filthie auarice roote miſchiefe euill naie ſeeth age plaine dealing murthered deceit faithleſſe fraud beholdeth true meaning ſtrangled forged flatterie loathſome leaſings bowel compaſſion pitie ſhut vp violent oppreſſion tyrannie feete willing tread path pride fornication vncleanneſſe hand readie offer wrong iniurie innocent yea fine whatſoeuer thou haſt giuen vnto v ſpread ſet foorth thy glorie honour ſinne ſo corrupted make member body grace pure loue ingraffed bodie chriſt rich great ſhepheard ſoules verie member sathan ſet purpoſe tranſgreſſion abounding flie chriſt rocke ſtrong piller ſaluation run headlong death vtter deſtruction bodie ſoule yet like louing god mercifull father thou calleſt v home againe thy word wherin onlie thy mercy alſo thy terrible threat thundered foorth againſt v impenitencie neither thy manifold mercy freelie thine abundant goodneſſe offered vnto v ieſus chriſt mooue ſtir v handfaſt contrition neither yet thy terrible commination thretnings reclame call v backe dangerous puddle ſins thou ſendeſt forth thy plague puniſhments peſtilence famine bloudie ſword intending thereby driue v amendment life acknowledge thine omnipotencie thou beholdeſt true repentant hart ſobs ſighing teares powred foorth throne thy diuine maieſtie thou withdraweſt v terror thine indignation vengeance rod thy correction laid aſide thy diſpleaſure iuſtlie conceiued againſt v continuall exerciſe ſinne vtterlie forgotten interceſſion thy ſonne ieſus chriſt ſitteth thy right hand glorie permanent euerlaſting like louing father moſt mercifull god ſiluered ſcepter peace offered vnto v thy gratious benefit thine anger conuerted clemencie thy diſpleaſure turned louing kindneſſe fine thine indignation ſo calmed thine abundant grace mercie like louing gentle father thine armes ſtretched foorth ioifullie embrace receiue v thy fauour againe knowe moſt certaine true tune ſoeuer ſhall appeare gate mercie meanes power conſtant liuelie faith knocke therat thou art redie open vnto v anie deſerts merit ieſus chriſt fulneſſe thy diuine miſeration compaſſion pitie whenſoeuer ſhall call vpon thee lowlineſſe meekeneſſe hart mind bewailing wofullie heinous offence committed againſt thee thine eares moſt attentiue heare willinglie doeſt grant v petition wherefore moſt gratious louing father come vnto thee ſorowfull contrite hart beſeeching thee loue thine annointed ſonne ieſus chriſt meſſias sauiour redeemer behold looke vpon v eies compaſſion pitie albeit haue worthilie deſerued thy plague puniſhment yet reſpect thou deſeruings leaſt thy furie indignation confounded periſh haue eie rather thy ſonne ieſus chriſt behold bloudie wound yet freſh greene neuer ſtint bleeding thinke vpon bitter painefull torment ſuffered v vpon croſſe whoſe name beſeech thee fauourablie looke vpon infirmity mercifullie heare praiers petition offered vnto thee gratiouſlie glorie thy name ſake take withdrawe v thy heauie rod correction ſinfull liues contempt thy precept haue heaped heauilie neckes giue v patience ſuffer whatſoeuer ſhall pleaſe thee laie vpon v giue v grace alwaie call crie vpon thy holie bleſſed name faithfullie teares ſaie vnto thee continuallie spare v good lord ſpare thy people thou haſt redeemed thy pretious bloud neither yet good lord thou angrie v euer graunt mercifull father loue thy onlie ſonne ieſus chriſt whome thee holie ghoſt honour glorie praiſe aſcribed foreuer amen praier patience trouble meekelie ſuffer aduerſitie gratious lord omnipotent god whoſe mercie euerlaſting infinite bowe downe thine eare harken vnto praier make thy diuine maieſtie moſt humblie beſeeching thee thine accuſtomed goodneſſe indue work mercie deedes charitie aboue thing giue patience aduerſitie meekelie ſuffer patientlie take whatſoeuer ſhall pleaſe thee laie vpon neuer murmur grudge thereat alwaies thinke thy louing gentle correction much leſſe deſerts great manifold offence againe vnder correction thy child father correcteth child whome moſt intirelie loueth euident token thou loueſt v thou correcteſt v ſcripture ſaith whome god loueth chaſteneth thou ſeeſt thing thou vnderſtandeſt knoweſt thing ſo ſo much one little ſparowe lighteth vpon ground without thy knowledge yea verie thought foreknowne vnto thee thou diſpoſeſt ordereſt thing ſeemeth beſt thy holie pleaſure thy helpe may doo thing without thee doo nothing thou powreſt vpon v thy creature thy good gift benefit thou beſtoweſt vpon v proſperitie health wealth ſuch like thou dooeſt intent acknowledging ſame ſhould thereby incouraged ſerue honour humblie obeie thee alwaies praiſe magnifie thy glorious name contrariwiſe thou ſtrikeſt v thy rod correction plaging v great mortalitie ſuffering enimies inuade v robber ſpoile v pouertie oppreſſe v fire conſume thoſe thing thou haſt lent v maintenance body mortall life thou doeſt put v mind haue tranſgreſſed thy commandements haue harkned vnto thee neither done acceptable thy ſight willinglie falling puddle ſin following owne appetite haue prouoked thy iuſt wrath indignation againſt v thus thou dealeſt v lord intent ſuffering bodilie puniſhment feeling ſmart ſame may thereby admoniſhed dutie true compunction hart deſire releaſed thy ſcourges haue deſerued worthilie receiue acknowledge ſelues loſt child ſtraieng ſheepe may ſee aſhamed vnbrideled affection wilfulneſſe haue brought v calamitie miſerie true penitent ſaie worthie moſt mercifull father lift vp eies voice vnto thee manifold ſins wickedneſſe neuertheleſſe preſuming vpon thine aboundant mercie refuſeſt none doo call vppon thee moſt lamentablie doo crie haue mercie vpon v lord haue mercie vpon v miſerable ſinners greeuouſlie afflicted burden puniſhment affliction thou haſt laid vpon v put thou therefore awaie diſpleaſure conceiued againſt v thy poore creature grant v beeing warned may euer heereafter ſerue thee newneſſe life neuer commit anie thing ſhall diſpleaſe offend thee heauenlie father acknowledge dutie though part haue performed ſame ought doo yet beſeech thine ineſtimable goodneſſe execute rigour thy iuſtice vpon ſtate thine hand thou giue anie greater wound behold humilitie repentance able recompenſe ſatiſfie treſpaſſes againſt thee haue committed doo offer vnto thee according poore widowe able giue ſorowfull contrition hart former offence done paſſed thy iuſtice right ſo rigorous ſinners thou art ſo gealous ſo much doeſt deteſt ſin thou ſpareſt puniſh thy verie elect choſen ſeruants fall acceptable thy ſight holie prophet king dauid whome thou thy ſelfe didſt ſaie haue found man according mine owne hart euen dauid ſeruant yet neuertheleſſe diuers ſundrie way didſt thou puniſh ſwarued thy teſtimonies thou ſufferedſt moleſted inſurrection owne ſonne thou didſt ſend prophet vnto offer choice plague thou wouldeſt ſend vpon wicked liuing ſorowfull ſighes trickling teares turned vnto thee confeſſing fault crauing pardon promiſing amendment life thou forgateſt thine anger forgaueſt offence thy choſen veſſels thou haſt permitted greeuouſlie tormented vexed ſundrie trouble aduerſities onlie trie faith ſtedfaſtneſſe towards thee thou didſt ſuffer patient man iob moſt cruellie intreated enimie mankind haue houſes burned ſpoiled cattell taken awaie ſeruants driuen bondage child ſlaine owne bodie afflicted moſt loathſome diſeaſes plague ſores thou didſt anie euill deede ſhewe thine omnipotencie power thou hadſt tried vtmoſt found enimie diuell could preuaile againſt anie paine greefe cauſe blaſpheame ſpeake euill thee thou diddeſt reduce health thou diddeſt enrich againe thou diddeſt reſtore vnto againe child friend familie good much euer poſſeſſed ſhewing moſt manifeſtlie thou wilt reward moſt plentiouſlie loue thee folowe obſerue thy commandements wherefore beſeech thee giue grace whatſoeuer waie ſhall pleaſe thee viſit thy puniſhment may take patientlie ſaie patient iob naked came world naked ſhall returne earth againe lord giueth lord taketh awaie euen pleaſeth lord ſo suffer deſpaire thinke thou dealeſt vniuſtlie ſaie shall receiue proſperitie lord hand content aduerſitie alwaie thinke vpon happie whome thou doeſt puniſh though thou make wound thou alſo giueſt plaiſter though thou ſmiteſt thy hand maketh whole againe mine iniquitie great thou merciful vnto wickednes deliuer thine anger preſſe ſhall able beare acknowledge whatſoeuer trouble thou haſt ſent wilt laie vpon either puniſhment mine iniquitie triall conſtancie may repentant dauid find remiſſion ſins patient iob releaſe mine aduerſitie obtaine ſuch fauour thy ſight thou neuer againe ſo greeuouſlie puniſh may ſo paſſe life may afterward liue thee whome honour glorie euer euer amen another praier trouble aduerſitie haue mercie vpon lord haue mercie vpon moſt miſerable creature doo ought feare haue moſt iuſtlie deſerued weigh ſelfe wickedneſſe haue done puniſhment thereby deſerued halfe ſo great ſinne haue committed thou art mercifull god thy iudgements right neither dooeſt thou anie time puniſh v vniuſtly thou almightie god madeſt v loſt damned thou didſt miraculouſlie reſtore v knowe ſure life led ſudden vncertaine motion diſpoſed directed thee thou haſt fatherlie care v eſpeciallie ſuch doo put whole truſt confidence thy mercie therefore humblie praie beſeech thee thou wouldeſt deale deſeruings according thy great mercie doth exceede ſinnes whole world often thou dooeſt puniſh outwardlie giue grace inwardlie patience beare ſame thy praiſe neuer depart mouth order dooings euen ſhall moſt neceſſarie bodie ſoule thou onlie haſt power ouer thing thou knoweſt thing thee honour euer amen another praier trouble obteining mercie behold bottome hart doo crie vnto thee lord beſeeching thee thou wouldeſt ſaue bottomleſſe pit hell knowe mercie thee doo therefore marke haue done amiſſe enter iudgment thy ſeruant meanes iuſtified thy ſight remembrance mine offence greeuous vnto mee therefore right humblie craue pardon thereof hart troubled ſoule vexed health fleſh forſake mine onlie ſtaie comfort deſpiſe contrite hart open boſome thy mercie take cleane awaie mine iniquitie bring ſoule tribulation turne extremitie thy iuſtice thy tender mercie thou ſhalt come iudge quicke dead reuenged eternall damnation take mee amongſt thine elect bleſſed ſtate ſaluation grant father chriſt ſake mediator aduocate amen another lord god although haue committed whereby offender make ſelfe bee thy creature though ſinne haue loſt cleanneſſe puritie haue alſo taken awaie thy goodneſſe mercie though haue committed wherefore thou maieſt condemne haſt thou done whereby thou maieſt ſaue true lord conſcience doth ſhew haue deſerued damnation thy mercie exceedeth offenſion spare god bicauſe vnpoſſible thy power vnmeete thy mercie vnaccuſtomed yet contrarie thine infinite goodneſſe wherefore thou haſt created doo deſtroie thou ieſu haſt redeemed doo condemne thou haſt made mee let thy worke caſt awaie wickedneſſe wipe awaie mine draweth thee knowledge thine may bring mee vnto thee liueſt reigneſt one god perſons three honour euer amen another praier wherin penitent longeth comfort long lord wilt thou turne awaie thy face long wilt thou bee angrie thy ſeruant long ſhall abide mourning ſolitarie bird hath loſt hir yoong lord thinke thy mercy doo correct thy wrath ſhall become duſt ſmoke wind lord forſake thy ſeruant iſrael thou haſt choſen hart comforted thy mercy ſhall reioice ſing vnto thee praiſe thee thy good work miracle thou haſt done father time tempted ghoſtlie enimie feare god doubt anie article catholike faith deſpaire god mercie yeeld melancholie fanſies vexed vnkindnes friend malice enimies troubled ſickneſſe anie way oppreſſed griefe bodie mind ſaie deuoutlie followeth humblie accept moſt mercifull ieſus heauie temptation ſuffer hand thy diuine prouidence would greater thou pleaſe laie thy ſake haſt ordeined beginning tender loue thou beareſt health ſinfull ſoule moſt hartilie thanke thee confeſſe haue deſerued woorſe ſinne vnkindneſſe towards thee woorthie receiue anie comfort conſolation thy hand therfore honour paſſion death thou willinglie ſufferedſt croſſe offer ſelfe ſuſtaine anie aduerſitie hart ſeeking otherwiſe eaſe reliefe thee lord thy good pleaſure ſhall appoint yet one thing craue beſeech thee tender loue thou beareſt mankind vertue ought good helpe aſſiſt thy holie ſpirit truſt thou wilt promiſeſt man ſhall tempted ſhall able beare giue euer ſhall neceſſarie ſuſtaine patience croſſe temptation thy diuine wiſdome hath appointed intent bearing ſame willinglie thee world may conceiue aſſured hope partaker thy glorie world come grant requeſt moſt mercifull sauiour merit deſeruing onlie merit thy death bitter paſſion humblie beſeech thee amen praier againſt feare worldlie caſualties moſt bountifull louing father mine onlie guider comforter well mercie true light world take awaie darkneſſe mind lighten hart ſenſes indue thy grace arme ſo ſtronglie ſure hope confidence truſt thee neuer driuen feare either ſubtile inuaſions ghoſtlie enimie sathan craftie wilineſſe world neither yet loſſe damage hurt hinderance anie thoſe vaine tranſitorie thing world doo poſſeſſe alwaies whatſoeuer ſhall becom thinke thing lent owne ſhall make ſtreight account vſe abuſe whereby poſſeſſe thereof greater ſhall paine abuſe wherefore take mee inward heauineſſe thought care anie loſſe diſcommoditie receiued worldlie good alwaies thinke well pouertie rich needineſſe abundance ſickneſſe health aduerſitie proſperitie come thee knowne thine inſcrutable iudgement onlie wherefore thou ſendeſt either theſe vpon v therefore let mind troubled anie feare thing chance ſauing onlie feare diſpleaſe thee alwaies merrie thee ſobernes caſt care worldlie affaire vpon thee foraſmuch thou haſt commanded ſhould carefull eate drinke raiment ſhall clothed thou wilt ſee righteous forſaken child begging bread thou turneſt thing beſt ſerue thee flie vnto thee ſuccour time diſtreſſe let lord euermore freſh memorie grauen hart readie mouth ſo leauing needleſſe feare may alwaies giue thanks vnto thee praiſe thy holie name amen praier deliuered enimies danger moſt mightie lord god abraham iſaac iacob didſt leade child iſrael red ſea madeſt ſtreames iordan runne backe ſprings againe thy people might paſſe midſt thereof good lord whoſe heaſts flouds obeied whoſe voice hils doo leape earth doth tremble moſt mightie lord canſt deſtroie proudeſt king verie fly ant madeſt little dauid triumph giant goliah deliueredſt enimie king saule hand gaueſt gedeon thy ſeruant ſouldiours victorie ſo manie legion ſtrong men thou haſt ſubdued ſo manie mightie king ſundrie nation vnto thy people iſrael god workeſt thing giueſt victorie alwaies ſeemeth beſt thine vnſearchable wiſdome defend alwaies beſeech thee againſt mine enimies euils ſhip toſſed beaten waues world may reſt thy happie hauen euerlaſting ioie euer ſoule cleaueth vnto thy mercie holie ſanctuarie god thou ſhouldeſt mercifull could abide heat thy diſpleaſure thou lord art good thy ſeruants hope ſee thy goodneſſe land liuing glorie moſt high mercifull god euer euer amen praier righteous iudgement matter controuerſie lord god iuſtice equall ballance dooeſt weigh cauſe prince pooreſt man deſpiſeſt ſuites ſimple deliuereſt captiue comforteſt deſolate carefull lord haſt bleſſed poore ſpirit releeue thy ſeruant oppreſſed griefe remooue cloud ſorowes lord ſtretch forth thy mightie hand helpe let ſinke ſeas ſlander ſhame thou knoweſt ſecrets hart defend mine innocencie pleade thou cauſe againſt vngodlie haue laid net god thou haſt deliuered ioſeph daniel mardocheus suſanna captiuitie inſtant death didſt cloth honour good lord ſtrengthen defender againſt euils let poiſoned arrowes malicious tongue doo anie harme grant theſe praiers good lord beſeech thee sauiour ieſus chriſt ſake amen pſalme ſaid trouble eſcaped ſoule reioice god light defence helpe lanterne foot hath heard praier called hath holpen neede hath deliuered danger lord keeper life whome ſhall ſhrinke whome ſhall feare lieng proſtrate feete lord bewailed caſe heard plaint forſaketh ſeruants wherefore army men ſtood vp againſt ſhould feare god ſide preuaile againſt happie ſafe whome god mightie god iſrael keepeth sun ſhall burne daie moone night chriſe bleſſed feareth lord ſhall ſee happie day hart thirſteth water ſprings ſo ſoule hath longed lord liuing god ſhall come appeare thy preſence ſee thee thy glorious maieſtie face face lord let thy kingdome come come lord ieſus may ſee daie redemption good lord make haſt helpe glorie maieſtie empire vnto god creator god redeemer god holie comforter euer euer amen comfortable exhortation againſt manifold aſſaults sathan thou perceiue ſtorme temptation doth verie often greeuouſlie aſſault thee diſmaie therefore thy ſelfe neither diſpleaſed thy ſelfe though almightie god nothing regarded thee rather thank inſtructeth teacheth thee one heire puniſheth correcteth thee moſt deere ſoune prooueth aſſaieth thee welbeloued freend manifeſt great token man reiect mercie fauour god troubled temptation thy temptation remember holie apoſtle paule rapt myſteries third heauen vexed angel sathan remember temptation holie man iob greeuouſlie troubled offence happie fortunate man whome earthlie adam ſo mortified ſubdued wiſe reſiſteth ſpirit whether perfect quietneſſe may anie affirme peraduenture neceſſarie paule life notwithſtanding high perfection grace motion fleſh vexe trouble thriſe deſired god deliuered ſaid motion onelie anſwere paule grace ſufficient vertue made perfect vexation paule vexed pride ſhould proud perfect ſtrong god cauſed weake feeble caried treaſure heauenlie reuelation fraile brittle veſſell honour victorie ſhould onlie god himſelfe one example paule erudition learning manie thing entiſed moued ſinne diligentlie call almightie god praier remember dauid prophet king salomon peter apoſtle notwithſtanding great light example holineſſe yet fell greeuous great ſinnes whome almightie god peraduenture ſuffered fall cauſe ſpeciallie thou ſhouldſt deſpaire lift vp thy ſelfe therefore vpon thy feete high courage bold ſtomach returne againe battell againſt thy enimies onlie fierce bold alſo ware diligent thinke thy ſelfe intollerable inuincible temptation chriſt ſuffered thee wherein appeared helpe comfort aide defence anie wherein god whole world ſeemed moſt cruell malicious enimies cried alowd god god haſt thou forſaken trulie moſt greeuous painefull bitter temptation chriſt ſuffered v might make waie croſſe eaſie v therefore prepare thy ſelfe patientlie drinke cup chriſt ieſu thy head hath ſo willinglie dronke ſaluation mankind ſeeing therefore chriſt ſo willinglie put himſelfe ſubiection dipped himſelfe thoſe ſo horrible intollerable ſorowes calamity moſt louing heauenlie father willing ſame doubt alſo vnderſtandeth knoweth infirmitie doubt taking compaſſion v extremelie deale v rather beare imbecillitie weakeneſſe doth himſelfe calling men vnto ſaie come vnto yee labour heauie laden refreſh greater comfort praie giuen v could chriſt ſpeake mercifullie vnto v manie thing greeuouſlie vexe trouble man thing cruellie vexe torment conſcience ouerwhelmed ſinne doubteth mercie god dreadeth leaſt god aduerſarie reiect able conceiue faith mercie doth imagine himſelfe caſt awaie drie member cut preſent heere ieſus chriſt thine aide helpe heere haue neede thy comfort let blacke violent horrible tempeſt trouble ouerthrowe drowne wretched man cauſe ſhould doubt chriſt true make promiſe appeare helpe v refreſh v therefore whereas thy faith ſtrong ynough whereas thou feeleſt thy ſelfe doubt god mercie haſt wellneere faith ſtreightwaies call vpon god bewaile thy miſerie lacke beleefe ſeeke aide ſuccour feruent praier helpe refreſh thee hath taken vpon thus doo bring paſſe take heede thou ceaſe call vpon god beſeech thou without ceaſing father conſolation comfort ſighes bottome thine heart turne face thee laie thy weakeneſſe vpon powre boſome thing trouble torment thee crie diſciples lord increaſe faith likewiſe ſaie thou father lunatike childe lord beleeue helpe thou mine vnbeleefe make haſte lord helpe oppreſſed weight drowned moſt louing moſt mercifull father lord god health onlie helpe refuge enter iudgement thy ſeruants chriſt righteouſneſſe redemption innocencie ſuffered moſt bitter cruell death ſake let thoſe thing moue thee father compaſſion haue mercie vpon thy ſonnes ſake confirme ſtrengthen hart faith chriſt comfort conſolations holie ghoſt may enioie true ioies euerlaſting life merit lord sauiour ieſus chriſt father holie ghoſt praiſe glorie euer euer amen godlie meditation vnſpeakable ioies heauen intollerable paine hell verie often remembred god lord hart delight ſoule longeth dwell heauenlie ieruſalem wherein continuall health eternall felicitie happie libertie perfect bleſſedneſſe men ſhall like vnto angel god iuſt men ſhall ſhine sunne euerlaſting kingdome wherein heauineſſe ſorrowe greefe feare labour death diſeaſe lacke hunger thirſt cold heate wearineſſe faſting temptation enimie ſinne power doo euill old age lame deformed perſon feare pouertie weakneſſe diſeaſe quiet harbour ioie euerlaſting happineſſe men ſocietie angel ſhall continuallie dwell without anie infirmitie fleſh infinite ioie eternall bliſſe whence none ſhall remoued thy prouidence ſhall enter therein reſt labour peace enimie new kind ioie delight ſuch hart conceine ſaue onlie taking maruellous delight exceeding pleaſure beholding thee lord god glorious redeemer heauenlie comforter proceedeth father sonne heauenlie ieruſalem thou art ſweet beautifull thy ioies delight ſuch miſeries thee feele ſuffer poore miſerable life thee darkeneſſe change time ſhining moone twinkling brightneſſe star giueth light thee onlie god power glorie maieſtie light light thee sun iuſtice giueth light thoſe adopted bloud euerduring bleſſedneſſe bright immaculate lambe moſt beautifull light thy light doth illuminate choſen child king king middeſt thee enuironed ech ſide beloued saint redie crowne euerlaſting glorie thee legion angel ſinging ſweet hymnes ſongs ſet foorth praiſe honor thy name thee felowſhip heauenlie citizen thee reſteth ſweete ſolemnitie ſuch returne miſerable pilgrimage vnto thy glorie companie prophet apoſtles victorious armie martyr holie men woman haue vanquiſhed pleaſures world haue abiding thee yoong child maiden haue paſſed ouer day holineſſe life publiſhing thy praiſe puritie pietie euerie one reioiceth degree though equall glorie yet like ioies gladneſſe reigneth perfect charitie god whoſe maieſtie without end ſee continuallie ſtill beholding loue increaſeth eternall bleſſedneſſe holie apoſtle peter ſhadowe taſt vpon mount thabor tranſfiguration chriſt whence deſired might depart paule alſo proofe rapt taken vp third heauen heard word ſawe thing ſo maruellous ſecret far paſſeth man vnderſtanding ſuch told reuealed vnto men moſes face became ſo bright conuerſation diuine glorie vpon mount sinai iſraelites could abide ſhall become v perpetuallie thee art lord glorie ſhall conuerſant maner thy child familiar friend ſeeke deſire meanes poſſible dweller deſire peace ioie eternitie perfect ſight god contrariwiſe able expreſſe torment appointed vngodlie vnrepentant liuers deadlie place called hell sathan himſelfe abhorreth thing continuall paine eternall tribulation infinite calamitie repleat euils dwell wicked ouglie angel whoſe horrible lookes bring ſudden feare greeuous paine fearefull death continual cloud euerduring darknes nothing howling wailing lamentation mourning without end fearfull ſcriches confuſed cry place ſuddenlie raiſed woorme conſcience neuer dieth damnable dungeon fire vnquenchable perpetuall gnaſhing teeth miſerable ſoule findeth reſt afflicted kind torment ſuch neuer expreſſed endure euer ala little auaileth thoſe ſubiected firebrans hell crie vnto lord heare ſhall knowe thing life vaine ſuch thing thought pleaſant found bitter gall poiſon pleaſure fleſh ſo termed falſlie none pleaſure feare lord ſhall confeſſe ſaie iudgement god true righteous ſaieng heare yet would conuerted wicked deed ſhall nothing preuaile ſorowe find comfort complaint anie remorſe torment eaſe painfull paſſions end ſuch ſo exceeding vexation ſecond death wherewith body ſoules vnrighteous ſhall euer enuironed sith therefore heauenlie father moſt gratious god ſeemeth good thine eternall wiſdome knowledge thine euerlaſting truth giue knowledge thine ineſtimable mercie offered freelie vnto ieſus chriſt mercifull sauiour whoſe bloudie death painfull paſſion aſſured eternall life bleſſedneſſe giue grace print remembrance thy manifold mercy feeding ſoule faith thee may attaine vnto thoſe endleſſe ioies thou haſt prepared thine adopted ſonnes choſen child kingdome euerlaſting righteouſneſſe ſo eſcape thoſe euerlaſting torment thou haſt prepared diuell angel place wofull vexation endleſſe miſerie deliuer heauenlie father loue ieſus chriſt ſake thee holie ghoſt laud praiſe euer amen praier ſaid ſicke houre death moſt mightie art thou lord thy deed moſt holie thy way bleſſed name father god glorious creator diuine power celeſtiall prouidence nothing made thing fiſh fleſh foules fruites tree hearbes thing whatſoeuer conteined heauen earth ſeas nethermoſt part thereof man concerning outward part thou thy celeſtiall prouidence fatherlie bountie framedſt createdſt claie concerning inward ſubſtance thy creature man thou didſt faſhion make euen according thine owne ſimilitude likeneſſe moreouer ſuch ſo great thy loue good towards creature work thy creation ſerued vſe earth thou madeſt lord king ouer fruit thereof beaſts field foules aire fiſhes little flouds great water firmament thou haſt placed gliſtering sunne orient beames giue light daie therewith thou haſt giuen moone ſtarres gouerne night cauſe aboue work thy creation man ſhould ought right giue thee glorie thee belongeth ala ſuch ſo great corruption fraile ſinfull fleſh theſe thy grace wee carried awaie thee enter contempt thy precept cauſe thou oftentimes dooſt correct puniſh v intent might thereby feeling thy rod correction driuen imbrace hartie true repentance thy threat ſtripes thy diſpleaſure laid vpon v take place amongſt v thou oftentimes giueſt v vp folowe luſts affection laſt thou dooeſt behold enormity thou moment power thy diuine iuſtice reſtraineſt rope diſordered libertie cutteſt ſunder bridle voluptuouſnes either ſudden death ſword fire famine ſickneſſe diuine ſentences thy conceiued ire intent thy creature might terrour thy iuſtice auoid ſinne learne amend liues leaſt fall like calamitie danger true moſt true good lord exerciſe ſinne child death deſtruction grace almightie victorious conquerour ſweete ieſus chriſt adopted ſonnes thy father made felloweheires thee perfect emanuel whoſe name humilitie lowlineſſe hart mind come vnto thee great extremitie ſickneſſe danger death beſeeching thee preſent forget mine offence thinke vpon thy mercy although haue deſerued ſo much leaſt drop thy fauour meanes great burden ſinnes preſence thy diuine maieſtie moſt ouglie loathſome behold yet reſpect thou father mine iniquitie haue eie beſeech thee merit sauiour chriſt ieſus mediator sauiour redeemer appeale hath promiſed comfort ſweete conſolation thoſe name flie vnto thee releefe confeſſe woorthilie thou haſt viſited ſickneſſe diſeaſe yet according multitude ſinnes fulneſſe miſeration fatherlie pitie giue grace therefore theſe bitter brunt death vehementlie preſent beginneth combat fainting feeble life conſtantlie cleaue vnto thee let pleaſures wicked world let impediment come vnto thee let fraile feeble fleſh ſubiect ſinne hath tranſgreſſion made bondman death mooue deſpaire thy great mercie neither yet let caueling aduerſarie enimie mankind laſt end triumph ouer giue patience ſuffer gladlie beare abide thy ſcourge viſitation ſo fortifie ſoule bodie ſo long life ſhall endure may neuer ceaſe call vpon thy holie bleſſed name yea death moſt buſieſt make thou moſt conſtant yea ſeeketh moſt ſtronglie aſſaile feeble bodie giue thy grace good lord may ſpirit hart mind power ſoule giue praiſes vnto thee thy grace ineſtimable kindneſſe haſt ſent thy ſonne chriſt ieſus ranſome bloudie death paſſion power hell giue grace therfore thou haſt appointed thy meſſenger death finiſh day pilgrimage call ſummons vale miſerie wretchedneſſe build ſtedfaſtlie vpon faithfullie hope life ſaluation alone let remembrance former wickedneſſe thought vpon let mine offence blotted thy glorious ſight behold ſorowfull true repentant hart come vnto thee teares building merit vpon thy mercy though ſinfull thy ſonne sauiour righteous though wicked yet moſt holie though full impietie yet full goodneſſe though haue greeuouſlie offended thee yet hath fullie contented thee though haue tranſgreſſed thy lawe yet hath fulfilled ſame hath promiſed bloud waſh awaie ſinnes faith continue conſtant end therefore great painfull agonie beholding death gate bodie come vnto thee vertue fruitfull faith beſeeching thee thou ſhalt ſee meete conuenient ſhall diſſolue band vading life endureth thouſand yeeres yeſterdaie thy ſight take ſoule thy glorious bleſſed hand ſo confirme thy truth laſt ſhall pleaſe thee ſound trumpe raiſe bodie graue time bodie ſoule ſhall vnite come thy preſence may faith thee paſſe ouer mount corruption ſhake band ſinne ſet free death deſtruction vertue thy righteouſneſſe made holie may triumph happie victorie ouer ſinne death power hell enter thee felowſhip thy choſen saint euerlaſting reſt grant moſt louing father chriſt ieſus ſake thee holie ghoſt rendred laud glorie honour praiſe euer amen lord god mercifull pardon forgiue ſinnes looke vpon gratious bleſſed countenance preſerue ſecond death euerlaſting deſtruction bodie ſoule lord god iuſtifie death bloud cloath euerlaſting righteouſneſſe regiſter name booke life lord god comfort guiltie conſcience euerlaſting light bountifull fauour lot place among saint heauenlie kingdome lord god mercy ſake bodilie death giue fruition preſence rich palace endleſſe glorie whoſe mercifull protection commend humilitie reuerence ſoule lord ieſus preſerue lord ieſus comfort lord ieſus refreſh lord ieſus praie onlie thy hand haſt redeemed mee lord god truth commend ſoule amen deuout meditation vſed praier remember lord god thine anger againſt offender mindfull thy mercie towards true penitent forget pride haue prouoked thee ire fauourablie harken vnto praier ieſus sauiour therefore bountifull ieſu thou sauiour riſe vp thine owne ſtrength helpe saie vnto ſoule thy ſafegard thy goodneſſe doo truſt thee helpe foraſmuch thou haſt willed ſhould without ceaſing ſeeke ſue vnto thee behold beeing counſelled foretold thy commandements doo aſke ſeeke knocke thou commandeſt aſke graunt may receiue thou biddeſt ſeeke make find thou haſt taught knocke open vnto ſtand knocking ſtrengthen weake reſtore loſt reuiue dead ſinne make ſerue thee liue thee giue ſelfe wholie thee knowe god becauſe thou madeſt owe ſelfe vnto thee thou haſt redeemed ſhould owe thee ſelfe behold haue giue neither giue ſelfe vnto thee vnleſſe thou make willing therevnto take thou draw vnto thee thine creation ſo may thine following thee liueſt reigneſt euer euer amen praier deciphering alphabet forme name right woorſhipfull ladie mary fane moſt mightie art thou lord thy deedes holie thy work haue mercie vpon giue vnderſtanding therefore aboue conſider ſubſtance whereof thou haſt framed knowledge thereof make conſider mine owne weakeneſſe infirmitie ſuch vnleſſe thou ſet thy hand ſpeedilie helpe oppreſſed ſinne ſhall periſh wickedneſſe ſins innumerable redder ſcarlet ſo giue grace acknowledge thy greate mercy ſurmounting ſands ſeas thou thy grace thy good pleaſure canſt waſh awaie deformitie make excell ſnowe libanus beſeech thee mercifull father let far thought wilfullie ſet purpoſe fall danger ſinne commit anie heinous ſinne greeuous wickednes againſt thine eternall maieſtie exerciſe ſuch ſo great euill meanes preſumption prouoke thee diſpleaſure giue grace therefore ſtand awe thy iuſtice leaſt thy mercie withheld kept thou giue ouer thou didſt proud pharao luſt affection mine owne hart ſo drowned dangerous gulph deſtruction r readie art thou lord time heare giue eare vnto petition thy people readier run aſtraie thy tranſgreſſe thy ſacred lawes diuine ſtatutes leaue luſts carnalitie pleaſures vaine wicked world ſo greatlie affected licentious libertie kind notorious euill yet mercifull father thine abundant loue fauour exceeding kindneſſe giue grace renounce ſinne hate tranſitorie vading world mortifie fraile feeble fleſh rebelleth againſt ſpirit faith chriſt dangerous pilgrimage ſo giue ſtrength mine enimies may ouerthrowne deliuered ſnares hell may thee art author man felicitie haue fruition thy kingdome celeſtiall manſion endleſſe ſempiternall glorie ydleneſſe nurſe roote infectious euils giue thine aid therefore lord loath deteſt deadlie dangerous ſinne leaſt therby run headlong thy heauie diſpleaſure make alwaies euer occupied good lord thy holie lawe power ſoule hart mind vnderſtanding may giue thee continuall praiſe honor glorie yeeld plentiouſlie vnto alſo good lord thy grace aboue may continuallie make boaſt thine euerlaſting name hartie contrition bitter deploration ſinnes wickedneſſe obtaine thy fauourable pardon thee ſanctified made cleane mine vncleanneſſe vngodlineſſe may enter thee laſt daie celeſtiall glorious kingdome purchaſed bloudie death sauiour ieſus chriſt yea illuminate mine eies ſaie good lord ſleepe darkenes giue grace good lord continuallie keepe watch ward leaſt enimie find ſlumbering cradle careleſneſſe gate bodie broken vp daie thy comming iudgement ſentence thy diſpleaſure pronounced againſt vtter confuſion bodie ſoule f faith embraced thoſe hope felicitie bleſſedneſſe ieſus chriſt giue therefore ſuch wiſdome aboue may dailie deſirous learne thy ſacred precept walke pathwaie thy glorious ſtatutes exerciſe thy ſinfull vice iniquitie may vanquiſhed vertue may haue dominion ſouereigntie abſtinence coupled conſtant faithfull praier thing much pleaſeth thy maieſtie withdraweth v force thy heauie indignation giue grace praier exerciſe ſuch faſting may hold downe man ſinne ſwell pride exceſſe gluttonie ſuperfluous eating drinking make alwaies vſe thy gift ſo moderatelie thy name may glorified faſting ſinne hartie praier faithfullie may beate gate thy grace ſo obtaine full effect thy fatherlie loue fauourable kindneſſe finallie abate beſeech thee pride vngodlie trouble confound thy iuſtice imagination fooliſh ſticke ſaie hart god breake iawe bone thoſe ſunder conſult take counſell togither may harme innocent weake bloudthirſtie deceiptfull man deliuer lord god looke fauourablie vpon glad thou hart cheerefull lookes thy gratious louing countenance saie vnto ſoule thy ſafegard thou euer ſhall need feare power ſubtile cruell enimies thine appointed heauenlie pleaſure ſhall made ſafe felowſhip thy choſen saint enioie fruition thine euerlaſting kingdome n nothing lord brought world nothing ſhall carie hence mee giue mee grace power therefore conſider worldlie thing vaine ſhall vaniſh awaie like ſmoke make vnderſtand ſtranger heere far countrie new citie ieruſalem thou haſt fulneſſe thy great mercie ordeined thoſe continue faithfull thee end ſith earthlie thing ſubiected conſuming meere vanity endue ſuch vnderſtanding may laie treaſure plentifullie heauen ieſus chriſt whome water baptiſme grace ſpirit coupled knit withdrawe therefore delight worldlie pleaſures giue ſtreugth offer ſelfe vp wholie bleſſed heauenlie hand hart mind power ſoule haue may depend whome treaſure reſteth vnder comfortable gard defence may deliuered danger bodie ſoule naked borne naked graue ſhall returne againe lord giueth lord taketh awaie euen pleaſeth maieſtie thing brought paſſe whoſe glorious name praiſed euer man eſcape ſting death fleſh muſt bow vnto graue giue feruent faith therefore lord continue faithfull ieſus chriſt whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe thee ſend thy meſſenger death arreſt may readie ſummons ioifullie beare ſtroke power liuelie faith ſo withſtand ſinne sathan death may enimies man felicitie vanquiſhed ſubdued may liue ieſus chriſt e expell roote remembrance deteſtable branch wrath pride concupiſcence vaineglorie horrible vice noiſome euils heape vp thy greeuous diſpleaſure againſt take abuſe let neuer blaſpheme thy bleſſed glorious name let tong purged thee corrupt vncomelie talke let thought occupied thy ſeruice faith feare loue make good lord alwaies obedient doo thy walke way thy commandements delight thy bleſſed teſtimonies graunt thy grace hearing thy euangelicall heauenlie doctrine faith may increaſed made ſtrong fruitfull exerciſe work charitie loue men chieflie thoſe conſtantlie fauour thy goſpell continue faithfull chriſt ieſus euermore ſaie good lord giue thy bleſſings aboue let hart ſoule tong euer readie thy gratious benefit receiued publiſh ſet foorth thy glorie praiſe weale wo pouertie proſperitie time peace time danger stretch foorth thy hand protect thee deliuered peril ſhall make boaſt thy mercy freelie ſhowne vnto without deſerts felowſhip thy saint giue ſuch honour praiſe reuerence vnto thee right bounden dutie ought doo foraſmuch euerie one ſaith lord lord ſhall enter kingdome god chriſt make profeſſor thy word lip earneſt louer ſame faithfull folower thy commandements leaſt comming great rich bridegroome ieſus chriſt refuſed fiue vndiſcreet fooliſh virgin wanted oyle garniſh lamp thou lord paſſe finde vnprouided gate thy grace faſt ſhut vp locked cloſe ſhall ſtand knocking calling lord vaine thou wilt giue anſwere thou knoweſt forſaken thee ſhall periſh euerlaſtinglie giue grace therefore good lord readie prepared wedding garment oyle lampe may continuallie watch thy comming ſo enter thee thy gheſt rich banqueting houſe euerlaſting glorie amen f ſinfulneſſe preſerue lord r renew thy ſpirit hart let tongue therewith accord v vttering goodneſſe part n thought let ariſe c contrarie thy ſtatutes ten e euer let moſt mindfull still praiſe thy name amen ſoule ſo bodie b thou guider god v vnto thee onlie crie r remoue thy furious rod g graunt head may ſtill deuiſe thing pleaſing thee v vnto mine eares mine eies e euer let watch ſet bee n none ill may heare ſee n wicked deede let hand yn thy good path let feete go finis ¶ certaine praiers made godlie woman martyr praier agnes martyr hir death eternall gouernour vouchſafe open gate heauen ſhut vp againſt inhabitant earth receiue ſoule oh chriſt ſeeketh thee ſong eulalia martyr hir death behold lord wil forget thee pleaſure chriſt remember thy triumphant victory attaine vnto thoſe high dignity praier anne askue martyr hir death lord haue mo enimies heares head yet lord let neuer ouercome vaine word fight thou lord ſide thee caſt care ſpite imagine fall vpon thy poore creature yet ſweete lord let ſet againſt thee whole delight lord hartilie deſire thee thou wilt thy moſt mercifull goodneſſe forgiue violence doo haue done vnto open alſo thou blind hart may hereafter doo thing thy ſight onlie acceptable thee ſet foorth thy veritie aright without vaine phantaſies ſinfull man lord praier maiſter bradford morher ſaid offered vnto god behalfe little martyrdome ah good father dooeſt vouchſafe ſonne iohn bradford greeuous ſinner thy ſight ſhould find fauour thee one thy ſonne chriſt captaines men war fight ſuffer goſpels ſake thanke thee praie thee ſame thy deere ſonne chriſts name thou wouldeſt forgiue ſinnes vnthankfulneſſe make perfect good thou haſt begun yea lord praie thee make worthie ſuffer impriſonment euen verie death thy truth religion goſpell ſake hanna applie dedicate giue hir firſt child ſonne samuel vnto thee euen ſo doo deere father beſeeching thee chriſts ſake accept gift giue ſonne iohn bradford grace alwaies trulie ſerue thee thy people samuel amen amen godlie praiers taken pſalmes written godlie harted gentlewoman ponder word lord conſider meditation harken thou vnto voice wofull mourning king god vnto thee make praier heare voice lord betimes earlie morning direct praier vnto thee thou art god haſt pleaſure wickedneſſe neither ſhall anie euill dwell thee thou hateſt worke vanitie leade therefore thy righteouſneſſe lord weake without thee haue ſtrength therfore lord god rebuke thine indignation neither chaſten thy heauie diſpleaſure haue mercie vpon lord deliuer ſoule oh ſaue thy mercie ſake almoſt wearie groning euerie night waſh bed water couch teares lord god thee haue put truſt ſaue mee perſecute deliuer lord god haue done anie ſuch thing laid charge anie ſuch wickedneſſe let mine enimie perſecute ſoule take captiue haſt thou lord god defended ſuch vngodlineſſe oh long wilt thou hide thy ſelfe thy poore afflicted ſeruant oh long ſhall ſeeke comfort ſoule ſo vexed hart yea long ſhall mine enimies triumph ouer conſider heare lord god lighten mine eies ſleepe death leaſt mine enimies ſaie haue preuailed againſt caſt downe trouble reioice truſt thy mercie lord hart ioifull thy ſaluation ſtorme thou makeſt weather faire ſtill weeping heauineſſe thou giueſt great ioie thy name moſt mightie god praiſed euer euer amen another praier lord conſider meditation complaining oh harken thou vnto praiers go fained lip let ſentence come foorth thy preſence let thine eies looke vpon thing equall hold thou vp going thy way footſteps ſlip haue called vpon thee god thou ſhalt heare incline thine eare hearken vnto word shew thy maruellous louing kindneſſe thou art sauiour put truſt thee keepe apple eie hide vnder ſhadowe thy wing vngodlie trouble mine enimies compaſſe round take away ſoule lord let man haue vpper hand let heathen iudged thy ſight may knowe themſelues men yet thy mercie lord forgiue mine enimies turne hart ſuch hate tell oft offendeth oh clenſe thou ſecret offence keepe thy ſeruant alſo preſumptuous ſinnes leaſt get dominion ouer ſo ſhall vndefiled innocent great offence let mourning teares ſorowfull ſighing hart come thy preſence alwaies accepted thy ſight lord ſtrength redeemer let thy good pleaſure rid deliuer trouble moſt humblie beſeech thee ſhew ſome token thy fauor poore wretched ſinner baniſhed woman looke vpon lord beſeech thee thou didſt looke vpon suſanna sarai daughter raguel thoſe holie woman truſted thee thou didſt deliuer hoped thee forſaken knowe lord thy ſtrength weakened neither thy power abated ſo thy good pleaſure lord thou wilt helpe make thy power knowne meane time mercifull moſt gratious lord god giue grace thankfullie patientlie take whatſoeuer ſhall thy good pleaſure laie vpon lord grant thoſe thing hartilie haue praied euer ieſus chriſts ſake lord redeemer thee holie ghoſt honour glorie praiſe amen god hath deliuered thee thy trouble ſing thoſe pſalmes 9 30 33 34 116 145 146 euer giuing thanks god almightie lord king ſaieng followeth thankeſgiuing trouble lord ſtrong rocke defence sauiour god might truſt horne alſo ſaluation refuge yea lord ſhepheard therfore lacke nothing hath comforted ſoule brought trouble euen mercy ſake though walke vale ſhadowe death feare none euill thou art thy rod thy ſtaffe comforteth thee lord haue put truſt feare fleſh bloud doo vnto haue waited long weeping teares haue taried lord leaſure hath great goodneſſe deliuered trouble moſt mightie god thine accuſtomed mercie preſerue ſinne wickedneſſe lord feele mine owne infirmitie weakeneſſe moſt mercifull lord keepe bit bridle ioifulneſſe doo forget dutie thee neighbour haue althings owne pleaſure nothing trouble v dailie enimie readie puffe v vp pride vnthankfulneſſe yea forgetfulneſſe thy lawes wherefore moſt mightie lord looke downe thy holie heauens euen thy fatherlie eies pitie ſtrengthen trembling ſoule thy holie ſpirit guide ſwarue frō thy truth taught holie scripture thought word deed may redound glorie honour woorthie praiſe thy moſt holie name teares moſt humblie beſeech thee grant euen ieſus chriſts ſake whoſe name come thee none ſaieng father c another thankeſgiuing trouble lord moſt humblie render lauds thanks praiſes vnto thee thou haſt ſet vp made foe triumph ouer lord god cried vnto thee thou haſt heard yea thou broughteſt ſoule trouble girded ioie gladnes sing praiſes vnto lord oye saint let v giue thanks vnto remembrance holineſſe wrath indureth twinkling eie pleaſure life euerlaſting heauineſſe may endure night ioie commeth morning thou didſt turne thy face lord lo ſore troubled cried vnto thee lord praied vnto god right humblie ſaieng heare lord haue mercie lord thou helpe trouble bow downe thine eare make haſte deliuer thou art ſtrong rocke deliuerer thy hand lord commit ſpirit thou haſt redeemed lord thou god moſt high oh reward ſhould giue vnto lord maruellous benefit hath done vnto mee woorthilie expreſſe trouble called vpon lord heard large temptation holie ſpirit mightilie preſerued therefore knowe lord ſide feare man doo vnto better truſt lord put anie confidence prince lord mercie plentious redemption earth lord full thy mercie therefore talke thy praiſe daie long ſing pſalmes thankeſgiuing vnto thee good haue beene trouble elſe ſhould haue learned thy ſtatutes delight beene thy lawes ſhould ſurelie haue periſhed trouble lawe god deerer vnto thouſands ſiluer gold yea rich world nothing woorth compariſon thy word comfortable moſt coſtlieſt pretious reſtoratiue anie phyſician make comforteth nouriſheth preſerueth ſoule leading vnto life euerlaſting oh lord god hoſts like vnto thee thy truth moſt mightie god endureth euermore alwaies giue thanks vnto thee great benefit thou haſt beſtowed righteous ſhall heare thereof reioice yea vnrighteous ſhall feare lord ſaie doubtleſſe god defendeth ſeruants alſo doth puniſh wrong dooers thou art god dooeſt woonderous thing lord may compared vnto thee thou deliuereſt thy poore oppreſſed ſeruant hand ſtrong enimie yea ſuch one mightie deale withall thou haſt ſaie mightilie defended lord mindfull command ſpirit receiued grace thy good pleaſure amen inſtruction chriſtians conteining fruitfull godlie exerciſe well wholſome fruitfull praiers reuerend diſcerning god holie commandements sacrament tranſlated french english right vertuous godlie matrone gentlewoman named mistreſſe dorcas martin pſalme vnder pontius pilate crucified dead buried deſcended hell third daie roſe againe dead aſcended heauen ſitteth right hand god father almightie thence ſhall come iudge quicke dead beleeue holie ghoſt egypt houſe bondage firſt table 1 thou ſhalt haue none god 2 thou ſhalt make thee grauen image neither anie ſimilitude thing heauen aboue neither earth beneath water vnder earth thou ſhalt bow downe woorſhip lord thy god gealous god viſiting iniquitie father vpon child vpon third generation vpon fourth hate ſhewing mercie vnto thouſands loue keepe commandements 3 thou ſhalt take name lord thy god vaine lord hold giltleſſe taketh name vaine 4 remember sabboth daie keepe holie sixe day ſhalt thou labour doo thy workes ſeauenth daie sabboth lord thy god thou ſhalt doo anie worke thou thy ſonne thy daughter thy manſeruant thy maideſeruant ſtranger within thy gate ſixe day lord made heauen earth ſea reſted ſeauenth daie therfore lord bleſſed sabboth daie halowed ſecond table 5 honour thy father thy mother thy day may bee prolonged vpon land lord thy god giueth thee 6 thou ſhalt kill 7 thou ſhalt commit adulterie 8 thou ſhalt ſteale 9 thou ſhalt beare falſe witneſſe againſt thy neighbour 10 thou ſhalt couet thy neighbour houſe neither ſhalt thou couet thy neighbour wife ſeruant maide oxe aſſe neither anie thing thy neighbour summe thou ſhalt loue lord thy god thine hart thy ſoule thy mind firſt greateſt commandement ſecond like vnto thou ſhalt loue thy neighbour thy ſelfe theſe two commandements hangeth whole lawe prophet matth 7 verſe 12 whatſoeuer ye would men ſhould doo euen ſo doo ye lawe prophet iohn 15 verſe 12 commandement ye loue one another haue loued iohn 13 verſe 35 heereby ſhall men knowe diſciples ye loue one another praier ſaid morning one awaketh helpe name lord hath made heauen earth god father moſt humblie praiſe thanke thee thine infinite goodneſſe mercie hath pleaſed thee watch night while ſlept preſeruing ſo manie kind danger wherevnto miſerable life ſubiect lord beſeech thee bring memorie thy great innumerable benefit alſo according may able comprehend end may likewiſe render thanks ſame leaſt vngratefull towards thy maieſtie thou haſt done good forget thou alone haſt preſerued inconuenience herewithall beſeech thee moſt gratious father thy mercie continue thy fatherlie care thou haſt vntill ſuch time ſhall reſt happie ſleepe whereof reioice ſleepe peace lord ieſus chriſt thy ſonne vnitie holie ghoſt liueth reigneth god thee eternallie exerciſe houſholder familie praie morning god father sauiour ſeeing hath pleaſed thee giue v grace paſſe night come vnto daie preſent vouchſafe alſo beſtowe goodneſſe vpon v may emploie ſelues altogether thy ſeruice ſuch wiſe neither thinke ſaie doo anie thing onlie pleaſe thee obey thy good end mean work may praiſe thy name edifieng neighbour hath pleaſed thee cauſe thy sunne ſhine vpon earth lighten v corporallie vouchſafe alſo cleereneſſe thy ſpirit illuminate vnderſtandings heart direct v vnto ſtreight waie righteouſneſſe euen ſo thing ſoeuer may applie ſelues let chiefe end purpoſe alwaies walke thy feare ſerue honour thee looking wealth proſperitie thy holie bleſſing end enterpriſe nothing ſhall agreeable vnto thee moreouer let v ſo trauell bodie life preſent alwaie haue regard namelie life heauen thou haſt promiſed vnto thy child neuertheleſſe let pleaſe thee protector touching bodie touching ſoule ſtrengthening v againſt temptation diuell deliuering v danger may come vnto v becauſe nothing well begun doth continue vouchſafe receiue v thy holie gouernance onlie preſent daie whole life continuing increaſing dailie thy grace v till thou haſt brought v vnto full coniunction thy ſonne ieſus chriſt lord true sunlight ſoules ſhining daie night without end perpetuallie intent may obteine theſe grace thee vouchſafe forget fault paſt pardoning v thine infinite mercie thou haſt promiſed vnto ſeeke thee good heart heare v father mercie thy ſonne lord ieſus chriſt ſake 143 pſalme 8 let v heare thy louing kindneſſe morning thee truſt ſhew v waie ſhould walke haue lift vp hart vnto thee 9 deliuer v lord enimies haue cried vnto thee 10 teach v doo thy thou art god praier ſaie one begin worke lord god father vouchſafe aſſiſt v holie ſpirit gouerne guide v ſuch ſort ſhall doo ſaie thinke may glorie name ſonne ieſus chriſt lord another praier ſame purpoſe god father sauiour ſeeing hath pleaſed thee command v trauell ſuſtentation neceſſitie vouchſafe thy grace ſo bleſſe labour thy bleſſing may extend vnto v without alſo able continue let ſuch fauour thine ſerue v teſtimonie thy bountifulneſſe aſſiſtance ſame may knowe fatherlie care thou haſt v moreouer let pleaſe thee lord aſſiſt v thy holie ſpirit end may faithfullie exerciſed eſtate vocation without anie guile deceit rather regard followe thine ordinance ſatiſfie owne deſire gaine pleaſe thee proſper labor giue v alſo willing mind ſuccour thoſe neceſſitie according abilitie thou haſt granted v ſo yet mind lift vp ſelues aboue thoſe haue receiued thee ſuch liberalitie thou wilt handle v greater pouertie neceſſitie fleſh ſhall deſire let pleaſe thee lord ſhew v grace euen knowe thou thy bountifulnes wilt continuallie nouriſh v leaſt tempted miſtruſt patientlie abide vntill thou repleniſh v onelie thy corporall gift alſo thy ſpirituall grace may ſtill haue ample matter occaſion thanke thee ſincerelie ſtaie ſelues vpon thine onlie goodneſſe heare v father mercie thy ſonne ieſus chriſt lord praier ſaie afore one begin ſtudie leſſon 119 pſalme verſes 9 18 34 wherewithall ſhall yoong man redreſſe waie euen taking heede therevnto according thy word open thou mine eies may ſee maruellous work thy lawe giue vnderſtanding ſhall keepe thy lawe yea ſhall keepe whole hart lord art fountaine wiſdome knowledge ſeeing hath pleaſed thee giue mee meanes inſtructed age mine infancie make mee knowe gouerne whole courſe life holilie honeſtlie vouchſafe alſo illuminate mine vnderſtanding ſelfe blind may comprehend learning ſhall taught vouchſafe confirme memorie keepe well let thy pleaſure diſpoſe hart receiue willinglie ſuch deſire conuenient mine ingratitude occaſion thou offereſt loſt doo vouchſafe powre vpon thy holie ſpirit ſpirit ſaie vnderſtanding veritie iudgment prudence learning may make able profit well end trauell ſhall taken teach loſt ſtudie ſoeuer applie ſelfe make reduce vnto true end namelie knowe thee lord ieſus chriſt haue full affiance ſaluation life thy grace ſerue thee vprightlie purelie according thy good pleaſure ſo ſhall learne may inſtrument aid vnto ſame ſeeing thou promiſeſt giue wiſdome vnto babe humble confound proud vanitie owne mind likewiſe ſhew thy ſelfe vnto thoſe right hart contrarilie blind wicked peruerſe vouchſafe bring vnto true humilitie whereby may yeeld ſelfe apt learne obedient firſt vnto thee ſecondlie ſuperiours thou haſt ordeined rule teach furthermore vouchſafe diſpoſe hart ſeeke thee without feinedneſſe renouncing carnall euil affection ſuch ſort may prepare ſelfe ſerue thee eſtate vocation ſhall pleaſe thee ordeine ſhall come age heare father mercie lord ieſus chriſt pſalme 25 verſe 13 lord ſheweth ſecrets vnto feare maketh knowe couenant praier grace ſaie afore meate thing wait vpon thee lord thou giueſt meate due ſeaſon thou giueſt gather thou openeſt thy hand ſatiſfied good thing lord conſiſteth fulneſſe good thing vouchſafe extend thy bleſſing vpon v thy poore ſeruants ſanctifie vnto v thy gift receiue thy liberalitie may vſe ſoberlie purelie according thy good meanes knowledge thee father author goodneſſe ſtill ſeeking principallie ſpirituall bread thy word whereby ſoules may bee nouriſhed eternallie ieſus chriſt thy ſonne lord matthew 4 verſe 4 man liueth bread onlie euerie word proceedeth mouth god grace meate let nation praiſe lord let people ſing praiſe vnto mercie multiplied vpon v truth endureth euer render thanks vnto thee lord god benefit receiue continuallie thy hand pleaſeth thee ſuſtaine v corporall life miniſtring vnto v neceſſities ſpeciallie hath pleaſed thee regenerate v hope better life thou haſt reuealed vnto v thy holie goſpell beſeech thee ſuffer affection rooted theſe corruptible thing alwaies haue higher reſpect waiting lord ieſus chriſt vntill appeere redemption praier ſaid ſleepe exhortation let v fall downe humbling ſelues high ſoeuereigne maieſtie good god father acknowledging v namelie poore miſerable ſinners praieng hartilie vnto followeth lord god father eternall beſeech thee pleaſe thee caſt eie thy fatherlie mercie vpon v thy poore ſeruants laieng charge ſo manie fault offence whereby worthie brought vnto thy iudgement whereby wee ceaſe prouoke thy wrath againſt v foraſmuch vnwoorthie appeare thy holie maieſtie vouchſafe receiue v name thy welbeloued ſonne lord ieſus chriſt accepting merit death paſſion recompenſe fault regarding rather obedience hath rendred vnto thee manifold fault dailie commit againſt thy maieſtie lord god ſeeing hath pleaſed thee create night man reſt ſo thou haſt ordeined daie trauell grant v grace ſo take bodilie reſt night ſoules may alwaie watch vnto thee hart lift vp thy loue ſo renounce earthlie care ſuccour ſelues according infirmitie requireth let v neuer forget thee let remembrance thy goodneſſe grace continue alwaie printed memorie meanes conſciences alſo ſhall haue ſpirituall reſt body take furthermore let ſleepe exceſſiue accompliſh eaſe fleſh beyond meaſure onelie ſatiſfie frailtie nature may diſpoſed ſerue thee moreouer let pleaſe thee preſerue v vnderfiled body ſpirits keepe v againſt danger verie ſleepe may glorie thy name ſeeing daie ſo paſſed haue offended thee manie way according poore ſinners ſo hid darkneſſe thou ſendeſt vpon earth vouchſafe alſo burie fault thy mercie leaſt thereby bee taken thy preſence let pleaſe thee alſo lord god illuminate v thy holie ſpirit true vnderſtanding thy holie bring paſſe alſo may yeeld vnto thee loue feare true faithfull ſeruants doo owe vnto maſters child vnto parent ſeeing hath pleaſed thee ſhew v ſuch grace receiue v number thy ſeruants child amen praier church faithfull king earth haue aſſembled prince come togither againſt lord againſt chriſt trulie herod pontius pilate gentils people iſrael haue gathered themſelues together citie againſt holie child ieſus thou haſt annointed doo thoſe thing thy hand thy counſell hath determined done lord behold threatnings giue vnto thy ſeruants may ſpeake thy word boldneſſe ſo thou ſtretch foorth thine hand healing ſignes ieſus anſwered ſaid vnto take heed man deceiue manie ſhall come name ſaieng chriſt ſhall deceiue manie yee ſhall heare warres fame warres ſee troubled theſe thing muſt come paſſe end yet matth 24 ſhall ſignes sunne moone star earth sea water ſhall roare men hart ſhall faile feare looking thoſe thing ſhall come earth behold figge tree tree ſhoote foorth bud ye ſee knowe owne ſelues summer nigh hand likewiſe yee ye ſee theſe thing come paſſe vnderſtand kingdome god nigh hand luke 21 daie houre man knoweth angel heauen father onlie time noah ſo ſhall likewiſe comming ſonne man day floud eate drinke marie maried euen vnto daie noah entered ſhip knew nothing till floud came tooke awaie ſo ſhall alſo comming ſonne man matth 23 take heede ſelues leaſt heart ouercome ſurfeting dronkenneſſe care world daie come vnwares ſnare ſhall come vpon ſit face earth watch therefore continuallie praie ye may obtaine grace flie ſhall come ye ſtand ſonne god luke 21 take heed watch praie ye knowe time man gone ſtrange countrie hath left houſe giuen authoritie ſeruants euerie man worke commanded porter watch watch therefore yee knowe maiſter houſe come whether euen midnight whether cockecrowing dawning leaſt come ſuddenlie ſhould find ſleeping ſaie vnto ſaie vnto men watch praie matth 13 ſober watch aduerſarie diuell roring lion walketh ſeeking whome hee may deuoure whome reſiſt yee ſtedfaſtlie faith finallie let v praiers remember praie queenes moſt excellent maieſtie pleaſe almightie god proſper hir hir affaire ſend hir long triumphant reigne ouer v ſhe may ouercome hir enimies painefull life ended ſhe may reigne chriſt heauenlie kingdome receiue glorious crowne neuer ſhall periſh finis third lampe virginitie conteining ſundrie formes diuine meditation christian praiers penned godlie learned properlie vſed qveenes excellent maiestie especiallie vpon 17 daie nouember daie gladneſſe hir hart memorable feast hir coronation ſo day time hir grace pleaſure wherevnto alſo added moſt heauenlie heast ſpoken perſon god vnto hir maieſtie conteining diuine commandement concerning gouernement right godlie chriſtian vow vttered againe hir grace vnto god comprehending heroicall office dutie prince faithfullie compiled holie pſalmes princelie prophet king david learnedlie explaned theodore beza verie profitable often read meditated vpon hir maieſtie chriſtian ruler
