v mother womb giueth v good thing grant v likewiſe quietneſſe mind peace time thy grace may abound toward v continue defend v liue almightie mercifull father thy breath take life thy bleſſing doth abide v thee liue moue haue man liueth bread onlie owne wiſedome forecaſt neither art thou bound fatall chaine ſecond cauſes thy decree enioie life thing created thy becke doo continue thou thinkeſt good giue v onlie ſtore thing neceſſitie life grant alſo meate drinke vertue power releeue ſtrengthen body thou alone vpholdeſt thing thy word power unleſſe thou dailie didſt feed v hidden grace thou dooeſt inſpire bread feed v heapes yeerelie increaſe ſmall purpoſe aboundance wheate wine thing yet vnleſſe watered thy bleſſing quicklie would come naught ſhould periſh lacke food aboundance ſubſtance poſſeſſe without thou proſper fructifie ſame thy bleſſing albeit feed bread yet aſcribe life vertue bread neither thy power tied bread man life included within ſame altogither dependeth vpon thy good pleaſure beſeech thee thy moſt large bountifull liberalitie caſt v time old age ſtrength faileth v forſake v likewiſe confirme faith diſtruſt thy promiſes neither driuen thee anie meanes ſeeme neuer ſo contrarie naturall cauſes giue grace may withdrawe eies worldlie conſultations touching food neceſſaries life may wholie depend vpon thee time go beyond limit thou haſt prepared lord ieſus chriſt liueth reigneth thee euermore amen noonetide middaie ſaie thus lord light inlightning welfare whence true brightneſſe light doth come grant beſeech thee thy goodneſſe thou haſt giuen thus plentifullie corporall light compaſſe bodie euerie ſide ſo thy mercie giue aboundantlie ſpirituall light thy grace knowledge may inlighten mind cauſe mine age appeare cleere noone daie becauſe lord nothing world ſo perfect glorious full decreaſe weare awaie euen ſee courſe thy glorious creature sunne higheſt begin drawe downeward graunt alſo beſeech thee age fortie yeeres bodie little little ſhall begin fade beautie thereof wither drawe towards end togither ſoule daie iudgement may ſhine bright sunne higheſt doth may begin glorified full region celeſtiall world sunne righteouſneſſe brightneſſe perpetuall charitie felicitie doth euerlaſtinglie ſhine inlighten holie companie heauen amen elſe thus lord let thy fauour preuent v doth sunne higheſt region ſpreadeth beames ouer part earth brightneſſe therof ſhineth without cloud ſame ſort giue v thy cleereneſſe ſhewe thy bright countenance ouer v lightened thy word wee may walke daie thorough circumſpectlie warilie way thy commandements blinded mid daie run headlong darkeneſſe neither grope noone daie night wandering path thy iudgements open thine eies god ouer v thou vnto v mightie protector daie firmament ſtrength couering againſt heate parching ſhadow noone tide defender offence aſſiſter falling comforter ſoules lightener mind giuer health happines chriſt lord amen ¶ meate better keepe vaine exerciſes idle cogitation ſpend sabboth daie wholie holilie lord behooueth take occaſion god name either cathechiſe child familie praie preſeruation queenes moſt excellent maieſtie reade deuoutlie ſome theſe godlie meditation praiers god work feaſts following sundaie praier right keeping sabboth sundaie eternall father lord ieſu chriſt togither thy sonne holie ghoſt didſt create man thine infinite mercie powredſt ſimilitude thoſe thing moſt excellent thee fountaine goodneſſe wouldeſt nature temple ſeeing thine image ſhine therein continue celebrate ioifull sabboth man defaced thine image pluckt thee thy sonne thine owne ſubſtance ſhould take fleſh vpon made ſacrifice ſinnes mankind bee crucified die yea great sabboth daie lawe lie graue word vnſpeakable manner reſted may receiue againe ſocietie new celeſtiall sabboth beſeech thee grant thy sonne lord sabboth may begin life reſt v heale corruption nature holie ſpirit heauenlie fire drie vp dropſie fleſh may loue v bone bone make v one ſpirit finallie bring v glorious companie eternall sabboth ſuch excellencie conceiued hart man meane let v ceaſſe hurlie burlie toiling drudging vaine trumperie world ſo laſt may religiouſlie halowe keepe godlie reſt new sabboth ſuch thing allowable pleaſant vnto thee ſanctifieng thee true reſt peace drawe v vaine fantaſies preſent thing may attend await vpon thee thy ioifull comming grant ſaie may humbled vnder thy mightie hand may knowe infirmity obeie thee croſſes correction looke vnto thee liuelie faith hope ioifull deliuerance ſhall perfect thy sonne trumpet ſhall ſummon new sabboth drawe vnto high ſitteth thy right hand exalted thine elect thine enimies beaſtlie arrogancie bluſhed contend fight againſt thee ſubdued amen another almightie god moſt mercifull heauenlie father ſixe day thou haddeſt created thing didſt reſt ſeauenth daie ſanctifiedſt teach v keepe holie sabboth daie ſhew cercmonie onlie much euerie good woorke thou haſt commanded part faſhion ſake wholie end thine owne glorie ſake wee beſeech thee lord heale onlie head limmes alſo hart ſoules may lawfull keeping thy sabboth thy commandements obedient vnto thee lord sabboth thou haſt taught v right keeping sabboth ſtand chieflie dooing good one vnto another giue v grace continuallie keepe sabboth inuiolable vnprophaned may onlie doo thoſe thing holie acceptable vnto thee may ceaſſe lewd work way eſpeciallie lord grant may auoid carefullie firſt ſtep ladder leadeth horrible ſinne blaſphemie forgiuen neither world world come amen ghoſtlie meditation meete v chriſtians occupie ſelues daie leaſt thoſe whoſe leaſure ſerue weeke euerie sundaie holie daie author found old ancient written copie excellent matter therin conteind hath thought good publiſh glorie god profit church firſt let v call memorie bountifull goodneſſe almightie god extended towards v creation firmament earth ſea therein conteined hath made onelie comfort ſeruice v let v alſo conſider greatneſſe omnipotencie power able word onlie nothing make althings thoſe ſo wonderfull work able comprehended within compaſſe man reaſon call alſo mind vnſearchableneſſe diuine wiſedome ſo goodlie order continuallie doth conſerue thoſe thing laſtlie let v forget incomparable loue towards v onlie meere goodneſſe without anie part ableneſſe deſerts hath prouided theſe thing vſe onlie hath moreouer made v capacitie vnderſtanding diſcuſſe knowe vſe ſame ſeruing neceſſities diuerſitie time occaſion requireth let v therefore ſhew ſelues vnto vnthankfull nextlie let v call mind ſundrie peril well ghoſtle bodilie hath dooth time time preſerue v namelie peril land peril water peril fire peril ſicknes impriſonment open ſhame ſlanders extreme beggerie famine peſtilence horrible diſeaſes ſudden ſhamefull death ſundrie miſchiefes may vnderſtand haue happened dailie doo perceiue happen vnto others ſhould like ſort haue happened vnto v mercifull goodneſſe beene therefrom preſerued herewith let v alſo call vnto mind health wealth god good gift hath lent vnto v render vnto moſt humble thanks therefore alſo let v thinke hath made v vile ſort condition euen vnto owne likeneſſe indued moſt pretious gift reaſon vnderſtanding memorie noble gift hath giuen v intent ſhould theſe honour accordinglie doo doo abuſe ſame worldlie vaine fantaſticall delight may aſſure ſelues onelie make ſtraight account thereof alſo moſt greeuouſlie puniſhed therefore moreouer let v call mind mercifull like moſt louing maiſter sauior chriſt sonne god ſecond perſon trinitie lord king ouer rule power deſcended downe boſome father heauenlie throne miſerable world tooke vpon fraile fleſh ſuffering ſame ſpace three thirtie yeeres hunger thirſt cold watch pouertie euil report hatred diſdaine ſlanders rebuke check taunt ſcornes buffet binding beating whipping wrongfull accuſation falſe condemnation yea laſt moſt vile ſpitefull cruell ſhamefull death innocentlie giltleſſe thereby deliuer v gilt eternall death tranſgreſſion firſt parent adam moſt iuſtlie deſerued herewith let v alſo thinke reproch ſhame v repine grudge ſuffer like ſake ſith lord maiſter ſingular loue beare vnto v hath ſuffered thoſe ſakes ſhould ſeruants rather vile ſlaues reſpect diſdaine repine onelie maiſter king ouer king hath diſdained ſuffer alſo let v conſider merit moſt bitter paſſion grace giuen vnto v sacrament baptiſme hath forgiuen v cleerelie clenſed v vtterlie diſcharged v former ſinnes herevpon let v call mind oft ſince time haue offended falling againe deadlie ſinne therewith let v call remembrance particularitie offence greeuouſneſſe ſame long haue continued without repentance taken let v weigh abundance great mercie firſt gratiouſlie hath abidden time repentance readie hath beene forgiue v vpon due repentance taken perfect confeſſion without diſſimulation made thereof vnto remember alſo lewdlie wickedlie ſinfullie haue beſtowed ſhort time god hath world lent vnto v fight warre continuallie againſt moſt mortall aduerſaries world fleſh diuell trauell without ceaſſing worke euerlaſting deſtruction bring v euerlaſting death beereue v life eternall ioies endleſſe thinke alſo god great mercie gratiouſlie ſpared v life vntill repented wickednes wretched condition moſt extreme torment hell paine beene ſo ſhould haue continued euer world without end deere ſhould thoſe ſhort pleaſures vaine delight fleſh haue beene vnto v let v alſo call mind houre death vncerteintie time thereof knowe maner ſhall like moſt certeine eſcape ſo wee ſure happen depart life deadlie ſinne ſhall onelie die bodilie death alſo ſpirituall death eternall death bodie ſoule let v therefore endeuour ſelues ſo liue though euerie houre ſhould vnto v laſt houre meanes ſhall vnreadie ſuddenlie ſoeuer death ſhall ſteale vpon v yet ſhall feare cōming furthermore let v thinke ſhall become wretched body vile carcaſes haue ſought meanes pamper whoſe eaſe wee haue ſo much procured haue ſo delicatelie nouriſhed haue ſo finelie araied whoſe vaine pleaſures haue ſo much followed doubtleſſe ſhall become abhominable ſtinking carion thoſe moſt deereſt friend ſhall forced turne awaie head ſtopping noſes verie noiſomneſſe corrupt ſauour euill ſtinch thereof let v alſo conſider ſhall auaile v poſſeſſions rich haue ſought ſo buſilie ſo greedilie heape togither muſt leaue behind v ſhall carie awaie nothing v ſauing heauie burden conſcience ſuch part doo vnlawfullie poſſeſſe wrongfullie withhold elſe haue euill gotten let v weigh ſhall become ſoule ſhall leaue bodie rot earth ſelfe ſhall called iudgement high iudge ſhall forced make ſtreight account work word thought ſhall able conceale nothing verie ſecrets dooings ſhall made open aſhamed confeſſe ſhall manifeſt booke ſhall opened deed thought ſhall rehearſed whole companie heauen ſhall ſaid euerie one v behold man work ſhall conſcience accuſe v euill deed witneſſes ſhall come againſt v diuell ſhall readie drawe v eternall perdition terribleneſſe countenance ſhall put v horrible feare ſhall tremble quake deſire haue reſpite amendement former wicked life repent v ſinfull liuing wiſe may bee granted v aſmuch mercie muſt giue place iuſtice let v therefore god doth lend v time repent time doo vnfeinedlie may aſſure ſelues receiue mercie forgiueneſſe god aſmuch willeth death ſinner rather ſhould conuert liue let v alſo weigh ſelues noble thing ſoule greeuous hir wound curing sauiour chriſt neceſſitie wounded yea thoſe beene vnto death death eternall ſonne god ſhould neuer haue ſuffered shall lightlie eſteeme loſſe ſoule vnto may perceiue ſo much compaſſion ſhewed ſo great maieſtie ſith hath ſhed teares v let v likewiſe nightlie waſh bed cōpunction hart continuall teares verie heauineſſe wee haue ſo greeuouſlie offended ſo louing maiſter ſith fleſhlie pleaſures worldlie reioicings euill concupiſcence ſo ſhort vaine pleaſures continuall torment miſerie doo endure neuer ſee light neuer receiue eaſe paine comfort heauineſſe fire continuallie burneth yet neuer conſumeth long burning leeſeth anie part heate woorms doo gnawe conſcience diuels tormentor waxe neuer wearie tormenting take anie pitie intreated mitigate anie part torment nothing among people declare thy woonderfull thing thou art mightie lord worthie praiſed great thy vertue thy power woonderfull thanke thee holie father god heauen becauſe thou haſt created thy word power vniuerſall world creature whatſoeuer liueth moueth ſame thy wiſdome thou dooeſt gouerne ſending thy ſpirit yet doeſt vphold cheriſh ſame wood fruitfull tree ſtones graine flower herbes graſſe feeld region aire bird feathered fowles ſundrie kind food man glorifie thee giuing whole frame earth creature ſame vnto mankinde ſetting man ouer work thine hand haſt ſubiected thing vnder foot ſheepe ox yea beaſts feeld fowles aire fiſh sea walke path sea eſpeciallie praiſe thee lord maker making v thy creature reaſonable men woman according thine owne ſimilitude giuing v reaſon ſenſes preſeruing v hitherto thou didſt nouriſh v woonderfullie within mother wombe thereof haſt thou brought v ſound part without imperfection yet continueſt thy fauour dooeſt keepe v againſt danger deliuereſt v euill hath breath praiſe lord praiſe ye lord amen another meditation thanksgiuing creation world moſt mightie moſt wiſe moſt maruellous lord god nothing haſt created heauen earth therein haſt prepared due new property euerie worke thou haſt brought foorth thy diuine word holie commandement haſt ordeined eſtabliſhed holie work thy hand ſo yet ſtand ſerue vſe ſeruice men courſe heauens neuer ſtand ſtill ingendered vnto v euer haue need ſame courſe alſo dieth withereth rotteth old bicauſe old decaied ſhould ariſe vp new freſh courſe haſt thou mightie god made ſo maruellouſlie ſo agreeably man thorough agreeable work thine hand without anie externall learning teaching inſtruction might come knowledge inuiſible thee thy holie exalted euerlaſting bleſſed godhead inuiſible might inſomuch none make himſelfe vngiltie inexcuſable miſbeleefe ignorance farre ſoeuer departed thy holie word verie heauens giue knowledge inough thy diuine glorie though haue tongue ſpeake neither doo heare anie thing mouth yet neuertheleſſe voice gone corner world place men heare voice ſounding eares man ſo farre diſtant feeleth alwaies benefit come heauens alſo ſeeth continuallie thy maruellous handie work firmament dooth ſhew declare vnto v thanke thee praiſe thee laud magnifie thy glorious name moſt meeke lord thy benefit eſpeciallie thou haſt thought inough thee haue giuen v heauens earth therin ſerue v inſtruct v alſo haſt vouchſafed ſend thine onlie deere beloued sonne sauior ieſus chriſt downe amongſt v vale teares aſcended heauen haſt left v thy holie word ſent thy holie ghoſt v intent may hencefoorth liue godlie ghoſtlie life ſo fleſh may hindered paſſe pilgrimage ſuch perfection thou requireſt chriſtian men may knowe diſcerne vſe thy glorie vnmeaſurable great good thing thy large image infunding creating reaſonable ſoule mortall tranſitorie ſoules vnreaſonable beaſts ſuch ſoule liueth like ſpirit ghoſt god euer ſoule man knoweth thee god doth beleeue thee ſhall behold thee ſoule bodie together thou haſt made man aboue creature ſo much ſuperiour haſt ſo highlie exalted thou haſt made prince chiefe gouernour lord captaine ouer thy creature earth haſt caſt vnder foot ſubiection moſt mercifull lord powre v thy heauenlie light may euer haue due regard vile lothſome ſtuffe matter thy godlie hand hath made v thou haſt neuertheleſſe exalted v ſo mightilie miſerie let v knowe ſaie lord man crept duſt mire woman rib hir huſband end may anie meanes puffed vp pride vaineglorie preſumption great glorie wherewith thou haſt vouchſafed endue cloath v true humilitie may impute exhibit thing vnto thine onlie goodneſſe clemencie grace mercie may bee drawne thereby vnto loue thee kindle lampe ſoules cold thy loue light thy grace ſo may diligentlie fulfill accompliſh thou haſt commanded v leaue thou haſt forbidden v like becommeth thine obedient child ſo vale miſerie alſo afterward heauenlie paradiſe vndefiled like vnto thee may found like thou haſt created v like place among thing thou haſt made according thou liſtedſt couldeſt kneweſt doo certes lord thy hand could haue made ſome ſtone ſome bird ſome ſerpent ſome beaſt knew haue done would bicauſe thy goodneſſe ſtone ſome tree ſome beaſt trulie bicauſe thy goodneſſe hath ſo ordeined bicauſe thou louedſt firſt haſt thou done ſo maker heauen earth bottomleſſe deepe haſt neede wherevpon commeth thou haſt thus loued lo bicauſe thou haſt created cauſe thou didſt create account number thy creature thy foreordinance euerlaſting thou madeſt anie thing euen beginning thou didſt ſpread heauens yet deepes neither haddeſt thou yet made earth founded mountaines neither anie waterſprings yet broken thou madeſt theſe thing ſaie thou madeſt thy word thou foreſaweſt moſt aſſured prouidence thy truth ſhould thy creature alſo thou willedſt ſhould thy creature whence commeth moſt gentle lord moſt high god moſt mercifull father alwaies moſt meeke deſerued kindneſſe ſhewed ſhould like thy roiall maieſtie create thou diddeſt create nothing nothing thou madeſt ſomewhat maner ſomewhat drop water fire bird fiſh ſerpent ſome brute beaſts ſtone block thoſe ſort thing haue onelie thoſe thing haue onelie growing yet thoſe kind thing haue onlie growing feeling aboue theſe thing thy haue ſort haue onlie thoſe haue growing growe alſo thoſe kind thing haue growing feeling alſo doo growe feele yea thou haſt made ſmall od betweene angel haue receiued reaſon knowe thee thy hand well well ſaie ſome od betweene v haue happie knowledge thee alreadie poſſeſſion haue hope ſee thee face face ſee thee riddle glaſſe ſee thee fullie partlie howbeit thing commeth perfect ſhall vnperfect done awaie ſuch time ſhall behold thee vncouered face face ſhould let v counted little inferiour angel ſeeing thou lord haſt crowned v garland hope decked glorie honour ſeeing thou haſt inhonoured v exceedinglie thy friend rather fellowes coequals thing thine angel uerelie euen ſo ſaith thy truth equall angel ſonnes god elſe ſonnes god made fellowes angel ſhall ſonnes god verie deede ſonne man become ſonne god trulie bethinke bold ſaie man onlie little inferiour angel yea hailefelowe angel alſo ſuperiour bicauſe man god god man angel reſpect may ſaie man woorthieſt creature becauſe word beginning god god word whereby god ſaid let light made light made word whereby god created althings beginning euen ſelfeſame word became fleſh dwelt among v haue ſeene glorie lo heere glorie glorie diſcreetlie lo heere ioie ioie diſcreetlie lord god whole life glorie ſoule therefore acknowledge vnto thee lord god thou createdſt indued reaſon thou didſt create ſort equall angel thy word may perfect attaine equalitie angel ſo may haue adoption thy child thine onlie begotten word lord thy deer beloued son thou art well pleaſed onelie coheire ſame ſubſtance euerlaſtingnes thou thy ſelfe art yea euen ieſus chriſt onlie lord redeemer inlightner comforter ſpokeſman thee light eies life ſauiour onlie hope hath loued v himſelfe whome haue aſſured truſt laid vp ſtore ſtedfaſt faith theeward entrance come vnto thee becauſe hath giuen power become child god manie beleeue name giue praiſe vnto thy name lord creating thine owne image haſt made capable ſo great glorie become ſonne god trulie tree doo ſtones doo ſpeake generallie anie thing doo moue growe aire ſea earth aſmuch hath giuen power thy word become ſonnes god becauſe haue reaſon power whereby knowe conſiſteth reaſon hath giuen power vnto men whome created reaſonable owne image likeneſſe certeſſe lord thy grace woman grace may thy child thing whence haue lord ſouereigne truth true ſouereigne beginning creature whence haue lord may become child god thing cannot thou art endureſt euer thou haſt made thing thou haſt made man beaſts ſtones greene thing earth went deſert afore went good turne afore thou haſt created thing onlie thine owne goodneſſe creature hath deſerued none deſerued ought thy goodneſſe ſhewe ſelfe creature thou haſt made reaſonable without reaſon alone deſerued thou ſhouldeſt make able become child god denie ſame abilitie reſt god forbid ſhould thinke ſo thine onlie grace thine onlie goodneſſe brought paſſe might partaker ſweetneſſe grace therefore whereby thou haſt created nothing beſeech thee lord giue grace thankefull vnto thee thy creature put truſt vnder ſhadowe thy wing goodneſſe wherethrough thou haſt created helpe thy creature whome thy gratious goodneſſe hath created let periſh naughtineſſe thy goodneſſe hath wrought let periſh wretchedneſſe thy ſingular mercie hath made auaileth thou haſt created ſhall ſinke downe mine owne corruption god haſt thou made ſonnes men vaine thou haſt created lord rule thou thing thou haſt created deſpiſe worke thine owne hand god thou haſt made naught lord thou gouerne ſhall returne naught againe like thou madeſt nothing ſo thou gouerne ſhall yet againe brought nothing ſelfe helpe lord life leaſt periſh mine owne naughtineſſe lord thou hadſt created ſhould haue beene becauſe thou haſt created thou gouerne vndone mine owne merit mine owne deſerts haue ſaid made thee create thine owne moſt gratious goodneſſe mercifulnes louingneſſe thine lord god made thee create beſeech thee let ſame make thee gouerne booteth thy louingneſſe cauſed thee create muſt periſh mine owne wretchedneſſe thy right hand gouerne lord god let mercifulneſſe cauſed thee create created cauſe thee alſo ſaue created let louingneſſe wan thee create win thee alſo ſaue ſith leſſe thou art verie loue mercie ſelfe thou continueſt alwaie one vnchangeable immortall inuiſible god bleſſed praiſed euer euer amen god hath put thing vnder ſeruice man conſideration temporall benefit coniecture heauenlie wiſedome goodneſſe god thou gratious god haſt put thing vnder man foot end man alone ſhould wholie ſubiect vnto thee end man ſhould wholie thine thou haſt made man lord thy work thou haſt created outward thing bodie bodie ſoule ſoule thee might ſerue thee onlie loue thee onlie poſſeſſing thee comfort inferiour thing ſeruants whatſoeuer conteined vnder cope heauen inferiour vnto man ſoule made inherit ſouereigne goodneſſe aboue become happie poſſeſſing wherevnto ſticke faſt ſhall ſurmount need inferiour thing changeable euerlaſting immortalitie quietlie behold ſouereigne maieſtie whereof repreſenteth image ſhall enioie thoſe excellent good thing lord houſe compariſon whereof thing ſee counted nothing thoſe thing eie hath ſeene eare hard hart man conceiued god hath prepared loue trulie lord theſe thing wilt thou giue vnto ſoule theſe dooeſt thou loueſt men ſoules dailie glad hart thy ſeruants woonder theſe thing lord god thou inhonoureſt thine owne image thine owne likeneſſe wherevnto created end bodie though yet corruptible baſe might ſee thou haſt giuen v light ſkie hand thine vnweariable ſeruants sunne moone according thy commandement doo continuall ſeruice daie night thy child intent might breath thou haſt granted v pure aire intent might heare thou haſt giuen v diuerſitie ſounds intent might ſmell thou haſt giuen v ſweetneſſe ſents intent might taſte thou haſt giuen v quality ſauours end might feele thou haſt giuen v ſubſtances bodilie thing helpe v neceſſities thou haſt giuen v bearing beaſts refreſh v withall thou haſt beſtowed vpon v fowles aire fiſhes ſea fruit earth euerie ſore maladie diſeaſe thou haſt created medicine ſalue plaiſter earth euerie ſeuerall euill thou haſt prepared ſeuerall remedie encounter becauſe thou art mercifull full compaſſion thou potter knoweſt mettall made v claie thy hand holie lord god good maker theſe leaſt thing comprehend great thing theſe viſible thing comprehend thine inuiſible thing thou ſend ſo great ſo innumerable benefit vnto baſe corruptible bodie mine ſkie aire land ſea light darkeneſſe heate ſhadowe dew raine wind ſhowers fowles fiſhes beaſts tree diuerſitie herbes thing growe vpon earth ſeruice thy creature ſeruing turnes courſe ſeaſons eaſe v wearineſſe excellent praie thee great innumerable ſhall thoſe good thing thou haſt prepared loue thee heauenlie realme ſhall ſee thee face face thou doo ſo much v priſon wilt thou doo thy pallace great innumerable thy work lord thou king heauen earth ſith theſe thing exceeding good pleaſant thou haſt deliuered good men bad men togither common maner thing ſhall thoſe thou haſt laid vp ſtore good men onlie gift ſo ſundrie ſo innumerable thou dealeſt well thy foe thy friend great innumerable ſweet delightfull ſhall thoſe thou wilt deale onlie thy friend thou giue ſo great ſolace time mourning great ioies wilt thou giue daie wedding priſon conteine ſo manie delectable thing much delectable thing conteineth father houſe god eie without thee hath ſeene thing thou haſt prepared loue thee according manifoldneſſe thy mightie work ſo alſo great aboundance thy ſweetneſſe thou keepeſt ſtore loue thee great art thou lord god yea vnmeaſurable art thou end thy greatneſſe number thy wiſedome meaſure thy mercie neither end number meaſure thy bountifulneſſe like thou thy ſelfe art great ſo thy reward great thou thy ſelfe art price reward thy lawfull combators thee therefore honour glorie praiſe euer amen meditation god power beautie goodneſſe bicauſe thou lord wouldeſt haue v loue thee one lie dooſt thou intiſe allure prouoke v alſo dooſt command v ſo doo promiſing thy ſelfe vnto ſuch loue thee threatening v dainnation doo otherwiſe whereby may ſee great corruption naughtineſſe alſo thine exceeding great mercie toward v firſt concerning corruption naughtineſſe thing power rich authoritie beutie goodneſſe liberalitie truth iuſtice thou art good lord mooue v loue thee whatſoeuer thing ſee faire good wiſe mightie euen ſparks thy power beautie goodneſſe wiſdome thou art end thou mighteſt declare thy rich beautie power wiſdome goodnes c thou haſt onelie made ſtill dooeſt conſerue creature dauid ſaith heauens declarer ſetters foorth thy glorie booke teach v knowe thee faire thou art beautie ſunne moone ſtars light flower riuers feelds hils biro beaſts men creature yea goodlie ſcape forme whole world dooth declare mightie thou art taught creation world euen naught gouerning ſame puniſhing wicked mightie giant thereof ouerthrowing deuiſes repreſſing rage ſea keeping within hir bound ſtormes tempeſts fire theſe ſuch like declare vnto v thine inuiſible almightie terrible power whereby thou ſubdueſt thing vnto thee rich thou art world thy great infinite treaſurehouſe dooth well declare plentie onelie thing alſo euerie kind thing yea dooſt thou yeerelie dailie multiplie theſe kind manie ſeeds dooſt thou make one ſeed yea great increaſe dooſt thou bring vnto theſe put v remembrance exceeding rich thou haſt thine enimies loue thee moſt part world thou giueſt ſo plentifullie thy rich heere ſhall thinke thy ſelfe thou haſt laid vp thy freends good thou art creature generallie particularlie teach creature world thou haſt made commoditie ſaie thou mighteſt haue made v creaturs without ſenſe reaſon thou hadſt would amongſt thing none dooth ſo teach v thy great loue towards v dooth death thy moſt deerlie beloued ſonne ſuffered paine terror thereof yea hell ſelfe ſakes thy loue beene ſmall thing would neuer haue laſted ſo long chriſt would neuer haue died praiers meditation vſed foure ſeaſons yeere first springtime almightie renewer thing lord ieſu haſt made moſt goodlie world ſakes haſt garniſhed heauens ſo manie light vnto vſe daie night tempereſt earth ſundrie time ſeaſons ordeined thee nouriſher man beaſts thou reſtored life thing renew confirme v hope reſurrection promiſed thee medowes afore withered waxe greene againe new graſſe herb garniſhed diuers gem flower corne herbeth ſeeds buried hole ſhoote foorth tree dead afore waxe yoong againe new boughes goodlie decked new bloſſoms giue v hope fruit ſunne ſelfe increaſeth grace light brieflie whole face nature ſpringing againe whitherſoeuer turne eies dooth ſpeake preach thy goodneſſe towards mankind wherethrough ſundrie ſolaces thou dooeſt eaſe mitigate v fault driuen paradiſe deſerued exile grant ſaie good god borne againe baptiſme haue put old man made new creature neuer ſlide againe old age may euer greene perpetuall innocencie pleaſant breathing thy ſpirit may adorned dailie flower vertues proceeding fruit woorthie goſpell father holie ghoſt reigne world amen summer moſt wiſe gouernor ruler thing ieſu chriſt behold yeere obeieng thy commandment waxeth hot feruour ſunne preparing ripe fruit vnto vſe thy ſeruants humblie beſeech thee art true sunne without nothing bright ſoules neither bringeth foorth anie fruit ſtretch beames thy grace earth ſpirits daily may waxe hot fire thy gratious loue may bring foorth ſundrie fruit wholeſome good work thou haſt witneſſed thy holie goſpell thou art ſingularlie delighted meate drinke raine thy feruent loue thirſted alſo meate holie apoſtle paule hungered euen vnderſtood knowe meant thou cameſt world ſend fire among v neither diddeſt thou deſire anie thing ſhould kindeled except hart touched beames thy grace increaſe lord ieſu thou haſt giuen finiſh thou haſt begun vntill growe perfect men vnto meaſure thy fulneſſe foorth fruit powreth ſhe hath receiued vpon much body courage faileth ſo much ſpirit flouriſheth beſeech thee thou wilt maintaine increaſe thoſe thing thou haſt vouchſafed giue v thine onelie begotten haſt thou praiſe without liketh thee thou thy ſelfe lord art thiue owne praiſe thy work creature heauen earth praiſe thee according thy manifold greatneſſe thy praiſe lord incomprehenſible hart comprehend tong meaſure eare receiue theſe thing paſſe awaie thy praiſe lord continueth euer thought haue beginning thought haue end voice make ſound foorthwith paſſe awaie eare heareth hearing ceaſſeth thy praiſe ſtandeth faſt euer praiſe thee man able vtter foorth thy praiſes thy praiſe euerlaſting tranſitorie man praiſeth thee beleeueth thee thine owne praiſe man praiſeth thee acknowledgeth himſelfe vnable attaine thy praiſe praiſe perpetuall neuer fadeſt thee praiſe thee ſhall ſoule praiſed praiſe thee thou thy ſelfe dooeſt thy ſelfe thy ſelfe alſo haue praiſe thee haue true praiſe haue praiſe thee light alloweth light thou beeing true praiſe yeeldeſt v true praiſe looke often ſeeke praiſe anie body hand thine ſo often doo forgo thy praiſe becauſe ſhadowiſh thine euerlaſting hunt tranſitorie praiſe looſe eternall praiſe praiſe eternall lord god whome praiſe without whome praiſe able praiſe thee without thee let haue thee praiſe thee ſelfe lord ſhould praiſe thee duſt aſhes dead ſtinking dog woormes rottenneſſe praiſe thee moſt mightie lord god breath better fleſh praiſe thee dwelleſt euerlaſtingneſſe darkeneſſe praiſe light death life thou art light darkeneſſe thou life death lieng praiſe truth thou art truth woman better vanitie ſelf ſhall praiſe thee lord shall wretchedneſſe praiſe thee shall ſtinch praiſe ſweet ſents shall man mortalitie heere daie gone morrowe praiſe thee shall man rottenneſſe ſonne man woormes praiſe thee lord praiſe thee bred borne brought vp ſinfulneſſe praiſe ſeemelie mouth ſinner lord god let thine owne incomprehenſible power let thy vnbounded wiſedome let thine vnſpeakable goodneſſe let thine ouerpaſſing mercie let thy ſuperabundant pitie let thine euerlaſting vertue godhead praiſe thee praiſed thou thine owne almightie puiſſance alſo thy ſingular gratious goodneſſe louingneſſe whereby thou haſt created v lord life ſoule god manifold benefit generallie humble thanksgiuing vnto maiestie ſame thy handmaid whome thorough thy goodneſſe thou haſt created vttermoſt power praiſe thee god creator preſeruer deliuerer hart call mind good thou haſt done youth vp inſtant knowe vnthankefulneſſe doth greatlie diſpleaſe thee roote ſpirituall euill wind blaſteth burneth vp good damming vp fountaine thy godlie mercie euer work dead alreadie reuiue work aliue doo die hand recouer againe thy creature giue thanks thee lord leaſt vnthankefull thee deliuerer deliuering often dragon ſwallowed vp long ago thou lord hadſt plucked mouth often haue ſinned ſtood readie ſnatch vp thou didſt defend lord god dealt wickedlie brake thy commandements ſtood waiting carrie awaie hell thou withſtoodeſt offended thee thou didſt defend feared thee yet thou didſt keepe ſtarted awaie thee yeelded ſelfe mine enimie yet thou didſt fraie awaie ſhould take mee theſe good turnes haſt thou done lord god wretch wiſt ſo haſt thou often time deliuered diuels chap plucked lion mouth manie ſundrie way brought backe againe hell though wiſt haue gone downe verie gate hell thou haſt held going drew neere death dore thou haſt ſuffered take alſo thou haſt oftentimes preſerued mée bodilie death ſauiour haue beene attached ſore ſickneſſes haue beene manie danger ſea land thou haſt alwaies ſtood deliuering fire ſword perill mercifullie preſeruing trulie lord thou knoweſt death diſpatched time hell receiued ſoule beene damned euer thy mercie thy grace preuented reſcuing bodilie death alſo death ſoule lord god theſe manie good turnes haſt thou done ſaie blind wiſt vntill thou inlightenedſt therefore light ſoule lord god life whereby liue ſight mine eies wherewith ſee behold thou haſt inlightened perceiue liue thee yeeld thee thanks though little woorth ſlender farre thy benefit howbeit yet ſuch frailtie hath giue thou onelie art god gratious maker loueſt ſoules hateſt none thing thou haſt made behold chiefe among ſinners thou haſt ſaued may example vnto others thy moſt merciful louing kindnes acknowledge thy great benefit vnto thee thou haſt plucked bottome hell twiſe thriſe hundred time thouſand time yea alwaies made toward hell thou didſt alwaies bring backe againe thou mighteſt iuſtlie haue damned thou haddeſt would thou wouldeſt lord god bicauſe thou loueſt men ſoules beareſt men ſinnes might repent thy way full mercie therefore lord god ſee theſe thing diſcerne thy light hart aſtoniſhed thy great mercie towards thou haſt deliuered ſoule bottome hell brought backe againe life ſtarke dead thou haſt made thoroughlie aliue againe therfore altogither beholden thee life whole yeeld ſelfe wholie vnto thee let whole ſpirit whole hart whole bodie whole life liue vnto thee ſweet life thou haſt deliuered whole thou mighteſt poſſeſſe whole thou haſt made whole new againe thou mighteſt haue whole againe therefore let loue thee lord ſtrength let loue thee mine vnſpeakable ioie let mee liue hencefoorth ſelfe vnto thee whole life periſhed mine owne wretchedneſſe reuiued againe thy mercie thou art pitifull mercifull god manie thy compaſſions towards thouſands loue thy name therfore lord god thou ſanctifier haſt commanded thy lawe ſhould loue thee hart might yea euen bottome hart houres time wherein enioie benefit thy mercie ſhould periſh euer thou ruleſt euer ſhould euer die thou euer quickeneſt yea euerie moment thou bindeſt vnto thee much euerie moment thou beſtoweſt thy great benefit vpon therfore like houre inſtant time life haue vſe thy benefit ſo ought moment wherein ſhould haue thee remembrance mine eies loue thee vttermoſt power able doo except thou make able commeth euerie good gift excellent gift change intercourſe darknes loue thee commeth owne owne running thy mercie lord thy gift whoſe good thing thou commandeſt v loue thee giue v thou commandeſt command thou wilt another meditation god great benefit vnto thee ſouereigne light ghoſtlie phyſician health ſoule euer giue praiſe whole hart thy benefit wherwith thou feedeſt youth vnto mine old age euen till laſt gaſpe beſeech thee thy ſelfe forſake thou madeſt thou redeemedſt forlorne thou inlightenedſt darkneſſe thou raiſedſt dead yea forlorne dead thou cameſt downe boſome thy father tookeſt mortalitie vpon thee thou king cameſt downe thy ſeruant redeeme thy ſeruant thou gaueſt thy ſelfe intent might liue thou tookeſt vpon thee die ouercameſt death thou diddeſt ſet vp againe abaſing thy ſelfe lowe vndoone gone farre awaie ſinnes ſold ſinne cameſt thou bring againe thou didſt loue ſo well thou gaueſt thine owne blood ranſome lord thou haſt loued thy ſelfe thou diddeſt find thine hart die upon condition haſt thou ſo deere price brought mee backe againe baniſhment ranſomed bondage reſcued puniſhment called mee thine owne name ſealed thy blood remembrance thee ſhould euermore ſhould neuer depart hart ſake ſhunned croſſe thou haſt annointed oile wherewith thou thy ſelfe wert annointed might called chriſtian thy name chriſt behold thou haſt regiſtred vpon thine hand end remembrance mee might alwaies preſent thee yet notwithſtanding ſo remembrance thee alwaies preſent thus haue thy loue thy grace mercie alwaies preuented thou haſt oftentimes deliuered manie great peril deliuerer went aſtraie thou broughteſt mee backe againe ignorant thou taughteſt mee ſinned thou diddeſt chaſtiſe haue beene heauines thou haſt cheered haue beene deſpaire thou haſt recomforted haue beene fallen thou haſt lifted vp haue ſtood thou haſt vpholden haue gone thou haſt guided haue come thou haſt receiued haue ſlept thou haſt watched haue cried vnto thee thou haſt heard lord ſhall haue word vtter ſignes thy ſingular loue toward conſidering thine innumerable benefit wherin thou haſt brought vp beginning namelie euen benefit creation firſt beginning thou madeſt nothing thine owne image honouring aduancing among creature thou madeſt innobling light thy countenance thou imprintedſt vpon lampe hart thereby diſſeuering well ſenſible ſenſeleſſe creature abaſing mee little beneath angel yet ſmall matter ſight thy godhead without ceaſſng thou haſt dailie nouriſhed vnprofitable woorme ſtinketh ſinne ſingular exceeding great ſtore thy good gift benefit thou haſt ſuckled ſtrengthened thy little tender babe teates thy comfort intent ſhould wholie ſerue thee thou haſt appointed thy creature ſerue theſe manie good turnes haſt thou done vnto lord god life ſoule render vnto thee againe moſt humble hartie thanksgiuing beſeeching thee lord may pleaſure wretch alwaies talking alwaies thinking vpon alwaies giuing thee thanks god ſhew ſaie much bound loue thee make appeare much ought pleaſe thee open doore thy light may enter knowe acknowledge vnto thee whole hart thy mercie great toward mee thou haſt deliuered hart bottome hell ſo might euer praiſe thee thy good gift loue thee hart ſoule mind ſtrength yea verie bowel intrailes hart ſinewes lord god bleſſed ſweetneſſe delight thee whoſe name woonderfull praiſe woorthie heauen earth another forme thanksgiuing vnto god benefit praier grace confirme increaſe ſame moſt higheſt almightie eternall god whoſe glorie repleniſheth heauen earth thy holie celeſtiall power doo neuer ceaſe lauding thy moſt holie maieſtie ſhould ceaſe earthlie lowlie ſeruants redeemed pretious bloud thy onelie ſonne much thy louing kindneſſe fauour eſpeciallie worketh towards v alſo ought continuallie giue thanks thy great goodneſſe haue mercie mercifull father neceſſitie life dooth ſuffer v thanke thee continuallie wherefore though continuallie ought worſhip thee maker trembling feare giue thee thanks thy benefit nothing thou madeſt mee gaueſt liuing ſoule quickened thy holie ſpirit formed mee thine owne image might able receiue thee art high god thy prouidence thou haſt brought thoſe thing expedient giuen knowledge true faith thee planted godlie mind inſtructed myſteries thy holie word sacrament oh lord dare recite thy benefit number ſeeing thy louing kindneſſe vnſearchable bottomleſſe ſea innumerable ſo ſoone giue thanks thy benefit ſhewed old new haue euen ouerwhelmed oh lord great benefit may thee giue thanks fellowſhip hath vnrighteouſneſſe righteouſneſſe partaking darkeneſſe light agreement filthineſſe puritie follie wiſedome mortalitie thee art immortall oh vileneſſe oh thy goodneſſe yea though ſpirit readie yet fleſh fraile thou lord thou wilt canſt make ſtrong ſo moſt mercifull father vouchſafe may euer giue thanks laud thee good gift euer deſire thee thou firſt willedſt better knoweth good thou becauſe need mediator accept thine innocent sonne ieſus chriſt croſſe paſſion bloudſhed death reſurrection haue deſerued thou father thy mercie truth haſt ſame thy deerelie beloued sonne promiſed giuen v thy mercie fauour open therefore mercifull father thy deerelie beloued sonnes ſake euen daie thy woonted hand mercie fulfill mind hart good let thy right hand defend ſinnes acknowledge great innumerable therefore repent hartilie ſorie doo let thy goodneſſe father wipe awaie thy glorie forgiue ſinnes therefore fleſh may reioice thee thou lord onlie art pure without ſinne haue mercie vpon thy bondſeruant vppon people father bring vnto knowledge thee art onlie god ieſus chriſt whome thou haſt ſent onlie ſauiour redeemer mediator aduocate v preſent life bring v eternall bliſſe felicitie deere merit thy sonne ieſus chriſt thine power kingdome glorie euer amen another ſame effect honour praiſe giuen thee lord god almightie moſt deere father heauen thy mercy louing kindneſſe ſhewed vnto v hath pleaſed thy gratious goodneſſe freelie thine owne accord elect chooſe v ſaluation afore beginning world euen like continuall thanks giuen vnto thee creating v thine owne image redeeming v pretious bloud thy deere sonne vtterlie loſt ſanctifieng v thy holie ſpirit reuelation knowledge thy ſacred word helping ſuccouring v need neceſſitie ſauing v danger bodie ſoule comforting v ſo fatherlie trouble affliction ſparing v ſo long giuing v ſo large time repentance theſe benefit moſt mercifull father like acknowledge haue receiued thine onlie goodneſſe euen ſo beſeech thee thy deere ſonne ieſus chriſtes ſake grant v alwaie thy holie ſpirit whereby may continuallie growe thankefulneſſe towards thee led truth comforted aduerſitie strengthen faith lord kindle feruentneſſe loue towards thee neighbour thy ſake suffer v moſt deere father receiue thy word anie vaine grant v alwaie aſſiſtance thy grace holie ſpirit hart word deede may ſanctifie doo woorſhip thy holie name may help amplifie thy kingdome whatſoeuer thou ſendeſt may bee hartilie well content thy good pleaſure suffer v lacke thing father without ſerue thee bleſſe thou ſo work hand may haue ſufficient chargeable rather helpfull vnto others merciful lord vnto offence ſeeing debt great thou haſt forgiuen v ieſus chriſt make v loue thee neighbor ſo much thou father captaine defender temptation hold thou v thy mercifull hand thereby may deliuered inconuenience end liues ſanctifieng honouring thy holie name ieſus chriſt lord amen ¶ ſeuenteenth daie nouember commonlie called queenes daie sundrie formes chriſtian praiers thanksgiuings vnto god preſeruation moſt vertuous ladie elizabeth moſt deare dread ſouereigne quéene england france ireland defender faith c verie neceſſarie vſed generallie faithfull ſubiects continuallie ſo eſpeciallie mother hir daughter vpon ſeuentéenth daie nouember euerie sabboth holie daie honourable remembrance ioifull sabboth reſt peace carefull mourning memorable ſeuententh daie brought v baniſhed exile england perſecuted member chriſt moſt happie entrance hir moſt roiall excellent maieſtie hir emperiall crowne kingdome pſalme mother come feare god come hither praie giue eare reherſe ye great benefit lord hath beſtowed vpon v daughter lo moſt mightie men gathered power againſt v laie wait life conſpired togither worke deſtruction though lord determined ſame exhorted one another ſaieng god hath forſaken therefore perſecute flieng awaie take deſtitute helpe moth theſe men aduerſaries ſaie whereſoeuer remoued went ſea land laie wait moſt diligentlie v yea multitude cruell enimies ceaſſe craftilie enuiron beſet v round ran vpon v gaping mouthes like raging roring lion malicious mind bring v extremitie deuoure v daugh thy ſake lord alone killed euerie daie neither anie better condition ſheepe appointed butcher ſlaughter moth manie v wandered waſte wilderneſſe ſought ſtrange city commodious dwell halfe dead killed famine thirſt ouerwhelmed ſhadowe death caſt downe burthen miſeries laie downe flat cleauing earth daugh band death compaſſed v round bound v moſt wicked men like moſt raging flouds made v afraid enuironing v round moth ſnared caſt faſt bound chaines moſt darke dungeon yea taſted heate fire force water daugh called vpon lord theſe extremity called vpon lord ſaie heard voice high palace receiuing eares crie made vnto deliuered v miſeries diſtreſſe moth gathered v home ſcattered eaſt weſt north south brought v dungeon priſons darkeneſſe death breaking fetter giues iron peeces daugh lord hath deliuered life death ſtaid teares eies eſtabliſhed foot fall hath brought v diſtreſſe hence haue light whereby cauſeth v ſhine hath driuen awaie darkeneſſe moth therfore praiſe thee lord among nation ſing lauds vnto thy maieſtie yea declare thy power ſhew foorth thy praiſe mercie earlie morning becauſe thou queene gouernor daugh putteth hir onlie confidence thee god hir tower moth oh ſend hir ſtill continuall helpe thy moſt holie place daugh euermore danger defend thou hir moſt roiall grace moth let infernall fo haue anie aduantage hir daugh let wicked enimie approch hurt hir moth indue hir miniſters alwaie righteouſneſſe equitie daugh make thou thy choſen ſeruants full ioifullie praiſe thee moth lord ſaue thy people peril dow thy gift daugh bleſſe thou thine inheritance thy bountious benefit moth time lord giue v thy peace paſſeth vnderſtanding daugh bicauſe none god dooth fight v onelie thou king moth ſoften thou hardened hart clenſe filthie ſoules ſinne daugh thy ſpirit gift grace make v holie life beginne praier mother lord god moſt mercifull father vpon daie placing thy ſeruant moſt deer souereigne moſt gratious queene elizabeth empire kingdome diddeſt deliuer thy people england danger war oppreſſion body tyrannie conſcience ſuperſtition reſtoring peace true religion libertie grace may word deed hart ſhew ſelues thankfull obedient vnto thee ſame elizabeth vertuous queene thy grace may honour goodneſſe godlineſſe long manie yeeres liue reigne ouer v obeie enioie hir maieſtie continuance thy great bleſſings thou hitherto haſt hir thy bleſſed miniſter powred vpon v hir people beſeech thee grant vnto v thy deere son ieſus chriſts ſake lord sauiour daughter amen elſe ſaie thus yeeld vnto thee moſt mightie mercifull father immortall thanks hath pleaſed thee thy meere mercie fatherlie bountie ſtormes ſo manie troubleſome time conduct v vpon daie baniſhment exile comfortable port tranquillitie hand thy moſt gratious ſeruant deere souereigne ladie queene elizabeth ſheepe wandering aſtraie wilderneſſe thou ordeinedſt hir maieſtie bee ſhepheard gather v againe thy ſheepefold beene long toſſed hither thither outrage cruell furie tyrannicall perſecution like poore weatherbeaten barke hath beene continuallie tormoiled toſſed perilous ſurges outragious ſwelling ſeas finding ſure rode harborough wherein reſt continuallie danger either ſinke ſands ouerwhelmed waues violentlie daſhed peeces againſt maine rock euen ſaie deſpaired vtterlie ſafegard ſtanding ſtil feare hazard euerlaſting confuſion thou cōmittedſt helme guided hir grace wiſedome laſt conducted v hauen long deſired peace tranquillitie therefore whereas thou haſt placed hir regal throne dauid ioſias samuel yea ſhepheard ringleader waie true holineſſe ſincere religion inſpire hir mind manifold bleſſings thy grace ſhe may walke day hir life path thy commandements happilie diſcharge hir dutie ſtewardſhip diſpenſation thou haſt committed hir maieſties hand inflame hir mind loue thy holie goſpell hir deed thought practiſes may tend propagation planting thy word chriſtian religion theſe hir maieſties dominion incline motion hir vertuous diſpoſition aboue thing ſeeke thine honour glorie ſowe ſeeds catholike faith abundantlie place cut brood ſuperſtition idolatrie conſtitute true preacher thy word ſtabliſh euerie thine holie goſpell true religion preſerue hir moſt mercifull father hitherto thou haſt moſt miraculouſlie done diueliſh deuiſes practiſes hir enimies ſhe may haue long happie reigne among v aduancement thy glorie ioie comfort v hir ſubiects let hir naturall diſpoſition continue hir foe terrible hir ſubiects amiable hir offender mercifull vertuous bountifull indifferent men reſpects parciall point neither cauſes eccleſiaſticall yet matter concerning politike gouernement aſſiſt hir moſt mercifull father might thy heauenlie ſpirit quaile pride tripleheaded romiſh cerberus father thy great mercy haſt giuen vnto v peaceable prince gratious queene alſo haft hitherto verie often miraculouſlie ſaued hir ſundrie great peril imminent danger hir mercifull vnbloudie gratious gouernement haſt preſerued v whole realme manifold miſchiefs dreadfull plague wherewith nation round v haue beene yet moſt greeuouſlie afflicted haue mercie vpon lord grant v grace beſeech thee theſe redoubted thou lord haſt appointed ſacred thou lord haſt annointed feared thou changeſt hart like ſtreames water honoured thine owne image likeneſſe guiding angel creature pregnant cannot deuaile bearing rule earth ouer child men praiſe due vnto thee thoſe vnto whome thou leaueſt anarchie headleſſe diſſolution canibals monſtrous miſſhapen gouernement fanning fire ſtreaming bloud ſmoking miſt inhabitant meſchech turbulent rauenous ſwarmes hoſts tubalgog ſuch like thoſe contrariwiſe whome thou leadeſt like flocke ſheepe hand moſes aaron haſt choſen dauid thy ſeruant whome thou haſt loued feed people thine owne inheritance giuing vnto warre peace inciuilitie ſocietie ignorance knowledge ſuperſtition religion error truth hunger plentie vnprouidence policie diſſonancie harmonie miſerie felicitie making dwell ſafetie vnder wing thy defence ſhadowe thy protection ſuch hath beene thy mercie towards v tongue able expreſſe giuing v thy gratious pleaſure thine vnrecountable largeſſe liberalitie thy ſelect ſeruant elizabeth queene ſupreame gouernour v legue nation people hir obeiſance regiment ſtarre light influence ouer thing beneath thee firſt cauſe fountaine brightneſſe attained vnto cleere riuer plentifull brooke courſe water thee euerlaſting headſpring euen ſo ſhining beames flowing ſtreames thoſe thy mercy good gift haue beene ſithence day hir happie gratious gouernement thee conuaid deuolued vnto v people ſo much regard eſtate haled ſauage wood men cruell mendeuourers terrible ſpirits brutiſh beaſts old age firſt calling home grand anceſtors humane ciuilitie theſe day yeares degenerate true knowledge thee thy sonne ieſus chriſt vnto conſuming nakedneſſe idolatrie plaieng inordinate golden calfe owne making prieſts foure twentith sunne moſt happilie inuironeth firmament ſithence meanes poore veſſell weaker ſexe ſillie maiden thou performing glorious deliuerance thy people thraldome ſlauerie pharao egypt didſt annoint king daughter holie oile ſetting crowne pure gold vpon hir head inueſting hir purple ſcepter regall diademe realme ſithence time father owe thee hir god moſes breath noſtrels ſight light vſe aire eaſe hart peace conſciences whole worke welfare hir inſpired thee ſpreading hir beames hir appearing bloudie launce claunching murreans redoubling ſheelds haue beene ſhattered aſunder ſhiuers bated foiled mattockes ſpades flame fury quenched put poole grace flowed ouer realme lion reconciled lambe wilde aſſe ſet paſtured ſeelie kid abhomination deſolation remoued holie temple sonne man exalted lift vp high owne kingdome ſtoong firie serpent looke vpon ſaued admirable lenitie babylon hath put zion egypt become owne rahab harlot denizoned ieruſalem become wild oliues true garden plant iſmael iſrael miſcreant chriſtian painime proteſting profeſſing antichriſtian romaniſts heathen idolater faithfull euangelicall ſincerelie beleeuing woorſhippers thee ſpirit veritie according thy holie word neither hath coſt beene ſpared occaſion foreſlowed time ouerpaſſed trauell intermitted raiſe fallen win withholden call ſtraied heale wearied find loſt reſtore ruined repaire decaied make good enable abandoned preacher haue beene ſent foorth plentiouſlie lawes haue beene executed mercifullie order haue beene ſet downe politikelie danger haue beene declined diſcreetly tumult haue beene appeaſed victoriouſlie whole ſpacious dominion iles adiacent land gouerned triumphantlie ſo hard find man orderlie hath managed charge anie one houſhold daughter thy houſe hir virginall hand hath weelded weightie ſcepter ſundrie mightie populous nation hir time haue ſeene golden yeeres reigne hir father dauid peacefull kingdom salomon haue aduanced earth haue denied hir fruitfulneſſe ſea hir increaſe cloud drop heauens faireneſſe ſunne warmth yeere hir goodneſſe vallies ſtand thicke corne wilderneſſe crowned gladneſſe furrowes watered mountaines laugh ſing fold full ſheepe ſonnes daughter growe vp like poliſhed corner temple yoong men ſee viſions old men propheſie ieruſalem hir light ſhining vnto hir glorie lord riſen vnto hir queene bringing hir honor vnto citie dauid nation walking light thereof great honour thou iehouah haſt heaped vpon v honourable foraigne region worke thou haſt wrought thy choſen yea ſo much hath brightneſſe beautie beene powred abroade whileſt egypt round hath darkened euen whole world manner beſides v whome thou haſt gathered paſtures goſen thicke miſts errour haue blinded eies earth cloudie piller hath departed v daie firie flame night whileſt land round haue warred deſtruction one another moſes hath guided v peace whileſt nation like egypt round hath plagued deſtroier firſt borne ſitting vpon prince throne vnto vaſſall ſlaue grinding handmill moſes hath diminiſhed hir flocke whileſt firme land haue beene ouerwhelmed rage ſeas water iland hauing dwelt peace hath ſent hir ſhip ophir gold prepared hir nauie againſt danger enimie whileſt athalia hath murthered hir owne bloud ioas hath learned lawe lord iehoiada whileſt achas conſecrateth owne ſonne fire samaria eateth hir owne child walles eliza directeth child prophet office whileſt iezabel ſetteth vp baal embrueth achab bloud prophet naboth elia gathereth people god mount carmel behold wonder fire god lighting heauen vpon ſacrifices repleniſhing hart ioie tongue gift language ſo woorthie inſtrument thy goodneſſe expreſſe image thy maieſtie ample matter day celebritie doth thy people deſire thy hand firſt lord thou giue v thankefull hart make v day liues mindfull thy fatherlie gratious bountifulneſſe preſentlie queenes highneſſe hath gloriouſlie atchiued trauell full three twentie yeares annuall celebritie voluntarie ſacrifice praiſe thanksgiuing therefore returneth ſo may thy benefit full often returne twice yeare yeare yeare heaped vpon yeare ofſpring may behold felicitie vntill ſhe ſatiſfied aboundance time drawe along thou haſt appointed veiling hir crowne foot thy ſonne ieſus courſe earthlie pilgrimage ouerrun ſhe determined ſeaſons taken reigne euerlaſting kingdome thy glorie againe much miſchiefe man great enormous rage sathan ſubtill practiſes antichriſt euill deſerts lamentable ſtate thing whileſt open colouring hideth priuie conſpiring poiſoned lip giue ſugred word breath cockatrice embracing scorpion roring bulles ringing libel raging rabſake ſword herod deſtruction abbadon hath beene ſeene ſtreets hath beene heard walles hath multiplied gate city thou deſtroie v midſt work thy mercie leaue v headleſſe hopeleſſe make v ſcorne prouerbe enimie rather behold number faithfull ſubiects dread ſoules iuſt gealouſie common intereſt bowing knee hart long ſafetie queene elizabeth ſacred princelie perſon rather thy iuſt furie auenging ſinnes ſuffer diuell wicked preuaile vniuſt zealouſneſſe prepoſterous vowes graceleſlie ſwearing death thy saincts thine annointed laſtlie remaineth happie building thy church hand thy deere daughter thou plentifullie powre thy principall ſpirit vpon hir rauiſh hir hart flame loue thee thy houſe moſes leade ioſhua bring land promiſe debora fight battell iahel knocke siſera rome temple vſurped headſhip vtter deſtruction dauid bring home arke salomon finiſh conſecrate eternitie thy temple amongſt people earth time giue largelie hir foſtermilke hieruſalem heauen time pureneſſe hir virginitie preſented lambe ſing ſong hir wedding daie thy angel thy saincts praiſe thy glorious maieſtie father sonne holie ghoſt one eternall deitie euer euer amen another godlie learned praier moſt gratious ſouereigne ladie queene elizabeth almightie eternall god creator gouernor preſeruer thing lord lord king king madeſt man like vnto thine owne image ſhould honour ſerue obeie thee onlie thy creature ſhould ſerue vſe commoditie ouer whome thou madeſt lord ruler forbidden fruit onlie except moſt miſerable man owne diſobedience eating thereof loſt onlie kinglie prerogatiue brought himſelfe poſteritie ſtate virgin thy diuine prouidence power reſtore moſt miſerable man v whoſe child nature vnto ſtate eternall ſaluation ſuffer moſt ſhamefull moſt vile bitter yea moſt cruell painefull death croſſe whereon glorious bodie broken pretious bloud ſhead ſufficient ranſome full ſatiſfaction iuſt recompenſe thy iuſtice lawe beleeue embrace thy goſpell ſacred truth lord good god mercifull vnto v infirmitie fall lordlie man great grandfather adam liue anie peaceable good condition ſtate without magiſtrates king rule gouerne v therefore moſt humblie hartilie beſeech thy diuine maieſtie loue thine onlie sonne ieſus chriſt looke downe thy fatherlie compaſſion vpon thy ſeruant elizabeth moſt gratious queene dread ſouereigne graffe hir roiall hart working thy holie ſpirit thy manifold good gift benefit wiſdome grace perſeuerance thy truth increaſe faith affiance thee defend hir lord thy mightie hand outſtretched arme graunt vnto hir moſt honourable long proſperous reigne ouer v moreouer lord ſeruice golden veſſels thy temple ieruſalem acceptable vnto thee vouchſafe thy ſeruant eſteemed thy ſight moſt honourable ornament new ieruſalem built monie labour ſeruants firſt salomon bought pretious bloud ſecond salomon thy sonne sauiour behold hir make hir lord pretious ſtone ſignet thine owne hand apple thine eie white lillie ſweet roſe incloſed garden deere doue thy delight thy truth ſake enimies whereof make hir name moſt dreadfull church whereſoeuer diſperſed moſt acceptable ioifull confound put ſhame lord thoſe procure anie euill hir roiall perſon heroicall virginitie diminution hir kingdomes imperiall dignitie ouer multitude ſinnes lord thou wilt puniſh v wind thy diſpleaſure taking v fragrant ſweet ſmelling flower beſeech thee thine name ſake long defer lord plant hir garden paradiſe thy preſence ſhe may growe dwell felicitie incomparable eie hath ſeene eare hath heard neither euer came vnderſtanding man thoſe ioies thou haſt prepared hir thine elect moreouer lord grant thy heauenlie wiſedome grace vnto v hir ſubiects may aduiſedlie conſider dutifullie call remembrance manifold bleſſings ſo long time haue enioied doo preſentlie poſſeſſe thy mercie hir miniſterie authoritie execution hir kinglie office vnder doo onlie reape peaceablie enioie fruit labour corporall commodity alſo woorth euen freedome libertie conſcience preaching hearing thy moſt holie word adminiſtration receiuing thy holie sacrament manie thy bleſſings lord worke v thy grace yeeld vnto thy diuine maieſtie poſſible continuall praiſes thankſgiuing ſaid vnto v ten cleanſed england preſerued tyrannie enioie theſe benefit returning giue thanks quicken memory therefore lord neuer forgetfull thy great goodneſſe towards v make v thy ſake reuerentlie feare hir dutifullie obeie hir faithfullie loue honor ſerue hir naturall louing prince mother meane whome receiue theſe thy good bleſſings hir maieſtie perceiuing diligence readineſſe obeie ſerue hir may oftener put mind feare honor loue ſerue obeie thy diuine incomparable maieſtie furthermore inſpire hir roiall hart lord thy diuine grace ſhe hath begun ſet foorth mainteine thy ſacred truth ſo ſhe may zealouſlie boldlie increaſe perſeuere continue ſame whereby filthineſſe nakedneſſe antichriſt may reuealed ſuperſtition aboliſhed remoued old lieng ſerpent roring lion ſathan ancient enimie may reſtrained kept backe malicious purpoſe ſeeking deuour draw v ignorance ſecuritie grant lord great comfort hir honor immortall fame yea diſcharging hir owne conſcience kinglie dutie euermore reward crowne theſe thine owne good gift hir lord worke ſake ieſus chriſts ſake thou ſhalt great ſorowe loſſe hir great ioie profit take hir v crowne hir moſt mercifull god crowne euerlaſting glorie giue hir full poſſeſſion eternall kingdome purchaſed blood immaculate lambe thine onlie sonne sauiour redeemer ieſus chriſt whome thee holie ghoſt three perſons one immortall euerlaſting god honour dominion praiſe thanksgiuing euer euer amen another praier queenes maieſtie ſtate preſent come posteritie moſt gratious lord god king almightie iuſt euerlaſting vpon whoſe wil dependeth rule ſtaie direction althings heauen earth giuing men power dominion ouer people nation world obedient thy moſt holie commandements thou giueſt wiſe careful induſtrious vertuous happie proſperous king prince ruler magiſtrates rule gouerne peace bleſſing comfort wealth ſame vnrighteous people laſciuious contemptuous idolatrous ſuperſtitious blaſphemous rebellious againſt thy word maieſtie ſhall deliuered ouer hand tuition fooliſh idle diſſolute negligent vnfortunate prince ruler gouernours whoſe brutiſh diſorder looſeneſſe follie ſtate beautie ſtrength bond peace iuſtice loue gouernement ſhall neglected broken diſturbed ſpoiled inteſtine hatred diſcords elſe forren vanquiſhments diſcomfitures deſtroied whereby land people left praie inuaſion ſpoile rauine greedie victorious deſtroier mercileſſe rage executeth plague thy iuſt wrath lord ſo man woman child beaſt foule fiſh ſcapeth ſtripes thereof country townes city dwelling burnt ſpoiled rent torne made waſte iuſtice lawe diſcipline nurture ciuill fellowſhip honeſt art exerciſes religion knowledge feare thee ſcorned baniſhed perſecuted land filled abhomination beaſtlie tyrannie ſlaughter bloud robberie theeuerie rapine murder people killed beginning world daie theſe latter day ſpeciallie iewes aegyptians armenian graecians italian hungarian polonians others whoſe ſeruile thrall calamity ought neuer remembrance ſhould mooue v continuallie behold bleſſing thy loue heauie ſorrowes thy diſpleaſure wherefore abundance thy mercy louing kindneſſe loue thy deere sonne gift thy grace profeſſe truth goſpell beſeech thee mercifull father fauourablie looke vpon realme people england turne awaie thy face lord take thy grace holie ſpirit v let v ſtill enioie bliſſe comfort thy louing countenance keepe v thy waie couer v vnder ſhadowe thy wing ſuffer v taken thee make v followe put whole truſt confidence thee ſhall ſafe thy mightie hand god giueth victorie power thy fauour ſhall enimie vanquiſhed ſtrength brought nothing safe citie thou lord art watchman ſo ſtandeth thy tuition readie praie vnto ye deſtroier therefore go farre v god thine elect ſake heauens earth implement formed made nothing preſeruation maintenance rule gouernment deuiſed ſtabliſhed ſakes empire kingdom country nation preſerued ſaued bleſſed iniurie ignominie done thy truth holie name changed plaged ſubuerted deſtroied great thy mercie compaſſion lord long ſuffering ready forgiue behold v father haue mercie vpon v remember iniquity iniquity forefather take iuſt vengeance ſinnes neither reward thou v deſerts spare v good lord ſpare v thy ſweet sonnes ſake chriſt ieſus sauiour haue mercie vpon v yea lord haue mercie vpon v vpon poſteritie holding continuallie thy holie hand ouer v bleſſe v increaſe faith make child childers childrē obedient thy word holie conuerſation thy sonne redeemer make v acceptable vnto thy ſelfe god ſanctified faith loue toward thy heauenlie maieſtie may deliuered thy wrathfull diſpleaſure euermore powre foorth abundance thy grace bleſſing vpon queene fulneſſe thy gratious fauour ſhe may haue long life health happie day aided faithfull vertuous prudent counſellers miniſters doo thing nouriſhing maintenance true religion vertue increaſe light thy goſpell number faithfull godlie preacher miniſters thy word whoſe induſtrie labour peace tranquillitie thy church may largelie augment number thy saint glorie thy name ioie bleſſing land people preſeruation continuance whereof bowel thy fatherlie care fauor remember v louing god leaue neither v poſteritie headleſſe neither put v ouer yoke ſtrange irreligious prince bliſſefull day thy gratious handmaid queene father let pleaſe thee reſerue happie ioifull ſtate end giue peace concord thy people vertuous wiſe godlie fortunate prince whoſe conſtant zeale care induſtrie endeuour towards cheriſhing aduancement thy truth glorie may purchaſe thy fatherlie loue furtherance fill land people maner bleſſings thy heauenlie wiſedome knoweth neceſſarie beautified vertue godlineſſe ſhall proſper triumph continuall peace victorie giuing honor gladſome thanks thy glorious maieſtie thy deere sonne lord sauiour holie ghoſt reigneſt vnitie power glorie dominion praiſed euer euer amen another verie godlie praier meete ſaid true ſubiects time anie priuie conſpiracie open rebellion gratious souereigne queene elizabeth preſent ſtate almightie god king king lord lord onelie god gouernour thing thou art alone king doo reigne thou moſt high beareſt rule ouer kingdom men thou chriſt thine onelie sonne moſt gratious father thy choſen church dooſt comfortable nouriſhing diſpoſe roiall ſtate among men thy grace come paſſe engliſh nation portion ſame thy church doo enioie gouernement elizabeth queene thou haſt againſt practiſes thine hir aduerſaris deliuered peril thy mightie hand brought reigne ouer v mercifullie guiding hir thou haſt made hir v mother thine afflicted flocke nurſe benefit haue libertie true religion common peace maruelouſlie protecting hir thou haſt kept hir defend v vſe hold benefit quietlie euen thy mightie maruelous mercie thou haſt diſcouered practiſes ſuch craftie cruell enimies purpoſed ſpoile hir v v hir hir v thy religion peace determining deliuer v ouer tyrannie ſhameleſſe man rome bloudie ſword purpoſe miſchiefe thou haddeſt permitted preuaile ſuffered ſinnes thy hand lord moſt iuſtlie hand moſt vnnaturallie vniuſtlie doo offend thy maieſtie manie way offend anie way yet ſuch wickedneſſe hate v onelie bicauſe truth doo profeſſe ſerue thee cauſe conſpire againſt thee god like hypocrite againſt queene like traitours againſt commonwelth countrie like ſpoilers againſt v euen cain againſt abel thy great goodneſſe hath deuiſed better v doo thou haſt ſpared v would haue ſpoiled thy wiſedome hath vnfolded wickedneſſe thy prouidence hath preuented purpoſe honour praiſe thanksgiuing congregation euerie member thereof giuen thee god grace lord pitie father mercie euer euer beſeech thee mercifull father prouoked ſinnes giue v ouer luſt enimies doo make v reproch theſe heathen let iewes turke papiſt ouerthrowe triumph againſt thee ſaieng god thy rich mercie chriſt forgiue ſinnes thy renewing ſpirit amend v worke good worke thou haſt begun among v confound bring naught attempt theſe like enimies thou didſt babel infold follie owne counſels thou diddeſt achitophel thine angel ſinite force thou didſt senacherib deſperate attempt let drowned pharao treaſons ouertake thou didſt abſolon anie conuerted turne thou diddeſt manaſſes otherwiſe let feele due puniſhment dathan conſpirators theſe alſo may left example thy iuſtice poſteritie doo likewiſe moſt humblie beſeech thee continue thy goodneſſe towards v euer thine old woonted mercie deliuer queene elizabeth euill direct hir true knowledge thee acknowledge thy benefit towards hir hir dutie towards thee kindle hir hart zeale ſerue thee hir ſelfe haue thee ſerued v entirelie guide hir ſtill gouerne v iuſtlie godlie peace giue vnto v alſo ſubiects thankefull hart thee faithfull hir thee charitable towards men liue vnder hir gouernment counſellers miniſters euerie place calling may throughlie ſanctified holineſſe liue thee thus prolonging hir reigne ouer v doo thou hir plant thy religion among v ſo may power reforme rule v remaine poſteritie v praiſe thy name may continue hart mouth engliſh nation england may ſaie euer lord praiſed thanksgiuing vnto god benefit beſtowed vpon realme england ſuppreſsing late rebellion praier preſeruation prosperous estate gratious queene elizabeth almightie euerlaſting god maker heauen earth lord creature whoſe mightie hand humble lowlie aduanced proud ſtubborne thruſt vnder foote thy ſeruants giue thee moſt hartie thanks thy great bountifull goodneſſe thou haſt late without deſeruing beſtowed vpon v deliuering v cruell tyrannie bondage perſecution wherewith late oppreſſed alſo reſtoring v againe former peace quietneſſe free exerciſe faith direction thy ſacred goſpell ſtill maugre head enimies mainteined thee amongſt v comfort thy ſingular benefit gratious liberalitie excellent father becauſe wiſe able render vnto thee woorthie thanks therfore make humble ſute requeſt vnto thee lord may pleaſe thee thy holie name ſake accept good willes behalfe giue v grace day life remember maruellous worke thine partlie chriſtian deuout feruent praiers thy humble handmaiden moſt gratious queene thy people partlie ſure confidence truſt hir grace euermore put thee thou haſt without force ſtrength men put onlie hir enimies alſo thine thoſe fight againſt thee thy truth trauelled meanes diſanull quite ouerthrowe ſtate church religion eſtabliſhed woonderfull myraculous act thou haſt moſt gratiouſlie begun ſo beſeech thee thy tender mercy ſake go forward ſo eſtabliſh thy glorie may aduanced thereby craftie deuiſes malicious aſſaults diuell miniſters cleane ouerthrowne ſubdued chriſt thou king king prince peace ruler iſrael haue mercie vpon moſt deere ſouereigne ladie elizabeth grant thou hitherto haſt moſt ſingularlie bleſſed hir adorned hir maieſtie manie thy ſpeciall good grace bleſſings benefit thy glorie comfort ſo thankefulueſſe therefore vnto thy maieſtie continuallie hartilie faithfullie praie thee ioie thy heauenlie countenance may ſtill moſt gratiouſlie ſhine vpon hir humble hir ſoule thee hir guide director ſheeld preſerue defend hir power hir enimies thine hir aduerſaries may time time made thine hir footſtoole euer kept vnder hir foot mire ſtreets thinne ſcoom filthie fome light chaffe withered haie burnt ſtubble wind beſeech thee alſo lord thou ſcepter iſrael hir ſcepter may yet growe greene burgen fructifie flouriſh fruit true happineſſe glorie victorie princelie honor dutifulneſſe healthfull ſweetneſſe tenderneſſe beautie comlineſſe hir moſt roiall ſtate calling euen palmetree ſafelie well ſet ſoile happineſſe hir throne regall may ſteddilie ſtand euer without winding ſhaking ſwaruing tottering nodding euen ſeate salomon day hir grace regiment may vnto v thy glorie day heauen life ended make hir partaker brightneſſe thine thy father euerlaſting glory among thine annointed elect celeſtiall kingdome euerlaſting renowme grant chriſt thou moſt mercifull king gouernor ſitteſt vpon ſeate dauid haſt obteined euerlaſting kingdome choſen iſraelites euen thy mercy ſake amen another praier queene eſtate realme gratious lord moſt mercifull father acknowledge thee lord lord king king creating beginning ruling thing euermore heauen earth according thy woonderfull wiſedome power ſelues thy poore ſeruants worke thy hand ſheepe thy paſture ſubiected thy high maieſtie depending vpon thy fatherlie prouidence thing neuertheleſſe ſeeing thou thy wiſedome annointeſt king queenes appointing rule ouer people ſit lieutenant thy ſeate miniſter iuſtice moſt father nurſſes mainteine cheriſh thy church commanding v onlie obeie honor moreouer praie watching ouer v good therefore beſeech thee thy great name ſake ieſus chriſtes ſake ſhew thy mercie king prince mainteine thy glorious goſpell eſpeciallie praie thee bleſſe gratious queene elizabeth ſpirituall bleſſings chriſt ieſus temporall bleſſings according thy good pleaſure great meaſures thine effectuall lawe ſhe may find great increaſe vertue wiſedome ſtrength chriſt ieſu faithfull happie diſcharge hir dutie hir holineſſe ioie zeale thy houſe may multiplied euerlaſting ſeeing hath pleaſed thee thy ſingular mercie giue hir eſpeciall honor firſt ſuffer thy glorious truth afterward miraculouſlie deliuering hir hand hir enimies ſet crowne vpon hir head make hir inſtrument aduance thy glorie goſpell ſhe ſuffered bring hir darkeneſſe light perſecution great long peace giue thee moſt hartie thanks ſingular benefit ſo beſeech thee make hir v euermore thankefull thy good pleaſure ſtill preſerue hir continuance theſe bleſſings towards v increaſe time time thy glorie benefit thy church hir infinite peace chriſt ieſus prince peace furthermore praise thee hir eſtate ſuch enimies goſpell hir enimies alſo defence therof may deſpiſe peace offered vnto repentance may accompt thy long ſuffering hir peaceable vnbloudie gouernement occaſion ſaluation ſoules vnfeigned loue truth mercifull souereigne otherwiſe ſtil remaine diſobedient thy truth diſloiall hir highneſſe dangerous ſtate god ſaluation thou haſt diſcouered ſo diſcouer ſtill thou haſt preuented ſo preuent ſtill let eies ware wearie looking hart faint waiting comming yet commeth neither let come lord beſeech thee bleſſed long reigne hir grace peace zion euermore alſo deere father ſo bleſſe ſo loue ſo thy ſpirit ſanctifie keepe hir ſhe maie ſpirit counſell fortitude ſo rule ſiſter alſo namely hir commonwealth may flouriſh together growe vp together palmetrees beautie ſtrength giuing aid help one another church glorie god may appeare sunne brightneſſe land may flowe milke honie true peace abound therein ye triumphant reigne debora theſe grace lord great miſerable ſinners vnwoorthie leaſt therefore looke v thy ſelfe iniquity thy great mercy accepting death paſſion thy sonne full ranſome offence throwing bottome ſea making croſſe reſurrection effectuall v obedience godlineſſe becommeth thy saincts thy good bleſſings towards gratious souereigne may added ſhe gouerneth bleſſedlie ouer bleſſed people people bleſſed lord beloued lord thy grace may abound church commonwealth daie daie till daie tranſlation thy kingdome iuſtice inhabiteth alſo ſhall inhabit reigne thee according thy promiſe euer grant v theſe thing mercifull father thy deere sonne lord ieſus chriſtes ſake whoſe name craue thy mercifull hand praieng furthermore hath taught v praie father c pſalme 72 another praier proſperous eſtate flourishing reigne right vertuous ſouereigne queene elizabeth god without whoſe wiſedome kingdome ſtand ſpeciall conſideration haſt ordeined kingdome familie dauid teach queene elizabeth whome thou haſt appointed rule right gouernement teach ſaie daughter thy dauid whome thou haſt choſen thy ſelfe rule righteouſneſſe ſhe may iuſtlie gouerne hir people thine eſpeciallie ſhe may defend poore againſt iniuries mightie thus people ſcattered heere mountaines hilles ſafe vnder iuſt gouernment ſhall abound commodity peace grant vnto hir ſhe far tyrannie may ſure refuge poore ſhe may comfort family oppreſſed pouertie iniuries ſhe may keepe vnder ye falſe accuſers moſt ſharpe puniſhment ſo come paſſe lord ſtate kingdome ordered thine authoritie men meete ſhall acknowledge feare thee anie ſhort continuance time sunne moone ſhall ſooner ceaſſe courſe thou ſhalt faile woorſhipped thou againe wilt powre downe vpon thy people heauen good thing like ſhowre comming downe vpon new mowne medowes none otherwiſe thou vſeſt water earth ſhowers due ſeaſon whileſt elizabeth reigneth thus gouerned thy grace holie ſpirit iuſt ſhall flouriſh great peace ſhall ſo continued firme courſe ſtarres queene hir ſelfe ſhall haue dominion one ſea euen frō euphrates fartheſt coaſts earth inhabitant country deſert ſhall come vnder hir yoke falling downe vnder hir foot hir enimies falling downe hir ſhall licke duſt earth king silicia ilands ſhall offer preſents vnto hir ethiopian alſo arabian ſhall bring hir gift finallie king ſhall haue hir admiration hir renowme vertue nation ſhall reuerence hir name maieſtie hir righteouſneſſe ſhall bee praiſed whole world becauſe ſhe heareth crie poore doth defend needie forſaken hath mercie needie ſhe refreſheth thoſe danger life defendeth poore againſt iniurie mightie neither doth ſhe ſuffer violence done vnto vnreuenged therefore thou god wilt keepe hir ſafe gold ſhall brought vnto hir midſt arabia men ſhall make praiers hir life ſafetie ſhall dailie wiſh proſperitie vnto hir ſeeing ſafetie family nation conſiſteth preſeruation hir maieſtie let v hartilie haue good cauſe praie inceſſantlie hir grace ſafetie welfare church thoſe loue fauour hir therein defend god thine owne hand woorthie woman ſacred queene whoſe endeuour thou haſt vſed reſtore peace thy church religion thy people ſaue woorthie princeſſe elizabeth ſaie whome purpoſe thou haſt indued moſt rare ſingular wiſedome power conſtancie roiall gift grace grant men may dutifullie honour obeie hir prince peace mother iſrael nurſe thy church woorthilie hir vertues ſet ouer v thee god reigne finallie grant gouernement paſtor chiefe ſhepheard may want neither integritie vprightneſſe taking counſell neither wiſedome performing hir enterpriſes according thy ſhall wheate reaped eueriewhere full handful verie top mountaines corne growing high tree libanus ſhall ſuch multitude inhabitant city may almoſt ſeeme like plant ſpringing earth yea ſhall hir noble memorie roiall fame euer euen durable ſunne queene elizabeth example pietie felicitie vnto kingdom nation world ſhall accept hir bleſſed among woman vnto thee lord prince celeſtiall company author thing ſo woonderfull rare gift hir maieſtie ſhall poſſible praiſe eſpeciallie giuen yea fame thy glorie praiſed magnified euer euer let fill heauen earth euen ſo let god amen another dailie praier perpetuall happineſſe ſacred gratious souereigne queene elizabeth almightie god king king lord lord thine hand power heauen earth thou confirmeſt kingdom againe dooſt alter according thine heauenlie pleaſure praiſe thee magnifie thee extoll thine holie name hath pleaſed thee appoint ouer v good gratious queene dooth gouerne counſell rule wiſdome grant hir beſeech thee continuall peace long life much happines deliuer hir maieſtie hand hir enimies rule thou hir mind ſhe may ſerue thee alwaies feare reioice trembling let hir maintaine imbrace pure religion defend hir people profeſſion chriſts goſpell againſt error ſuperſtition whatſoeuer giue hir wiſedome vnderſtanding doo ſuch thing gratefull thy ſight profitable v hir ſubiects hurtfull none god eternall father heare petition elizabeth queene hir trouble name chriſt sauiour glorifie hir comfortable aid holie spirit vphold hir euermore mindfull hir grace hir good lord remember hir offering make hir praiers acceptable thy ſight giue hir according hir hart deſire fulfill hir petition proſper hir purpoſes may reioice thy ſaluation triumph name thee god bleſſe hir lord euermore wee may knowe hir protector cloud harken vnto hir thy holie heauens oh ſend hir helpe thy ſanctuarie aid hir aboue thy mightie right hand bringeth ſaluation let hir enimies plainlie knowe god thou wilt ſaue thine annointed though ſome truſt horſes chariot yet remember name god ſhall fall ouercome wee couragiouſlie perſiſt lord protect hir maieſtie heare v call vpon thee thy ſtrength ſhe may reioice mightilie triumph thy ſaluation grant hir deſire hir hart denie petition hir lip thou haſt preuented hir notable bleſſings put crowne pure gold vpon hir head hath aſked life thee thou wilt giue hir long life great hir glorie thy ſaluation honour fame haſt thou put vpon hir thou haſt ordeined hir exceeding bleſſedneſſe dooſt comfort hir hart thy cheerfull countenance bicauſe ſhe delighteth chriſt doubteth thine euerlaſting mercie god giueſt victorie vnto king didſt deliuer dauid perill ſword ſaue redeeme deere queene elizabeth deliuer hir hand child another deuotion ſhe whoſe mouth vttereth vanitie right hand right hand falſhood yea let hir hand lord light vpon
