blaſphemie railing euill ſpeaking againſt ſhameleſſe ſinners reuiled reuiled againe ſuffered threatened committing vengeance iudgeth righteouſlie deſpiſed ſhame endured croſſe ſuffered v wretch leauing v example ſhould likewiſe followe ſteps whoſe ſtripes healed wo ala euer ſinned oh ſoule come therefore let v laie awaie preſſeth downe ſinne hangeth ſo faſt let v run patience vnto battell ſet v loking vp vnto ieſus captaine finiſher faith onelie reioice croſſe chriſt ſeeing haue redemption bloud euen forgiueneſſe ſins paſt preſent come much knowe redeemed old vaine conuerſation corruptible thing ſiluer gold euen pretious bloud chriſt owne ſelfe bare ſinnes bodie tree deliuered ſinne ſhould liue vnto righteouſneſſe ſuffered alſo v fleſh hencefoorth ſhould liue much time remained fleſh luſts men god reioice onelie croſſe chriſt let v take heed walke thoſe enimies croſſe chriſt crucifie dailie afreſh blaſphemie maner vngodlineſſe whoſe bellie god whoſe glorie ſhame whoſe end eternall damnation bodie ſoule rather thoſe haue conſciences purged dead work ſerue liuing god let v paſſe reſt time abode trembling feare euer reioice croſſe chriſt ſufficient v wee haue ſpent time paſt life gentile walking wantonneſſe luſts exceſſe wine exceſſe eating drinking exceſſe riot abhominable idolatrie therefore crie wo ala euer ſinned vpon wretch thus greeuouſlie haue offended god god aſke thee mercie haue mercie vpon lord haue mercie vpon wo mee euer tranſgreſſed oh ſoule let v eſteeme knowe nothing ſaue ieſus chriſt crucified yea god forbid ſhould reioice anie thing croſſe lord ieſus chriſt whereby world crucified v vnto world crucified chriſt may liue god hauing libertie enter holie place bloud ieſus new liuing waie hath prepared v vaile fleſh let v conſider one another prouoke vnto loue good work drawe nigh true penitent hart aſſurance faith ſprinkeled hart euill conſcience meditate dailie mercy giue thanks continuallie benefit paſſion eternall redemption ſtill reioice croſſe chriſt ieſu lord ſaie praier lord ieſu chriſt sonne liuing god mouth hartie affection wee glorifie thee praiſe thy name immortall thanks thine infinite goodwill towards mankind thou vouchſafeſt become interceſſor v vnto thine heauenlie father bearing horrible wrath conceiued againſt v ſinnes offering thy ſelfe death adorne v eternall glorie thou waſt hanged croſſe made curſſe v ouerwhelmed ſorowes heauie fleſh bloud beare thou ſufferedſt diſpleaſure conſuming fire god thou ſhedſt thy bloud thy whole bodie thy death thy member beeing pierced oh chriſt oh ſweet ieſu thou ſhedſt thy pretious bloud ſaie ſixe ſeuerall time ſundrie part thy bleſſed bodie afore thine execution v miſerable ſinners namelie firſt thy circumciſion beginning redemption ſecondlie thy praier garden earneſt deſire redemption thirdlie thy whipping fourthlie thy crowning thornes reward redemption thy ſtripes healed fiftlie thy crucifieng nailing croſſe thy hand foot bored faſten thee thereon price redemption ſixtlie laſtlie wounding piercing thy bleſſed ſide yea thy verie hart thou hanging dead croſſe true ſacrament redemption whereby cleanſed purified waſhed ſinnes among theſe thy diuers torment afore thy execution thy ſpirits reſolued ſenſe infinite anguiſhes thou ſufferedſt enduredſt oh chriſt thou vtteredſt diuers word partlie reaſon intollerable greefe partlie thine vnſpeakable goodnes oh teach v thy wiſedome reuerentlie liſten vnto put carefullie bottome mind thy death mankind ſeuered two part thou head penſiue church hangedſt vpon croſſe redie yeeld vp ghoſt croſſe ſtands thy louing mother marie godlie woman iohn thy weake diſciples moorning rage iewes hide themſelues nichodemus ioſeph aramathie great greefe mind faine hold tongs winke outragious crueltie nation againſt thee graceleſſe iewes vngodlie ſouldiers pilate herode laie hold thee mocke thee blindfold thee buffet thee pierce thee plaie thy garment epicure tyrant high prieſts paraſits haue thee deriſion laugh ſleeues ſee thy death conſpired may walter ſuperſtition wickedneſſe multitude ethniks quarter world celebrate filthie vngodlie feaſts great diſhonour thy name thou beholdeſt diuerſitie men ſeeſt thing heauen earth beeing deed humble meeke hart thou powredſt moſt charitable praier wiſe father forgiue knowe doo theſe word thy prieſthood thou art chiefeſt prieſt bedewed thine owne bloud entring holieſt holie place toucheſt breſt father ſearcheſt enen ſecret counſell thou praieſt onlie thy weake auditor ſtrengthned alſo thy verie enimies put thee ſo ſhamefullie death returne vnto repentance yea mankind thou praiedſt namelie euerie one ſhould beleeue thy name moſt mercifull interceſſor include ſelues theſe thy generall praiers recited thine agonie repeated croſſe yea vttered beginning world ſtanding right hand thy father making interceſſion v ſounded continuallie eares god worke ſo found number thoſe whome ſathan hath entred blaſpheame thee deſpiſe thy benefit deſtroie themſelues vtterlie increaſe faith knowledge thee eternall father thy ſacrifice pleaſed may forgiue ſinnes receiue v companie glorious thine eies croſſe ſtandeth thy noble ſorowfull mother hir ſiſter good woman thy diſciple iohn whome thou louedſt bleſſe v thy goodnes ioine v companie thy mother ſhineth notable light ſtrength faith ſhe beholdeth thee hir sonne thoſe ſights none could greeuous world ſhe ſawe rage thine enimies thine intollerable torment yet ſhe beleeued notwithſtanding greeuouſnes thy paine ſhedding thy pretious bloud flight thy diſciples crueltie thine enimies odiouſnes thy death ſhe beleeued ſaie force faith thou waſt god nature ſhouldeſt riſe againe reigne euerlaſtinglie ouercome death diuell ſubdue thine enimies sonne god kindle within v praie thee like ſparks faith giue v grace thine elect neuer aſhamed ſtand vnder thy croſſe thou euen entire good mercifullie among thy ſeruants didſt ſpeake vnto comfort thy penſiue moorning mother ſo ſpeake vnto v thy troubled church miſerie comfort hir thy ſweet voice preſence thou commendedſt thy mother thine apoſtle make v vnfeignedlie loue church thy ſweet true mother grant euerie v may cheriſh ſame louinglie mainteine vttermoſt power eſpeciallie guide preacher may loue mother nouriſh vnitie pure doctrine auoid ſeed hereſies remooue ſtumblingblockes occaſions hindering faith praier yoong chriſtians thy ſides hang two theeues puniſhed ſinnes according lawe deſerts whereof one deſperatelie powring blaſphemous ſpeeches godlie requiring thy fauour ended day mankind lord doo likewiſe hang miſeries ſinnes whereof ſome ſo captiued mind point death ſcoffe blaſpheme deſperatelie vtter condemnation finiſh day giue v grace beſeech thee may imitate example gratious theefe paſſage life moued infallible argument thine almightineſſe mercie required pardon offence obteined ſame according requeſt giue grace may imitate hartie repentance ſorowe ſin notable faith zealous confeſſion good work beſeech thee mercifull lord mindfull v lord mindfull v thou ſitteſt kingdom thy father miſeries world thou mindfull v begin thy kingdome v heere world euerie combate conſcience eſpeciallie point death pronounce heart comfortable abſolution daie ſhalt thou paradiſe shew vnto v thy paradiſe departing life may find reſt ſoules open ſoules gate paradiſe place ſeates immortalitie ſtate bliſſe thy father togither bleſſed companie angel men ſheweth himſelfe euen meane thy combate yet finiſhed thou criedſt moſt pittifull maner god god haſt thou forſaken thy diuinitie ſeparated thy humanitie neuer loſt tooke neither ſurceſſedſt dooeſt thou ſurceſſe anie time equall one thine eternall father houre thy humiliation wherein woonderfull vnſpeakable maner thy diuinitie hid ſelfe would haue obedience ſhowne thought beſt deſtroie iewes thine enimies murtherers yea hid ſelfe ſtreames god diſpleaſure againſt ſinnes men ſhould ſo fall vpon thee chriſt ſhould wreſtle extreame torment ſuch certeine ſpace thou perceiuedſt comfort notwithſtanding thy diuinitie confirmed thine humane nature ſuffer paſſions thy diuinitie could ſuffer anie paſſion therefore confirmed ſame might ſufficient ſatiſfaction ſins men haue endured moſt greeuous torment could neuer abide theſe god comfort v may abide puniſhment men may ſaid though body greefe feele yet ſoules great ioie vertuous hope ſtrengthen ſo paine naught annoie intollerable creature ſuffer puniſhment god ſaued thereby wherefore sonne god diſpleaſure bee mindfull thy mercie thou protection wrath thine eternall father doo deſtroie v euen little taſte god diſpleſure burſteth peeces bone men like lion therfore thou vtteredſt like complaint ſaieng thirſt thy ſoule languiſhed greatneſſe thy paine thy ſpirits reſolued thy woonderfull greefe hart thy bowel dried awaie moiſture abode therefore trulie didſt thou inwardlie thirſt deſire ſome vertue comfort thy father outwardlie haue thy bodie refreſhed ieſu chriſt art fountaine eternall life giuing water quencheth thirſt whoſe bellie ſpringeth well life ſuffer v taſte ſuch greeuous thirſt merciles rich glutton hell neuer quenched godlie ſaie ſoule ſtucke vnto iawes quietnes bone lord thy iudgements correct thy furie leaſt come vnto nothing thou obſerueſt iniquity lord lord ſhall able abide thus doo thy saincts crie ſaie trouble wherefore kindle thy wrath altogither againſt v ceaſe comfort weake nature ſtriuing againſt thy iudgements iuice thy word comfortable watering thy ſpirit unto thee thine eternall father manifeſt preſence comfort ſakes ſome better quieted thou ſaiedſt finiſhed thou gaueſt thanks thine eternall father helping thee whereby ſacrifice welfare elect euermore fulfilled oh moſt ſacred prieſt imprint within v celeſtiall concluſion notable finiſhing thy ſacrifice vndoubtedlie may thinke ſacrifice remiſſion ſinnes life eternall purchaſed v afterward deliuered feares thou criedſt great voice father thy hand commend ſpirit grant departure world may vtter ſame word make v feele preſence thy father comforting v pleaſed thee may know body ſoules doo periſh let v ieſt epicure doo ſaieng fugitiue flattering pale curſt naked ſoule whither goeſt thou thou haſt prepared v sonne god large pleaſant place thy father houſe manie reſting place feare torment thou haſt deliuered v paine hell purgatorie thy father embraceth ſoules mercifull armes laieth abraham boſome repleniſheth quietneſſe light ioie vnſpeakable till body alſo raiſed againe appeare euerlaſting kingdome faith giue v grace leaue world reſt thee euer euer amen amen haue ſinned haue ſinned god god haue mercie vpon god forbid ſhould reioice croſſe chriſt whereby world crucified vnto world thus fruitfull meditation vpon paſsion sauiour ieſus chriſt read often lord ieſus chriſt sonne euerliuing almightie god whome thing made ruled gouerned thou liuelie image ſubſtance father eternall wiſedome god brightneſſe glorie god god light light coequall coeternall conſubſtantiall father thou loue thou haddeſt mankind hee fallen fellowſhip god ſocietie ſathan euill didſt vouchſafe redemption become mediatour betweene god man taking thy godhead nature concerning ſubſtance ſo becameſt man alſo heire moſt mercifull meſſias power thy godhead merit thy manhood haſt made purgation ſins euen thine owne ſelfe whileſt thou waſt heere earth ſet right hand thy father v euen concerning nature maieſtie glorie power infinite pray humblie beſeech thy mercie grant preſent reherſe ſome thy paſſions ſufferings laſt night thou waſt heere thy death thy good ſpirit might thereby effectuall worke faith well pardon ſinnes mortification mine affection comfort croſſes patience affliction amen middeſt thy laſt supper thy deere apoſtles theſe thing could thee namelie would leaue thee moſt earneſt would forſweare thee one twelue ſhould moſt traiterouſlie betraie thee ſmall croſſes vnto thee iudas admoniſhed thee beware tooke heed went finiſh worke contemning thine admonition counſell could vexe thy moſt louing hart ſupper contention amongſt thy diſciples ſhould greateſt thee yet dreaming carnallie thee thy kingdome hauing affection pride ambition buſie amongſt notwithſtanding thy diligence reproouing teaching thine admonition croſſe would come thereby make vigilant ſo groſſe thought could two ſwords put awaie peril little greefe vnto thee thy comming gethſamane heauineſſe oppreſſed thee therefore thou wouldeſt thy diſciples praie thou didſt tell peter fellowes thy hart heauie death thou didſt praie carefull alſo leaſt ſhould fall temptation thou wenteſt ſtones caſt didſt praie thy ſelfe falling flat groueling vpon earth ala thou felteſt comfort therefore thou cameſt thy diſciples moſt ſweet deere vnto thee lo thy diſcomfort paſſe neither thy peril owne therefore ſleepe apace thou hadſt awaked thou goeſt againe praie thou foundeſt comfort therefore didſt returne againe ſome comfort thy deereſt freends hand yet againe ala faſt aſleepe wherevpon thou art inforced go againe thy heauenlie father ſome ſparkle comfort theſe thy wonderfull croſſes agony heere thou waſt ſo diſcouraged ſo comfortleſſe euen ſtreames bloud came running thine eies eares part thy bodie able expreſſe infinitenes thy croſſes euen thy garden thou ſufferedſt ſake well ſatiſfie thy father wrath ſinnes alſo ſanctifie ſufferings gladlie ſuſteined thy bloudie praier thou cameſt yet againe foundeſt thy diſciples aſleepe thou canſt well awake lo iudas commeth great band weaponed men apprehend thee theefe ſo doth leading thee awaie bound high biſhops houſe anna ſo caiphas heere augment thy miſerie behold thy diſciples flie thee falſe witneſſes brought againſt thee thou art accuſed condemned blaſphemie peter euen thy ſight forſweareth thee thou art vniuſtlie ſtriken anſwering lawfullie thou art blindfeeld ſtriken buffeted whole night biſhop caiphas houſe cruell ſeruants morning betimes thou art condemned againe prieſts blaſphemie therefore bring thee ſecular power pilate whome thou art openlie arraigned theeues malefactor ſawe thou waſt accuſed malice wife ſent meſſenger vnto ſaieng haue thou nothing doo iuſt man haue ſuffered manie thing daie dreame reaſon yet diſmiſſe thee ſend thee herod thou waſt derided ſhamefullie comming going waie wonderfullie eſpeciallie herod apparelled thee foole afore pilate againe therefore thou waſt brought accuſed falſlie man take thy part ſpeake good word thee pilate cauſed thee whipped ſcourged handled moſt pitifullie ſee anie pitie might appeare prelate man pitied thee barrabas notable theefe murtherer preferred thee people head taile againſt thee cried crucifige hang thee vp uniuſtlie death waſt thou iudged thou waſt crowned ſharpe thornes pierced thy braines thou waſt made mocking ſtocke thou waſt reuiled beaten ſcourged ſpit vpon moſt miſerablie handled thou wenteſt ieruſalem place execution euen mount caluerie great croſſe hang thee vp laid vpon thy backe beare drawe long thou waſt able thy bodie racked nailed tree thy hand bored thy foot alſo nailes put faſten thee thereon thou waſt hanged betweene heauen earth one ſpued heauen vomited earth vnworthie anie place high prieſts laughed thee ſcorne elder blaſphemed thee ſaid god care thee common people alſo laughed cried vpon thee thirſt oppreſſed thee vineger onlie gall giuen thee drinke heauen ſhined thee sunne gaue thee light earth afraid beare thee ſathan euen tempted thee thine owne humane ſenſes cauſed thee crie god god haſt thou forſaken oh wonderfull paſſions thou ſweet ieſus ſufferedſt mankind thou teacheſt thou comforteſt god father ſinnes forgiuen ſhould learne feare god loue god hope god hate ſinne patient call vpon god neuer leaue anie temptation thee crie father thy hand commend ſpirit amen praier wherein confeſſe ſelues verie cauſe theſe christ paſsions haſt thou committed oh lord thou ſhouldeſt bee ſo iudged haſt thou offended thou ſhouldeſt ſo cruellie handled ordered thy fault thine offence cauſe thy death occaſion thy condemnation lord cauſe thy ſorowe fault thou waſt killed haue deſerued thy death committed offence aduenged vpon thee oh maruellous kind iudgement vnſpeakable diſpoſition ordering myſteries vniuſt man offendeth righteous puniſhed guiltie doth euill innocent beaten euill doth treſpaſſe good condemned euill man deſerueth ſame doth good iuſt ſuffer ſeruant doth amiſſe maiſter maketh amends man treſpaſſeth god ſuffereth oh thou art sonne god lowe thine humilitie deſcend greatlie thy charitie euen waxe hot burne towards v far thy pitie exceed whither thy benignitie gentlenes growe extend far thy loue ſtretch far came thy compaſſion wrongfullie thou waſt puniſhed committed miſcheeuous deed aduenged vpon thee fault thou ſubmittedſt thy ſelfe torment proud thou waſt humble meeke ſwelled puffed vp thou waſt extenuate appaired diſobedient neuertheleſſe thou obedient bareſt paine puniſhments diſobedience obeied ſeruant exceſſe gluttonie thou waſt puniſhed ſcarſitie lacke food tree drawe grandmother eue vnto vnlawfull concupiſcence deſires perfect charitie led thee vnto puniſhment endure torment vpon croſſe preſumed forbidden thou didſt ſmart therefore tooke pleaſure delicateneſſe thou waſt vexed croſſe abound haue plentie pleaſures thou art torne nailes doo taſte pleaſant ſweetnes apple thou bitternes gall behold king glorie mine iniquitie vngodlineſſe thy pitie goodnes manifeſt behold mine vnrighteouſnes thy iuſtice plainelie declared thing god king ſhall render vnto thee theſe thing thou haſt beſtowed vpon nothing found hart man may worthilie recompenſe ſuch reward man wit excogitate imagine anie thing woorthie compared vnto thy diuine mercie neither office creature go recompenſe fullie iuſtlie aid helpe creator trulie sonne god thy maruellous diſpenſation appointment ſome fraileneſſe may helpe little ſo mind pricked ſtirred thy viſitation doo puniſh fleſh vice alſo euill concupiſcences thereof thing thou wilt grant giue grace doo ſhall begin ſuffer ſuſteine ſorrowes greefes becauſe thou alſo didſt vouchſafe die ſinnes ſo victorie inward man ſhall armed thou beeing captaine externall outward victorie foraſmuch ſpirituall perſecution ouercome ſhall afraid thy ſake obedient vnto materiall ſword croſſe world ſo ſlenderneſſe ſtate condition pleaſe thy goodnes ſhall able according little power thereof anſwer vnto greatnes excellencie creator ye heauenlie medicine good ieſu preſeruatiue thy loue beſeech thee thine accuſtomed ancient mercy powre wound fowle filthie matter venemous contagion infection caſt awaie may refreſh reſtore former puritie cleaneneſſe haue taſted pleaſant ſweetnes abide thee may make deſpiſe vtterlie ſet naught entiſements world feare thy ſake none aduerſities thereof remembring thine euerlaſting nobilitie excellencie may alwaies abhor diſdaine trouble tranſitorie world thou lord waſt crucified ſo beſeech thee crucifie thee may riſe againe thee euerlaſting life thy fleſh crucified crucifie thee chriſt kingdome fleſh hath dominion may put old adam newneſſe life may tranſformed thee ſecond adam ſinne infidelitie whole tyrannie ſathan vanquiſhed ouercome bring paſſe lord thy croſſe painefull ſuffering thy yoke may made light thy burthen eaſie willinglie gladlie following thee may come whether thou art gone thy father moſt bleſſed immortall whome nothing ſhall afterwards able ſeparate v amen haue ſinned haue ſinned god god haue mercie vpon god forbid ſhould reioice anie thing croſſe lord ieſus chriſt whereby world crucified vnto vnto world galath 6 another praier chriſt crucified wherein deuoutlie call mind great thing hath done v benefit reape remembrance holie wound exceeding greatlie haue ſinned againſt thy maieſtie lord mine owne conſcience findeth mee guiltie manie offence yet doo deſpaire neither anie thing doubtfull becauſe whereas ſinne hath abounded hath thy grace god ouerabounded deſpaireth forgiuenes ſinnes denieth thee god mercifull yea great wrong doth thee god diſtruſteth thy mercie much lieth denieth thee louing true mightie thing wherein whole hope conſiſteth weet loue thy adoption truth thy promiſe power thy redeeming let vnwiſe imagination murmur much liſteth ſaie art thou great thy glorie deſerts hopeſt thou obtaine anſwer boldlie knowe whome haue credited thou thine exceeding great loue haſt adopted thy child thou art ſouthfaſt promiſe thou art mightie perſeuerance thou maiſt doo thee liſteth bee feared multitude ſinnes bethinke death thee lord becauſe ſinnes able ouercome thee thy nailes thy ſpeare crie vnto throughlie reconciled thee chriſt loue thee longius hath opened thy ſide deere ieſu ſpeare gone doo reſt ſafetie afraid let loue loue driueth feare dores remedie ſo mightie effectuall againſt heate leacherie death thee redeemer thou ſtretcheſt thine armes vpon croſſe thou holdeſt thy hand readines imbrace v ſinners betweene armes thee ſauiour mind liue die ſhall ſing ſafelie glorifie exalt thee lord becauſe thou haſt taken vp haſt giuen mine enimies pleaſure ouer thou sauiour haſt bowed downe thy head thy death receiue kiſſes thy beloued ſo often doo kiſſe thee lord throughlie touched loue thee loue mankind god cameſt man cameſt man becameſt man loue inuiſible god becaineſt like thy ſeruants verie loue waſt wounded ſinnes thoſe wound thine sauiour ſafe quiet reſt v weakelings ſinners doo dwell eaſe thy wound haue waie vnto bowel thy mercie whatſoeuer wanting ſelfe doo borowe bowel thee lord aboundance mercie want hole flowe hole thy bleſſed bodie opened vnto ſecrets thy hart great pledge thy kindlie loue euen bowel mercie thee god whereby daie ſpring hath viſited v aloft thy wound ſweet ieſu chriſt full mercie full pitie full ſweetneſſe full loue bored thy hand thy foot pierced thy ſide ſpeare theſe hole may taſte ſweet mild thou art deed mercifull thou art call vpon thee truth ſeeke thee cheeflie loue thee plentious redemption giuen vnto v thy wound ſweet sauiour ieſu chriſt great aboundance ſweetnes great plentie grace great perfection vertues giuen v thy pretious wound ſweet sauiour ieſu chriſt moſt bountifull ieſu grant therefore humblie beſeech thee whenſoeuer anie fowle thought aſſaulteth may forthwith runne thy wound chriſt fleſh preſſeth downe may riſe vp remembring thy wound lord diuell laieth wait may flee bowel thy mercie ieſu ſo ſhall quicklie depart anie time heate lecherie prouoke member let quenched praie thee calling mind thy wound sonne god finallie mine aduerſities let find remedie ſo effectuall thy wound chriſt ſaie let ſleepe without care reſt without feare thou chriſt haſt died v nothing ſo bitter death ſwallowed vp thy death ſweet ieſu whole hope therfore ſhall thy death lord god thy death deſart refuge welfare life reſurrection thy mercifulneſſe lord merit poore merit ſo long thou lord compaſſions faileſt long thou art manifold mercie ſo long alſo manifold deſerts mightier thou art ſaue without care wherefore moſt excellent goodnes withdrawe thy mercie moſt mightie maker deſpiſe thy worke moſt prudent redeemer ſuffer periſh price thy redemption moſt gentle ghoſtlie heauenlie hoaſt gheſt purifie ſaue dreſſe keepe thy houſe dwelling place thou dedicatedſt ſanctifiedſt thee ſacrament baptiſme moſt bleſſed moſt charitable ſweet ieſu moſt bounteous excellent glorious ieſu moſt innocent mercifull meeke louing deere ieſu haue mercie vpon haue mercie vpon forgiue ſinnes ſhall loue thee ſhall ſorie ſinnes ſhall loath forſake ſinnes ſhall deteſt abhore ſinfull life turne vnto thee grace ſhall remember thy benefit thy meekenes thy pouertie bitter paſſion thy patience thy obedience thy loue thy charitie ſhall ſanctifie worſhip magnifie loue hartilie thee heauen thy saint earth celebrate thy feaſts accordinglie ſaie thy incarnation paſſion reſurrection aſcenſion ſuch due reuerence chriſtian deuotion thou moſt dredfull maiſter dread lord ieſu thou moſt loued father loue thou bee lord redeemer ſeruice thou mine hoaſt dwell ſoule thy grace mercie chaſtitie puritie cleanneſſe meet according ſuch hoaſt thou life saint faireneſſe beautie angel thanking therfore good lord jeſu chriſt wound hart thy moſt holie wound moiſt mind thy moſt pretious bloud whither ſoeuer turne may behold aboue thee crucified whatſoeuer ſee may appeare ruddie thy moſt pretious bloud thus holding may fixe ſight nothing onlie thee liueſt reigneſt one god world without end haue ſinned haue offended god god haue merceie praier wherein commemoration chriſtes paſsion deſire pardon ſinnes continuance vertue godlineſſe behold pitifull father thy moſt pitifull sonne ſuffered ſo wicked behold moſt mercifull king ſuffered remember thou art louing kind ſuffered lord innocent whō although thy sonne thou didſt deliuer redeeme ranſome ſeruant author beginner life led ſheepe killed made obedient thee euen vnto death afraid take vpon moſt cruell ſharp kind death▪ call remembrance thou diſtributer health whome although thou didſt beget thy power yet notwithſtanding thou wouldeſt haue made partaker thine infirmitie weakenes trulie ſame thy god head take vpon thy nature hanged vpon gibbet torment croſſe fleſh taken vpon ſuffer ſorrowfull puniſhment turne eies thy maieſtie lord god towards worke thine vnſpeakable pitie looke thy deere sonne whoſe whole body ſtretched foorth marke harmeleſſe hand pure doo drop diſtill downe innocent bloud beſeech thee pacified pardon wicked deed hand haue committed conſider bare naked ſide thruſt cruellie ſpeare renew waſh holie fountaine well beleeue flowe thence marke vnſpotted foot haue ſtood waie ſinners alwaies haue walked thy lawe pierced ſharpe nail make perfect ſteps thy path make thy louing kindneſſe hate way iniquitie remoue way iniquitie make thy mercie chooſe waie truth beſeech thee king holie men holie one holie one redeemer make runne waie thy commandements may vnited knit vnto ſpirit diſdaine clad fleſh doeſt thou looke vpon marke pittifull father head thy moſt deerelie beloued sonne yong man leaned vpon ſhoulders paſt moſt pretious death behold moſt gentle creator humanitie gentlenes thy beloued sonne haue compaſſion vpon feeblenes thy weake feeble handieworke behold moſt glorious parent torne rent member thy moſt kind louing child remember gentlie ſubſtance behold paine god man releaſe looſe man thy creature miſerie bondage ſinne behold puniſhment redeeme pardon offence redeemed lord whome thou didſt ſtrike ſinnes people although thy welbeloued whome found guile yet neuertheleſſe reckoned amongſt full iniquitie looke downe therefore lord thou louer labouring laden hart eies thy pittie ſee altar croſſe thy ſonne thine onlie beloued babe ſlaughtered behold father heauen thy bleeding babe ſakes thou hadſt made vnder lawe curſe therof giuing death euen acurſed ſhamefull death croſſe might thereby redeeme v wretch enimies lawe curſe condemnation looke vpon ſaie ſauiour world ſufferings life death hath fulfilled propheſies behold made caſtawaie iewes ſcorne gentile endured treaſonable hate friend deadlie terror troubled ſoule might haue peace conſcience reconciled vnto thee let ſhame ignominie praie thee honour triumph wound medicine curſe bliſſe death life finallie ſo lighten mind beſeech thee thy holie ſpirit may able conceiue vnderſtand height depth length breadth meanes infinite meaſure ſo exceeding loue towards v ſight knowledge ſo great loue may ſo inflame v loue thee againe thought deed may wholie ſet vpon thee ſhewing thankfulneſſe vnto thee obedience vnto thy word glorieng nothing thy chriſt crucified end may inioie full fruit paſſions thine vnſpeakable loue towards v euerlaſting ſaluation ieſus chriſt onelie lord redeemer thee father holie ghoſt giuen praiſe honour glorie euer euer amen another godlie meditation praier wherin declare vnto god father paſsion sonne rehearſed reconciliation attonement god behold almightie god father lord ieſus chriſt beſeech thee thy benignitie gentleneſſe haue mercie vpon becauſe moſt pretious thing could find ſame haue offered deuoutlie vnto thee thing moſt eſtimation could imagine haue preſented humblie vnto thee haue left nothing haue declared vnto thy maieſtie nothing remaining may adde becauſe haue committed betaken whole hope vnto thee haue ſent vnto thee mine aduocate ſpokesman euen thy welbeloued sonne ieſus haue ſent thy glorious child mediator betwixt thee haue ſent ſaie interceſſor whome truſt get pardon forgiuenes ſinnes word haue ſent word word haue ſaid ſent miſdeeds behold haue rehearſed vnto thee paſſion thy moſt holie sonne ieſus chriſt paſſion beleeue ſuffered beleeue godhead ſent thee take vpon mine humanitie nature thought ſcorne ſuffer buffet bond ſpittings mock yea tooke vpon ſuffer croſſe nailes dart beleeue alſo manhood nature infancie troubled creeping ſcrallings wrapt cloathes manner child vexed youth labour made leane waking faſtings wearied iournieng afterward whipped torne rent diuers kind puniſhments reckoned among dead endued glorie reſurrection carried ioies heauen placed vpon right hand thy maieſtie ſaie manhood waie meanes pacifieng appeaſing thee waie meanes hauing mercie vpon mee mercifullie looke vpon mee heare wretch redeeme bondſeruant deliuered behold creator doo deſpiſe creature receiue ſhepheard welcommed gentle louing countenance mercifullie looke vpon ſheepe hath brought home vpon owne ſhoulders moſt faithfull ſhepheard manie diuers labour trauels ouer ſteepe hils headlong deepe vallies ſearch owne ſheepe ſtraied awaie alſo found faint almoſt dead long wandring gat himſelfe vnder great reioicing making faſt vnto maruellous bond charitie lifted vp deapth confuſion brought home ninetie nine behold king king god almightie behold good ſhepheard rendereth thee thou committedſt charge tooke vpon thine ordinance ſaue man hath deliuered vnto thee cleane pure ſpots waſhing bloud lo thy moſt dearelie beloued sonne hath reconciled vnto thee thy handie worke gone aſtraie far waie lo gentle ſhepheard bringeth home againe thy flocke hir violent pirate robber driuen awaie hath brought vnto thy ſight ſeruant whome hir owne conſcience made run awaie ſhe hir ſelfe deſerued puniſhment thy sonne hir ſolicitor hath deſerued forgiuenes vnto whome alſo hir offence euerlaſting fire due neuertheleſſe ſubiect vnder ſuch prince captaine ſhe doth hope brought home hir owne countrie able holie father ſelfe offend thee able ſelfe pacifie appeaſe thee thy welbeloued sonne god made helper taking vpon mine humanitie intent might cure mine infirmitie wherof firſt occaſion thy wrath ſpring ſame might offer vp thee ſacrifice praiſe might render make alſo wellpleaſing thy goodnes thing ſitting thy right hand alwaies ſhew declare himſelfe equall ſubſtance fellowe ſame lo hope behold whome truſt thou deſpiſe meete mine iniquity yet looke vpon leaſtwiſe mercifulle charitie thy welbeloued sonne giue heed thy sonne whereby thou maieſt haue mercie vpon thy bondſeruant looke vpon ſacrament fleſh pardon offence fleſh often ſoeuer thou doeſt remember wound thy bleſſed son ſo oft beſéech thee let mine iniquitie hid bicauſe fleſh hath ſtirred thee wrath let fleſh beſeech thee mooue thee mercie like fleſh hath ſeduced led ſinne ſo fleſh may get obteine remiſſion certainly much mine iniquitie hath deſerued much goodnes redeemer may euen right require mine vnrighteouſnes great righteouſnes bigger looke much god ſuperiour vnto man euen ſo much malice euill inferiour vnto goodnes qualitie quantitie haue ſinned man sonne god made man hath redeemed pride could ſo exceeding high ſuch humilitie ſhould bring downe power death ſo great puniſhment sonne god ſuffered vpon croſſe might deface vtterlie deſtroie trulie god ſinnes ſinfull men woman ſhould weied iuſt equall balance loue fauour redeemer towards v eaſt ſo far diſtant weſt innermoſt part earth ſo much ſeparated vppermoſt part heauen ſhould vnlike ſo much leſſe ſhould mine iniquitie goodneſſe moſt noble creator light pardon mine offence vnmeaſurable trauels paine thy beloued sonne ſuſteine beſeech thee let goodneſſe ſet againſt wickednes modeſtie temperance againſt mine vngratious frowardnes meekenes againſt fierce crueltie let humilitie recompenſe pride patience mine impatience gentleneſſe mine vnkind churliſhnes obedience diſobedience quietneſſe mine vnquietnes pleaſant towardnes bitter frowardnes ſweet facilitie gentlenes mine angrie fretting fume conclude let charitie make amends heinous deteſtable crueltie amen haue ſinned haue ſinned god god haue mercie god forbid ſhould reioice anie thing croſſe chriſt whereby world crucified vnto vnto world 9 eaſter daie christ reſurrection paſſouer chriſtians preface chriſt riſen againe dead dieth halleluiah death hencefoorth hath power halleluiah chriſt riſen againe firſt fruit ſleepe halleluiah chriſt men dead ſinne reſtored life halleluiah thy reſurrection chriſt heauen earth doo reioice ſaie halleluiah thanks vnto god giueth v victorie thorough lord ieſus chriſt halleluiah hauing ſpoiled principality power hath made ſhew openlie triumphing ouer owne perſon halleluiah awake chriſt awake vp glorie ſing halleluiah chriſt paſſouer offered vp daie reuiued roſe iuſtification halleluiah let v reioice therfore ſaie ſoule keepe holidaie lord halleluiah old leauen maliciouſnes wickednes vnleauened bread pureneſſe truth halleluiah awake vp likenes may ſatiſfied preſence righteouſnes glorie halleluiah bleſſed holie thoſe haue part firſt reſurrection ſecond death hath power ſing halleluiah death thy ſting hell thy victorie halleluiah daie lord hath made reioice glad therein euermore ſing halleluiah halleluiah praier thy woonderfull victorie reſurrection death glorious kingdome sonne god ſaid daie roote ieſſe ſhall ſtand ſigne people vnto ſhall nation flie reſt ſhall glorie thou art bleſſed branch dauid thou tookeſt man nature vpon thee cameſt line dauid time thy humiliation thou waſt ſprig drie ground notable heauenlie plant oppreſſed miſeries thy ſoule dried awaie beaten mightie tempeſt god diſpleaſure againſt ſinnes notwithſtanding goodlie roote power thy diuine nature vtterlie choaked thou art deliuered midſt death thy diuine power thou ſtandeſt victoriouſlie ouer thine enimies art readie bring v thy ſouldiers euils make v partaker thy moſt glorious conqueſt thy kingdome altogither otherwiſe triumph glorie world death endeth pride power pompe world thy death reſt glorious thy kingdome glorie beginneth life ended chriſt sonne god woonderfull thy reſt man firſt made noble holie temple wherein perpetuall sabboth ſhould celebrated diuine nature ſhould abide filling comforting plentie heauenlie rich reſt turned vnquietnes ioie ſorowe hatred ſathan thine enimie prophaned temple ſabboth brought horrible miſorder wickednes wherefore pleaſed thine almightie father goodnes ſend thee onlie sonne owne boſome reſtore againe sabboth hence woonderfull manner daie great sabboth according lawe moſes thine humane nature death ſeparated ſoule bodie reſted ſepulchre word forſooke nature graue reuiued fleſh third daie ſo thou roſeſt againe time redemption expired victoriouſlie vnto thy kingdome giueſt eternall sabboth reſt ſuch flie vnto thee sonne god call thou ſinners euen v miſerable vncleane perſons vnto ſacred feaſt world thee cheefe prieſt begun ſhall made perfect elect euermore ſhall followe lambe whitherſoeuer go put v feſtiuall garment garment thy righteouſnes benediction putting awaie leauen malice wickednes may celebrate feaſt ſweet bread ſinceritie ſerue thee purenes liuing truth yeare thine incarnation 1582 paſſed 3091 yeares ſince firſt paſſouer iſraelites celebrate going egypt ſo long haſt thou preſerued thy church beſeech thee preſerue euerlaſtinglie notwithſtanding rage diuell miniſters thou defendedſt thy people eate lambe moreouer going egypt ſlaiedſt thy righteous iudgements firſt borne land ſo aſſiſt v liuelie faith may feed thee true lamb keepe v among miſeries laſt age world carcaſes remaining caſt awaie condemned thy oblation gratefull ſight god appeaſeth wrath eternall father eating thee art lamb god taking awaie ſinnes world righteouſnes life giuen beleeuers word raiſeth againe quickneth fleſh vnto v ingraffed therevnto faith like life may giuen bodie ſinne mortified v thou liue reigne v euermore wherefore let thy glorious reſt v made earth ſinne body appointed earth yea vngodlie ſhall abide euer earth neuer appeare thy glorious heauen thou touchedſt death thy liuelie fleſh thou madeſt light thou tookeſt awaie heauineſſe thereof blaſt firſt ſerpent manie time euen man fleſh turned verie ſerpents graue wicked horrible filth ſpirituall dragon ſerpents deuour euerlaſtinglie keepe perpetuall death thou sonne god makeſt graues thy ſaincts euen pleaſant chamber thou driueſt far awaie thence filthineſſe ſathan thou ſetteſt watchman euen thy pure angel bring ſoules paradiſe commending hand boſome thy father keepe alſo aſhes ſhall thy returne houſe holie ghoſt beautifie v like manner thy glorie true knowledge calling vpon thee preſent v point death receiue ſoules departure thine hand ſhew thou thy comfort ioie till reſurrection mankind thou crowne thine elect perfect endleſſe glorie taſte wherof might ſeene thoſe fortie day thy reſurrection neuer ſo goodlie world thou roſeſt death broughteſt graues great companie thy saincts scripture plainelie breeflie vngodlie doth teſtifie familiarlie holie father matrones remaine thy ſweet mother apoſtles pleaſant ſpeeches much talke made doubt miſeries man vnſpeakable benefit gotten thee glorie eternall life lord raiſe thou vp hart true deſire may long come faire companie let v turne ſelues cogitation vnto holie aſſemblie let v hearken vnto learne thy wiſedome reuealed thy word life thy church darkeneſſe miſeries men occupied obſeruation outward ceremony thoſe godlie woman annoint thy bodie manie time thy church ſeemeth depriued thy ſweet preſence vttereth theſe ſorrowfull word haue taken awaie lord tell haue laid sonne god amend mortall darkeneſſe within v kindle ſoule thine inward ſeruice pleaſeth thee manifeſt thy ſelfe vnto v affliction ſpeake theſe comfortable word calamitie vnto v weepe euen death may thinke ſelues thou art preſent death riſe againe fruition eternall life thy bleſſed saincts amen another almightie god moſt mercifull heauenlie father haſt raiſed vp thy sonne iuſtification thou gaueſt death ſinnes grant thy holie ſpirit may worke faith v whereby may made partaker righteouſnes hee hath thoſe truſt becauſe without bleſſed hope riſing againe dead faith vaine yet ſinnes therefore beſeech thee confirme ſtrengthen v thou haſt alreadie raiſed vp chriſt head ſo may aſſured thou wilt alſo raiſe v vp bodie may ioined head furthermore thou haſt left holie ſtorie thy sonne might beleeue faith obtaine euerlaſting life ſo beſeech thee worke fruit v conſtant faith ſaluation ſoules thy euerlaſting glorie whome sonne holie ghoſt honor praiſe glorie euer amen another almightie god moſt mercifull heauenlie father according beene written ye lawe moſes prophet behooued sauiour world ſuffer death riſe againe dead third daie repentance forgiuenes ſinnes ſhould bee preached amongſt nation name ſo point point haſt fullie accompliſhed theſe thing chriſt ieſus thine onlie sonne whome thou didſt raiſe graue daie onlie liue againe world euen ſit thy right hand prouiding infirmitie haſt giuen v great manie witneſſes holie men woman vpon earth angel heauen confirme truth matter vnto v might haue ſtrong aſſurance ſaluation faith open mind vnderſtand holie scripture grant v ſtedfaſtlie beleeue thy goſpell faith made one may receiue forgiuenes ſinnes eſtimation righteous men thy ſight furthermore alſo grant mightie conqueſt whereby hath triumphed ouer laſt enimie death raiſing himſelfe againe vnto life may riſe death ſinnes life grace leading new conuerſation ſit thy right hand hope hauing life hid ſhall appeare come iudgment life alſo heere led obedience faith may made manifeſt receiue faith poſſeſſe bleſſed hope looke wait comming ſaluation ſoules glorie thy name whome sonne holie ghoſt praiſe honour euer amen thanksgiuing lift vp hart vnto thee lord verie meet right bounden dutie ſhould time place giue thanks vnto thee lord holie father almightie euerlaſting god chieflie bound praiſe thee glorious reſurrection thy ſonne ieſus chriſt lord verie paſchall lambe offered v hath taken awaie ſinnes world death hath deſtroied death riſing life againe hath reſtored v euerlaſting life therefore angel archangel companie heauen laud magnifie thy glorious name euermore praiſing thee ſaieng holie holie holie lord god hoaſts heauen earth full thy glorie glorie thee lord moſt high 10 aſcenſion daie christ glorious aſcending heauens ſight apoſtles preface god gone vp merrie noiſe lord ſound trumpet glorie god high halleluiah humbled himſelfe vnto death wherefore god alſo hath highlie exalted ſet right hand heauenlie place far aboue power dominion halleluiah god gone vp high hathled captiuitie captiue receiued gift men halleluiah deſcended firſt lowe part earth euen ſame alſo aſcended vp far aboue heauens fulfill thing halleluiah god gone vp merrie noiſe lord aſcended great triumph halleluiah lift vp head ye gate ye lift vp ye euerlaſting dores king glorie may enter halleluiah yea thou exalted lord thine owne ſtrength ſo praiſe thy power perpetuallie euermore ſing glorie god high halleluiah praier thou chriſt ſonne god fortie day thy reſurrection continuedſt world vnſpeakable comfort thy church expired thou aſcendedſt gloriouſlie ſight thy saint heauens yeeld thee moſt hartie thanks thy benefit beſeeching thee moſt humblie number v among ſaints ſouldiers wait vpon thee triumphieng handwriting dependeth teſtimonie giltie conſcience condemnation thy death ſentence condemnation aboliſhed thy bloud waſheth v ſins enimies thine elect euen diuell death lead bound whole companie ſaints heauen earth filled ioie ſpeake thy victorie benefit thy saint heauen viſiblie doo behold thy glorious victorie thy saint earth ſaued faith ornament glorie king daughter glorious within ſight manie godlie auditor thine thy holie mother bleſſed virgin marie thou waſt carried viſiblie earth cloud heauen thou gaueſt taſte eternall life thine apoſtles wondering thy departure preachedſt thy returne iudgement thou haſt glorified thine humane nature vnſpeakable glorie placed ſame right hand thy father vpon throne triumph victorie hauing ſakes vanquiſhed enimies thine humane nature onelie aboue thy saint exalted alſo ſuch light cannot attained anie creature thou reigneſt viſible father repleniſhing whole celeſtiall congregation righteouſnes diuine glorie gouerne thou alſo mortall life outwardlie thy miniſterie inwardlie mind thou haſt aſcended high lead captiuitie captiue beſtowe thy benefit vpon man thy departure thou renewedſt inſtitution thy miniſterie thou gaueſt thy diſciples commandement preach nation thy goodneſſe giue thee moſt hartie thanks therby thou haſt called v ſocietie thy saint aſſiſt v thy ſpirit may beleeue goſpell keepe euermore couenant baptiſme haue made thee thou adornedſt thine apoſtles carrie new doctrine ouer face whole earth ſingular teſtimonies miracle church might aſſuredlie knowe erred continue among v like ſort thy miniſterie togither puritie thy word send among v euangeliſts paſtors teacher may ioine themſelues doctrine apoſtles diligentlie ſpread ſame abroad ſpeake thou art head miniſterie within hart raiſe vp godlie motion thy ſpirit thou art aſcended high bee head thy church filling thing finiſh thy worke v ingraffe v thy glorified bodie powre vpon v thy diuine nature like ſpirit may intermingle ſelfe ſoule begin liue v eternall life may create v new man faſhioned accordinglie thy ſimilitude likeneſſe inſpire v ſuch perfection righteouſneſſe thou ſhalt thinke meete conuenient weake fraile nature let holie motion agreeing thine heauenlie planted v driue awaie darkeneſſe mind extinguiſh wicked affection hart let new man dailie proſper increaſe perfection defend thy church thy mightie right hand againſt power man diuels fill flitting ſoules taſt new life receiue thine hand grant reſurrection glorification thy church maie ioifullie behold thee returning triumphing gloriouſlie ſo placed kingdome thou wilt deliuer thy father euerlaſting happineſſe amen halleluiah glorie god high anotherverie deuout meditation praier wherein mind verie much mooued plentiouſlie ſtirred contemplation heauenlie thing ſaid quietneſſe moſt mightie king verie good gentle louing lord ieſu chriſt thine ineſtimable charitie vnſpeakable pitie taking vpon thee ſeed abraham angel didſt vouchſafe onlie willinglie ſuffer ſinnes bond croſſe wound yea death ſepulchre three day death ouercome didſt riſe againe iuſtification waſt ſeene thy diſciples reforming hart eſtabliſhing almoſt declining thee alſo thou hadſt glorified mortall nature ſtole holie reſurrection immortalitie fortith daie thou ſight thy diſciples didſt triumph thy glorie gloriouſlie aſcend heauen cariedſt aboue heauens aboue melodious companie angel aboue cherubin seraphin placing vpon right hand god thy father angel doo praiſe ſame humane nature power heauen doo euen tremble ſee man god ouer thou lord ſitteſt liueſt euerlaſtinglie reigneſt throughout world behold thy ſeelie creature weight frailenes drawne euer downeward ſo able liue holilie vertuouſlie ought liue without thy continuall helpe whervnto thinke neceſſarie ſticke cleaue moſt humblie beſeech thee drawe vpward toward thee may runne thee ſweet ſauour thine ointment let runne faint thou draweſt leadeſt running drawe mouth ſoule thirſteth thee vnto high flouds ſtreames thine eternall aboundance ſatietie yea drawe wholie vnto thy ſelfe art liuing well intent may according capacitie drinke whervpon doo liue god life thou didſt ſaie thy holie bleſſed mouth anie man thirſt let come vnto drinke well life grant vnto thirſtie ſoule alwaie drinke thee according thy holie true promiſe water life may flowe bellie well life repleniſh fill mind full riuer thy pleaſure make hart droonken thy loue manner droonken wine forget thing ſaue cup ſo may forget vaine earthlie thing continuallie haue nothing elſe remembrance thee onelie according written remembred god delighted giue holie ghoſt thoſe water ſignifie thou didſt promiſe giue thirſted thee grant beſeech thee may aſſaie go whole deſire ſtudie toward place vnto beleeue thou didſt aſcend fortith daie thy reſurrection preſent miſerie may onlie bodie thought deſire alwaies thee hart may whereas thou art art treaſure worthie coueted much loued wherewith treaſure woorthie compared bring paſſe lord chriſt thy gift may ſtirred carried vpward feruentlie deſire aſcend yea make certaine aſcenſions hart lifting vpward ſing ſong ſtarres lampe thy loue ſaie kindled moued go thee thither whereas thou portion reigneſt beleeue reigne thither whereas thou fleſh art glorified beleeue glorified thither thou bloud ruleſt perceiue beare rule euen vnto peace ieruſalem ieruſalem ſaie countrie ieruſalem mother would go vpward remember ieruſalem extend ſtretch foorth towards ſenſes hart towards thee chriſt art king ouer hir hir light hir father hir defender hir patrone hir gouernour hir keeper hir chaſt ſtrong delight hir onlie whole pleaſure whome hir goodnes felicitie commeth becauſe thou art cheefe good true good neuer turne backe vntill thou bring home pilgrimage deformedlie ſcattered abroad vnto place deerelie beloued mother whereas firſt fruit ſpirit vntill thou god art mercie faſhion confirme euer whither go vpward peace ieruſalem bicauſe glad reioiced thoſe thing ſpoken vnto therfore wil go houſe lord hath placed v wil giue v good thing therfore deſire nothing elſe tarie remaine lord euer oh lord foraſmuch whileſt clad bodie doo go aſtraie ſtrangers vnto thee haue abiding place euer ſeeke one come abiding place heauen whither thou art aſcended therefore thy fauour grace guide enter chamber hart ſing vnto thee ſongs loue king god mourning maruellous ſighings place peregrination whereas thy iuſtices ſongs whereas toſſed ſtormes euerie ſide great floud life ſtedfaſt ſtanding place high inough aboue water foot doue reſt vpon life ſaie ſafe quiet peace anie ſure reſt eueriewhere battell ſtrife eueriewhere enimies fighting without doores fright feares within doores aſmuch one part v heauenlie earthlie bodie corrupt doth loden burdenous vnto ſoule therefore mind felowe freend wearie wandering foorth waie ſicke lieth torne rent thoſe thing hath paſſed hungreth thirſteth greatlie vanity haue nothing ſet afore bicauſe poore begger thou lord god art rich good thing moſt plentious giuer deinties heauenlie ſatietie giue meate vnto wearie ſuch thirſteth ſuch conuenient gather togither diſperſed renew refreſh torne lo ſtandeth doore knocketh beſeech thee bowel thy mercie wherwith thou daieſpring high haſt viſited v open hand thy pitie wretch knocketh vouchſafe mercifullie enter thee may reſt thee refreſhed thee art liuing heauenlie bread wherewith fed ſtrength come mee againe may aſcend vnto high thing lifted vp vale miſerie teares wing godlie deſires may flie vp vnto thee heauenlie kingdome let ſpirit lord beſeech thee take wing egle flie without fainting let flie vp come beautifulneſſe thine holie houſe place heauen thy glorie dwelleth whereas vpon meatetables thy ſupernall citizen may fed full thy ſecrets place thy paſture moſt plentifull riuers ſides let mine hart reſt thee god hart ſaie though great ſea ſwelling water thou diddeſt rebuke wind ſea made ſtreightwaies great calme come wake vpon fluds mine hart thing belong vnto may made calme cleere may imbrace thee art mine onelie god may behold thee art ſweet light nf mine eies without anie blind darkneſſe troubleſome cogitation thought let mind flie lord vnder ſhadowe thy wing meate couered temperateneſſe thy pleaſant coolneſſe may ſing ioifullie ſaie laie downe reſt peace finallie let memorie ſleepe god beſeech thee euils make hate iniquitie loue righteouſneſſe better delectable middes darkneſſe life among manifold bitter miſeries ſame deſire feruentlie heauenlie ſweetneſſe couet euerlaſting bleſſedneſſe mind held euer whereas may moſt ſure haue infallible true ioies oh lord thy louing kindneſſe art moſt woorthie deſired coueted thing ſhall ſee thee ſhall appeere thy face ſhall ſatiſfied thy glorie wilt thou bring foorth darke priſon may confeſſe thy name ſo afterward bee pricked ſhall paſſe go maruellous beautifull houſe thine whereas voice gladneſſe reioicing doth ſound tabernacle iuſt men bleſſed dwell thine houſe lord ſhall praiſe thee euer world without end bleſſed yea bleſſed indeed thou haſt choſen taken heauenlie inheritance behold lord thy saint flouriſh thee like vnto lillie repleniſhed plentiouſneſſe thine houſe thou dooeſt giue drinke flowing riuer thy pleaſure bicauſe thou art well life thy light brightnes doo ſee light ſo greatlie themſelues light made bright thee lord dooſt giue light doo ſhine like vnto ſunne thy ſight maruellous faire beautifull acceptable manſions dwelling place thine houſe lord power ſinfull ſoule dooth couet enter lord haue loued comlineſſe thine houſe place thine honour dwelleth aſked one petition lord ſame require may dwell houſe lord day life like hart coueteth go vnto water brooke euen ſo dooth ſoule deſire come vnto thee lord ſhall come appeare face lord ſhall ſee god ſoule longeth verie ſore ſhall ſee land liuing land dead cannot ſeene mortall eies ſhall doo wretch fettered heauie gieues mortalitie ſhall doo while continue bodie wee go aſtraie lord haue abiding place euer labour one come free citie heauen wo thinke dwell among barbarous nation infidel amongſt faithfull iſraelites lead life tent cedar ſoule hath dwelt long hate peace quietneſſe giue wing dooue may flie awaie reſt nothing deſire delight ſo much lord companie good cleaue vnto god oh grant lord whileſt theſe fraile member ſticke vnto thee written cleaueth vnto lord one ſpirit giue therefore beſeech thee wing contemplation wherewith apparelled may flie vpward aſmuch euerie vnluckie infortunate thing lieth beneath doo thou lord hold vp mind leaſt fall headlong loweſt bottom darke vallie leaſt ſhadowe earth ſhould come betweene ſeparate thee art bright ſunne righteouſnes leaſt hid cloud darkneſſe ſhould haue libertie letted looke heauenlie thing aboue therefore doo aſſaie go vpward vnto ioies quietneſſe peace vnto delectable pleaſant ſtate light hold mine hart thine hand bicauſe cannot drawne vnto high thing without thee thither doo make haſte whereas moſt chiefe principall peace reigneth continuall quietneſſe ſhineth foorth hold gouerne ſpirit take according thy thou guide vnto may aſcend region countrie plentifulneſſe wheras thou feedeſt iſrael euerlaſtinglie food truth intent leaſtwiſe ſwift cogitation thought may come nigh thy wiſedome remaineth aboue thing ouerpaſſeth thing gouerneth thing ala manie thing ſoule would flie vnto thee doo crie vpon command lord hold peace ſpeake vnto ſoule ſelfe let giue neuer word anſwer let paſſe thing let clime aboue althings created come vnto thee may faſten eies faith vpon thee art onlie creator thing let couet vnto thee bent towards thee let thinke vpon thee meditation contemplation let laie thee hir eies ſelfe let roll toſſe thee hir hart thee ſaie art true chiefe goodneſſe ioie remaine without ending ſurelie manie contemplation man ſoule maruellouſlie fed thee none ſoule ſo much delighted yet hath ſo good reſt thee thinketh vpon thee hath thee onelie contemplation oh much thy ſweetneſſe lord maruellouſlie dooeſt thou inſpire hart loue thee delectable thy loue fruition whereof haue loue nothing thee ſeeke nothing elſe couet nothing elſe happie whoſe onelie hope thou art haue truſt thee onlie whole worke praier bleſſed ſitteth ſolitarie alone holdeth peace ſtandeth vpon ward ſet keepe continuallie daie night yet whileſt fraile bodie may able taſte ſomewhat thy pleaſures require thee thoſe thy wound bring health vnto v wound thou ſufferedſt vpon croſſe health thy pretious bloud wherewith thou redeemedſt v diſtill drop downe wound ſinful ſoule alſo thou didſt vouchſafe die wound ſaie fire mightie dart thy great charitie word god liuelie effectuous pearcing ſharpe anie two edged ſword thou choſen dart moſt ſharpe ſword art able thy power pearce hard ſhield buckler man hart faſten ſtrike ſhaft thy loue mine hart ſoule may ſaie vnto thee wounded thy charitie ſo foorth ſame wound thy loue teares may flowe moſt plentiouſlie daie night strike lord ſtrike beſeech thee moſt indurated hardened hart mind mine ſharpe dart thy loue pearce deeper deeper innermoſt part thereof thy mightie power ſo bring head aboundance water mine eies verie well teares continuallie running great affect maruellous deſire ſee thy glorie may moorne daie night without taking anie comfort life vntill thy heauenlie wedding chamber may ſee thee welbeloued beautifull ſpouſe god lord ſee thy glorious maruellous beautifull face full ſweetnes togither thou haſt choſen ſaie may worſhip humblie thy maieſtie laſt repleniſhed heauenlie vnſpeakable reioicing euerlaſting gladneſſe may euer crie loue thee ſaieng behold haue long deſired haue obteined ioined heauen vnto whome earth loued ſtrength charitie embraced vnto whome loue ſticke cleaue doo praiſe bleſſe woorſhip liueth reigneth god world without end amen another praier chriſt aſcended reigning glorie oh good chriſt firſt begotten brother tenderharted ioſeph oh naturall sonne father whome made child adoption hope confidence alſo ſhall atteine bleſſed place whither thou art gone take poſſeſſion v oh ſtrong tower defence ſuccour hurt v truſting thee moſt vnhappie ignorant thee moſt happie alwaies behold thee bleſſed haue knowne thee heere day mortalitie bleſſed ſee thee heauens ſhall ſee thee reigning thy father ioies incomparable oh lord onelie ioie comfort ſoules ſhew v thy louing countenance thee open eares may heare thee ſo whatſoeuer wee doo ſpeake thinke may directed vnto thee alone redeemer mediator aduocate amen another thou lord didſt put awaie marie magdalen thee kiſſing thy foot becauſe thy fleſh yet exalted ſhe knewe yet dignitie thy clarified bodie beautified glorie immortalitie addicted onlie thy bodilie preſence yet ſought thee liuing among dead neither knowne hir thou waſt equall thy father wherefore thou wouldeſt ſuffer hir ſo much kiſſe thy foot becauſe thing vnworthie thy maieſtie thou mightie lion tribe iuda thou conqueror hell death euerliuing immortall thou art riſen death v thou art aſcended thy father father ſitteſt right hand glorie grant alſo hart mind may thither aſcend thee continuallie dwell suffer v come neere vnto thee may kiſſe thee yea lord thou louer ſoules come thou rather vnto v kiſſe v kiſſe thy mouth may glad reioice thee drawe v may runne ſauour thy ſweet ointment may behold thee righteouſnes thy glorie ſhall appeare may ſatiſfied taught world followeth vaine pleaſure ſeeketh proſperitie hunteth wealth worſhip eſpeciallie laſt age world doth ſo altogither doteth become ſecure fill thou hart true peace wherewith may ſtaie ſelues combate conſcience fighting iudgment god agony ſeparation ſhall made ſoule bodie giue v grace mindfull thy ſaieng let hart greeued go come againe vnto let thy comfortable preſence depart ſoule thou wilt certainlie come againe euen raiſe v dead place v thy kingdome wherfore reioice thy departure vnto thy father father greater thou thou haſt prepared place bleſſed manſion houſe thy father exalted right hand father haſt reſpect perſon ſent euen till conſummation world ceaſe applie merit thy ſacrifice vnto v make continuall interceſſion v thou abideſt king prieſt vntill thou deliuereſt kingdome deſtruction may pleaſe thee therefore thine ancient accuſtomed mercie goodneſſe giue grace caſt thing euill may fit take receiue thing good thee ſo powre ſowerneſſe ſinne wickedneſſe may filled ſweetneſſe vertue godlineſſe yea doo thou thy ſelfe gratious father euen ſame thy bleſſed finger mightie power wherewith time paſt thy ſonne chriſt jeſus thou didſt rebuke throwe diuels vncleane returne veſſell anie dwell therein beſeech thee furthermore expell foorth veſſell ſpirit world worketh delight vanitie fault ſelfe neuer intiſed deceiued anie therewith hereafter finallie humblie praie thee throwe euill vncleane ſpirits whatſoeuer noiſome enimies ſoule ſaluation grant thy ſpirit god euen holie ghoſt meane fruit gift vertues grace thereof may vouchſafe come enter tabernacle hid world grant may knowe father sonne thee may alwaies beleeue thou art ſpirit ſo worſhip one god trinitie trinitie vnitie whoſe one ſhould periſh conuerted liue manie beleeue sonne ſhould haue behold thou heauenlie comforter giue vnto v teſtimonie grant vnto mind token certaintie beleefe ſo doubt neither wauer thy diuine goodnes towards v make hart quiet ſecure full truſt confidence may approch throne thy heauenlie grace receiuing adoption right child inflamed ſpirituall ioie boldneſſe libertie may crie abba father thou moſt faithfull aduocate ſtrengthen v againſt aſſaults temptation ſathan ſo may neuer doubt thy diuine prouidence predeſtination whereby choſen called chriſt vnto euerlaſting life neuer ſtroken ſeruile feare oppreſſed dreadfull doubtings may rage flee forſake god ſurpaſſing comforter leaue v deſtitute thine aid patronage vouchſafe euermore preſent v croſſes trouble leaſt otherwiſe faint rather make v reioice tribulation knowing crowne life laid vp ſuch loue thou teacher men inſtruct v ought praie according thy may heard make thou interceſſion v ſighes expreſſed thou cleanſer heart giue v ſimplicitie mind without gall bitternes deſcendedſt iordan vpon lord sauiour chriſt likenes dooue may void bitter enuie contention hart haue roote among v bringeth foorth gall woormewood thou ſubſtantiall flame proceeding breaſt father eternall sonne lighten hart fire chaſte burning loue thou appearedſt vpon daie feaſt pentecoſt vnto apoſtles clouen tongs like fire ſee coldneſſe comfort v thy quickening heate breathing may receiue thy chriſme annointment thou gheſt ſoule make thee manſion place within ſecret part heart may houſe thy diuinitie may dwell perpetuallie member neuer depart v lord sauiour ieſus chriſt amen thanksgiuing lift vp hart vnto thee beholder ſearcher mine hart abiect hindmoſt thy ſeruants confeſſe acknowledge thee leaſt member thy church woorſhip thee due ſacrifice praiſe ſo much able according thou haſt vouchſafed endue withall foraſmuch deſtitute outward gift offer vnto thee thoſe vowes praiſe haue gift thy mercie behold willinglie gladlie offer vnto thee vnfeigned faith pure conſcience beleeue therefore hart king heauen lord earth mouth doo confeſſe thee father sonne holie ghoſt three perſons one ſubſtance true verie god almightie one ſimple incorporall inuiſible nature incomprehenſible ſuch nature place nature thou haſt nothing ſuperiour aboue thy ſelfe lower anie thing bigger thy ſelfe manner meanes perfect without ſpot deformitie thou art great without quantitie good without qualitie euerlaſting without time life without death ſtrong without infirmitie weakeneſſe true without lieng preſent euerie place without anie ſituation placed anie place euerie without place fulfilling thing without ſtretching foorth thy hand going euerie without anie contradiction gaineſaieng paſſing ouer thing without mouing abiding thing without anie kind proportion making thing hauing need nothing gouerning thing without labour giuing thing beginning hauing beginning thy ſelfe making thing mutable variable thy ſelfe without kind mutabilitie variableneſſe confeſſe thee greatneſſe without meaſure power almightie goodnes cheefe beſt wiſedome ineſtimable counſelles intent purpoſes terrible fearefull iudgements moſt vpright iuſt cogitation thought moſt ſecret word true work holie mercy aboundant plentifull toward offender moſt patient towards penitent thoſe hartilie ſorie ſinnes moſt gentle louing alwaies ſame euerlaſting continuallie continuing immortall incommutable impoſſible changed altered whome neither amplitude largenes place doth make bigger ſhortneſſe littleneſſe place make leſſer anie place corner conteine preſſe togither neither doth thy intent varie alter familiaritie acquaintance corrupt thee pluralitie god theſe much mo thing haue learned holie mother church whereof thy grace made member hir haue learned thou alone true god haſt bodie alſo art vnſubiect paſſions nothing thy ſubſtance nature anie waie violable changeable compounded created therefore certaine thou canſt neither perceiued anie bodilie eies could euer ſeene proper nature anie mortall man hence may euidentlie gathered angel doo behold thee alſo life ſhall ſee thee naie verie angel neither able ſee thee thou art thy ſelfe naïe conclude almightie trinitie knowne none onlie thy ſelfe bleſſed trinitie thou vnitie godhead pluralitie perſons manifold art number infinite therefore meaſurablie vnmeaſurable waightily vnwaiable knowledge beginning ſouereigne goodneſſe thou art whome whome thing participation thereof ſaie good thing thy diuine eſſence hath alwaies yet without matter although lacke forme wit informed forme formes moſt welformed forme thou imprinteſt ſeale euerie particular thing thou makeſt doubtleſſe differ thy ſelfe without either augmenting diminiſhing whatſoeuer world thy creature ſimple trinitie triple vnitie god whoſe almightineſſe poſſeſſeth ruleth repleniſheth thing thou haſt created neither ſaieng thou filleſt thing meane conteine thee rather thou conteineſt neither part filleſt thou thing yet may thought euerie thing according greatneſſe portion hath receiueth thee greateſt thing ſmalleſt thing leſſe thou rather thing trulie thing thee whoſe omnipotencie includeth thing neither man find waie eſcape thy power whoſoeuer hath thy fauour meanes auoid thy diſpleſure written neither eaſt weſt south god iudge againe whither ſhall go frō thy ſpirit whither ſhall go thy preſence immenſitie thy diuine greatneſſe knowe thee within thing included without thing yet excluded therefore thou art within thou maiſt containe therfore without thing may comprehended within immenſitie thine vncircumſcribed greatneſſe thou art within thou art knowne creator thou art without perceiue thou art gouernour thing leaſt thing created might without thee thou art within without thing may included thee locall greatneſſe thy mightie preſence art eueriewhere preſent thing preſent thee although ſome vnderſtand theſe thing yet ſome doo vnitie thine inſeparable nature haue ſeparable perſons bicauſe thou art trinitie vnitie vnitie trinitie ſo haue ſeparation perſons sometimes indeed thoſe perſons particularlie named ſo thou wouldeſt god trinitie declare thy ſelfe inſeparable perſons name anie one perſon may referred vnto another according rule relation father vnto sonne sonne vnto father ſo hath holie ghoſt true relation vnto father sonne alſo thoſe name ſignifie either ſubſtance god perſon power eſſence elſe properlie called god doo equalliie agree perſons great god almightie eternall generallie thing naturalle ſpoken god name nature ſo maie agree vnto thee god father ſame alſo may fitlie referred vnto sonne holie ghoſt ſaie thou father art naturallie god ſo sonne naturallie god holie ghoſt naturallie yet three god one god naturallie father sonne holie ghoſt therefore god holie trinitie perſons thou art inſeparable ſenſe vnderſtood though ſound haue ſeparable name receiue plurall number nature hereby declared perſons holie trinitie one verie god diuided name euerie perſon reſpecteth alwaie another perſon ſay father point vnto appeare end world thy ſaieng sonne god laſt doting age world greater greeuous miſeries confuſions among men ſhould bee euer alſo thou art defender thy church midſt ſuch calamity crueltie thine enimies wilt preſerue ſome remnant faithfull thy ſeruice vtterlie extinguiſhed end world wherefore oppreſſed intollerable burden miſeries heaped therefore vpon v bicauſe ſins withering world moſt greeuous lamentable eſpeciallie sathan thine enimie ſeeth daie iudgement verie nigh hand wherein abhomination ſhall openlie laid thy choſen creature caſt hedlong eternall torment make extreamelie rage againſt thy choſen flocke ſeeke meanes poſſiblie withdrawe v thee make v blaſpheme thy ſacred maieſtie wee ſtandeth v vpon flie vnto thee humbleneſſe mind theſe extremity whole frame world groaneth alſo thine elect earneſtlie deſireth renewed therefore according thy gratious admonition call mind ſignes ſhall come finall deſtruction world thanke thee thy goodneſſe foretelling v lift vp head vnto thee art aloft right hand eternall father faith praier looke ioifull daie thou wilt appeare moſt gloriouſlie cloud deliuerance thy people theſe calamity gouerne v thy word ſpirit moſt mightie protector wee may bee watchfull ſhun care tranſitorie world withdrawe mind exerciſe godlineſſe choke vertuous motion raiſed thine holie ſpirit flie wantonneſſe belliecheere vnlawfull pleaſures cauſe thy ſpirit forſake mind make body receptacle vnpure ſpirits whereby caried ſecure vnto abhominable wickednes thence vnto euerlaſting deſtruction finallie purge thou hart thy ſpirit let thy knowledge appeare v may expell groſſe darkneſſe inflame v godlie motion day life may continue true ſincere confeſſion thy name ſo much thou haſt promiſed defend v mitigate paine grant wee may eſcape euils come ſtand ioifullie thee thy returne amen another almightie god moſt mercifull heauenlie father deſtruction ieruſalem thou haſt left fearefull example thy horible iudgements againſt contempt goſpell wickedneſſe men threateneſt ſuch plague come like wickedneſſe vpon world ſhall cauſe men die feare come grant v ſo read thy truth obedient vnto ſignes theſe thing ſhall come ſhall aſtoniſh wicked wee may hold vp head comfort waiting redemption ſo neere hand watch continuall praier may eſcape theſe thing ſhall come vpon world daie wee may ſtand thy sonne ſhall come iudgement receiued euerlaſting glorie thee holie ghoſt honour glorie praiſe euer euer amen godlie meditation comming chriſt iudgement reward faithfull vnfaithfull lord ieſu chriſt sonne euerliuing god althings made ruled gouerned thy loue redemption thou diddeſt diſdaine bee mediator take vpon thee nature wombe virgin purelie without ſinne operation holie ghoſt thou mighteſt thine owne perſon woonderfullie beautifie exalt nature worke ſame v alſo firſt aboliſhing guiltineſſe ſinne remiſſion ſinne ſelfe death laſt death raiſing againe theſe body may like vnto thine owne glorious immortall bodie according power wherewith thou art able ſubiect thing vnto thee ſaie thy loue redemption thou becameſt man moſt poore afflicted vpon earth ſpace three thirtie yeeres leaſt moſt humilitie paiedſt price ranſome thy moſt bitter death paſſion moſt hartilie giue thanks thee ſo ſame thy loue towards v thy good time thou wilt come againe cloud heauen power great glorie flaming fire thouſands saint angel thy power mightie crie ſhowt archangell blaſt trumpet ſuddenlie lightening ſhineth eaſt c thinke leaſt euen theefe night men ſleepe thou wilt ſo come ſaie thus ſuddenlie twinkeling eie men euer haue beene ſhall woman child appearing thy tribunall iudgment ſeate render account thing haue thought ſpoken done againſt thy lawe openlie angel saint diuels ſo receiue iuſt reward thy vengeance haue repented obeied thy goſpell ſo depart thee diuell angel wicked euer haue beene ſhall hell fire vnquenchable paine intollerable endleſſe hopeleſſe euen face thy glorious maieſtie mightie power haue repented beleeued thy goſpell found watching like wiſe virgin lamp oile hand found readie apparelled wedding garment innocencie haue hardened hart hourded vp treaſure thy vengeauce daie wrath reuealed haue vſed time grace acceptable time time ſaluation time life thou ſtretcheſt thy hand ſpreadeſt thine armes calling crieng vnto v come vnto thee art meeke hart lowlie thou wilt eaſe labour heauie laden haue viſited ſicke priſoners comforted comfortleſſe fed hungrie cloathed naked lodged harbourleſſe haue loden hart gluttonie ſurfetting carefulneſſe life haue digged hid talent ground dooing good therewith haue faithfull occupie thy gift thy glorie haue waſhed garment thy bloud hartie repentance ſhall angel gather togither wicked ſhall collected fagot caſt fire good wheate gathered thy barne ſhall caught vp meete thee cloud ſhall corruptible bodie put incorruption ſhall indued immortalitie glorie ſhall thee go whither thou goeſt ſhall heare theſe ioifull word come ye bleſſed father poſſeſſe kingdome prepared beginning c ſhall ſet ſeates maieſtie iudging whole world ſhall reigne thee euer ſhall god ſhall enter inherit heauenlie ieruſalem glorious reſtfull land chanaan alwaies daie neuer night maner weeping teares infirmitie hunger cold ſickeneſſe enuie malice ſinne alwaies ioie without ſorowe mirth without meaſure pleaſure without paine heauenlie harmonie moſt pleaſant melodie ſaieng ſinging holie holie holie lord god hoſts c finallie eie hath ſeene eare hath heard neither hath entered hart man ſhall inherit moſt ſurelie enioie although heere bee tormented priſoned burned ſolicited sathan tempted fleſh intangled world wherethrough inforced crie thy kingdome come come lord ieſu c amiable thy tabernacle like hart deſireth water brooke ſo longeth ſoule thee god lord let thy ſeruant depart peace deſire diſſolued chriſt moorne ſoules waiting deliuerance body c oh gratious lord ſhall find ſuch mercie thee may repent beleeue hope looke theſe thing full fruition thoſe heauenlie ioies thou haſt promiſed prepared feare loue thee ſo reſt thee euermore amen 2 peter 3 10 11 12 daie lord come theefe night heauens ſhall paſſe awaie noiſe element ſhall melt heate earth work therein ſhall burnt vp seeing therefore theſe thing muſt diſſolued manner perſons ought yee holie conuerſation good liues looking haſtning vnto comming god heauens beeing fire ſhall diſſolued element ſhall melt heate ¶ godlie praiers vſed vpon euerie saincts daie fall orderlie yeare first 1 saint andrewes daie hart readie god hart readie prepared ſéeke thée followe thy lawe let go wrong thy commandements thanke thee sonne god head keeper thy church gathering thy ſelfe vncleane companie men holie church knit thee true confeſſion righteouſneſſe life manie time didſt thou repeate thy promiſe touching bringing man fallen thy fauour againe continuall preaching thy miniſters haſt giuen v light thereof thou didſt like manner appoint tower ordeine commonwealth moſes middeſt part world inhabited whence might heard mankinde length thou appearedſt fleſh brakeſt band old teſtament entredſt new couenant v calledſt thine holie apoſtle andrew reſt publiſhers witneſſes thy truth gaueſt authoritie preach ſufficient teſtimonie publiſh truth mainteine among v light may giue credit thy miniſters writing voice ſounding heauen may citizen companie builded vpon foundation prophet apoſtles building thou art corner ſtone bearing whole houſe word thy power grant imitating example saint andrew reſt holie doctor apoſtles thy grace readilie obeied calling thy sonne ieſus chriſt followed without delaie alſo called thy holie word may likewiſe foorthwith giue ouer ſelues obedientlie followe thee thy holie commandements ſaid went foorth ſowed ſeed teares ſhall returne ioie giue alſo thy church age euermore faithfull holie teacher may fiſhers men reteine forme ſound doctrine diſpenſe thy myſteries faithfullie gather thy kingdome great company till number thine elect filled net ſhall caſt thy whole church enioie thy viſible bleſſed ſight euermore amen 2 saint thomas daie beléeue lord helpe mine vnbeléefe increaſe faith lothſome darkeneſſe horrible ſtreames diffidence miſtruſt euen elect apoſtle thomas albeit ſenſiblie heard voice sonne god ſeene miracle bare teſtimonie taught preached truth yea albeit mind inwardlie beheld preſence lord yet beleeued reſurrection chriſt principall article faith neither gaue credit ſuch ſeene lord liuing againe doubting thou didſt ſuffer confirmation faith confirme thou v thou didſt confirme thy weake diſciple thomas grant v ſo perfectlie without doubt beleeue thy sonne ieſus chriſt faith thy ſight neuer reproued strengthen frailtie thy liuelie preſence appeare v night humane darkeneſſe doo extinguiſh light v bring thy gift houſes ſhut vp poore cottage great danger reaſon thine enimies speake thou vnto v thy bleſſed voice outwardlie thy word inwardlie thy ſpirit working thy peace within v filled ſenſe thy preſence may reſt coupled thee ſpirit vnto thine eternall father take v vp fraile fallen downe life shew v thy woonders fight conſcience diſpleaſure thine eternall father may remember thy merit laie v miſerable weake one thy ſide wound may hid couered wrath god ſucke thy bodie water waſheth vncleanneſſe liuelie nouriſhment thy bloud may ſtrengthen v euerlaſting life vnbeleeuers number faithfull hart may imitate noble confeſſion thine apoſtle saint thomas againſt blaſphemous ſpirits thine enimies acknowledge thou art lord god euen god beginning hath beene preſent church externallie miniſters inwardlie ſecret working holie ſpirit may euermore defend church againſt rage enimies couenant mankind knitteth faithfull owne fleſh grant sonne god mightie iehoua firmelie may beleeue thy promiſe depend vpon thee hope thine aid againſt hope begin ſaluation thy word reuealed beleeuing thee sauiour art chriſt high prieſt king may find eternall life thee amen 3 saint steeuens daie vvho first martyred shed bloud chriſt crucified gather themſelues togither make v euermore haue mind acknowledge greatneſſe thy loue towards mankinde thou art naturall hen thou begetteſt thy ſelfe congregation egge ſingular ſeed thy firſt promiſe made paradiſe thou gathereſt ſuch beleeue depend thereon vnder thy wing thine interceſſion againſt wrath god conſuming fire thy liuelie heate thou nonriſheſt powring vpon thy ſpirit ſubſtantiall fire flowing breſt thee thine eternall father expelleth coldneſſe nature quickneth ſuch ingraffed thee vnto new life thou encountereſt kite rauening bird raging ſpirits mortall infernall enimies ſafegard thy poore chicken wherefore keepe v humblie praie thee among thy chicken woonderfull entire affection acknowledge thy voice thou calleſt couer themſelues vnder thy wing drawe thy breſt moſt godlie comfort greefe hart
